# copyright_long:       "Source: The Word<br>Rights: Paul W Esposito President, Stauros Ministries PO Box 3004 Cocoa, Fl. 32924 (321) 403-5782<br><br>Welcome to the third edition of  The English Majority Text Version (EMTV) of the Holy Bible. This latest edition has Greek explanatory notes throughout the Bible, to aid the reader in understanding the meanings in some select places of the original Koine Greek. Also, the third edition finds itself closer to the Robinson/Pierpoint printed edition of the Byzantine majority text, rather than the Hodges/Farstad text, which the EMTV was translated from. This is one of the great things about having a Bible that is translated from the majority of the trustworthy Byzantine manuscripts that are in existence—the much greater probability of accuracy. On the other side of the fence, most modern Bibles are translated from a few scant manuscripts (literally), and more often than not they do not even agree with each other. Not so with a Bible that is translated out of the majority! The experts in linguistics who have put these readings together, and diligently compared the manuscripts, had hundreds and hundreds of manuscripts to compare.
40001001	The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ , the Son of David , the Son of Abraham :
40001002	Abraham fathered Isaac , Isaac fathered Jacob , and Jacob fathered Judah and his brothers .
40001003	Judah fathered Perez and Zerah by Tamar , Perez fathered Hezron , and Hezron fathered Ram .
40001004	Ram fathered Amminadab , Amminadab fathered Nahshon , and Nahshon fathered Salmon .
40001005	Salmon fathered Boaz by Rahab , Boaz fathered Obed by Ruth , Obed fathered Jesse ,
40001006	and Jesse fathered David the king . David the king fathered Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah .
40001007	Solomon fathered Rehoboam , Rehoboam fathered Abijah , and Abijah fathered Asa .
40001008	Asa fathered Jehoshaphat , Jehoshaphat fathered Joram , and Joram fathered Uzziah .
40001009	Uzziah fathered Jotham , Jotham fathered Ahaz , and Ahaz fathered Hezekiah .
40001010	Hezekiah fathered Manasseh , Manasseh fathered Amon , and Amon fathered Josiah .
40001011	Josiah fathered Jeconiah and his brothers at the time of the captivity in Babylon .
40001012	And after the captivity in Babylon , Jeconiah fathered Shealtiel , and Shealtiel fathered Zerubbabel .
40001013	Zerubbabel fathered Abiud , Abiud fathered Eliakim , and Eliakim fathered Azor .
40001014	Azor fathered Zadok , Zadok fathered Achim , and Achim fathered Eliud .
40001015	Eliud fathered Eleazar , Eleazar fathered Matthan , and Matthan fathered Jacob .
40001016	And Jacob fathered Joseph the husband of Mary , of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ .
40001017	So all the generations from Abraham till David [ were ] fourteen generations , from David until the captivity in Babylon [ were ] fourteen generations , and from the captivity in Babylon until the Christ [ were ] fourteen generations .
40001018	Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this : After His mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph , before they came together , she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit .
40001019	Then Joseph her husband , being righteous and not wanting to make her a public example , purposed to put her away secretly .
40001020	But while he was thinking about these things , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream , saying , " Joseph , son of David , do not fear to take unto [ you ] Mary your wife , for that which is begotten in her is of the Holy Spirit .
40001021	And she shall bring forth a Son , and you shall call His name JESUS , for He shall save His people from their sins . "
40001022	Now all this came to pass that the thing spoken by the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled , saying ,
40001023	" Behold , the virgin shall be with child , and shall bring forth a Son , and they shall call His name Immanuel , " which is translated , " God with us . "
40001024	Then Joseph , having been aroused from sleep , did as the angel of the Lord had ordered him and took to [ him ] his wife ,
40001025	but did not know her till she brought forth her firstborn Son . And he called His name JESUS .
40002001	Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea , in the days of Herod the king , behold , wise men from the East arrived in Jerusalem ,
40002002	saying , " Where is He who has been born King of the Jews ? For we have seen His star in the East , and have come to worship Him . "
40002003	But when Herod the king heard this , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
40002004	And having gathered together all the chief priests and scribes of the people , he inquired from them where the Christ would be born .
40002005	So they said to him , " In Bethlehem of Judea , for thus it is written by the prophet :
40002006	' But you , Bethlehem , in the land of Judah , are by no means least among the rulers of Judah ; for out of you shall come forth a Ruler who will shepherd My people Israel . ' "
40002007	Then Herod , secretly having called the wise men , ascertained from them the time that the star appeared .
40002008	And having sent them to Bethlehem , he said , " Go and carefully search for the young Child , and as soon as you find [ Him ] , report back to me , so that I also may come and worship Him . "
40002009	When they heard the king , they departed ; and behold , the star which they had seen in the East went before them , till it came and stood over where the young Child was .
40002010	And when they saw the star , they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy .
40002011	And having come into the house , they saw the young Child with Mary His mother , and falling down , they worshipped Him , and opening their treasures , they presented gifts to Him : gold , frankincense , and myrrh .
40002012	And having been divinely instructed in a dream not to return to Herod , they withdrew into their own country by another way .
40002013	Now when they had departed , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream , saying , " Arise , and take along the young Child and His mother , flee to Egypt , and stay there until I tell you ; for Herod is about to seek the young Child to destroy Him . "
40002014	When he arose , he took along the young Child and His mother by night and withdrew into Egypt ,
40002015	and was there until the death of Herod , so that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet , saying , " Out of Egypt I called My Son . "
40002016	Then Herod , seeing that he had been deceived by the wise men , was greatly enraged ; and he sent and executed all the boys in Bethlehem and in all its districts , from two years old and under , according to the time which he had ascertained from the wise men .
40002017	Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet , saying :
40002018	" A voice was heard in Ramah , lamentation and weeping , and great mourning , Rachel weeping for her children , refusing to be comforted , because they are no more . "
40002019	Now after Herod died , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
40002020	saying , " Arise , and take with [ you ] the young Child and His mother , and go into the land of Israel , for those who were seeking the life of the young Child have died . "
40002021	Then he rose and took along the young Child and His mother , and came into the land of Israel .
40002022	But hearing that Archelaus was reigning over Judea instead of his father Herod , he was afraid to go there . And being divinely instructed in a dream , he withdrew into the regions of Galilee .
40002023	And when he arrived , he settled down in a city called Nazareth , so that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets , " He would be called a Nazarene . "
40003001	In those days John the Baptist arrived preaching in the wilderness of Judea ,
40003002	and saying , " Repent , for the kingdom of heaven is at hand ! "
40003003	For this is he who was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah , saying : " A voice of one crying in the wilderness : ' Prepare the way of the LORD ; make His paths straight . ' "
40003004	And John himself had his clothing [ made ] from camel's hair , with a leather belt around his waist ; and his food was locusts and wild honey .
40003005	Then Jerusalem , and all Judea , and all the region around the Jordan were going out to him
40003006	and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan , confessing their sins .
40003007	But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism , he said to them , " Brood of vipers ! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath ?
40003008	Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance ,
40003009	and do not think to say among yourselves , ' We have Abraham as our father . ' For I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham out of these stones .
40003010	But even now , the ax is laid to the root of the trees . Therefore every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire .
40003011	I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance , but He who is coming after me is mightier than I , whose sandals I am not worthy to carry . He will baptize you with [ the ] Holy Spirit ,
40003012	whose winnowing shovel is in His hand , and He will thoroughly purge His threshing floor , and He will gather His wheat into the barn ; but the chaff He will burn up with unquenchable fire . "
40003013	Then Jesus arrived from Galilee to John at the Jordan , to be baptized by him .
40003014	But John [ tried to ] prevent Him , saying , " I have need to be baptized by You , and You are coming to me ? "
40003015	But Jesus answered and said to him , " Permit it now , for thus it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness . " Then he permitted Him .
40003016	And having been baptized , Jesus came up immediately from the water ; and behold , the heavens were opened to Him , and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming upon Him .
40003017	And behold , a voice came out of the heavens , saying , " This is My beloved Son , in whom I have found delight . "
40004001	Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit , to be tempted by the devil .
40004002	And having fasted forty days and forty nights , afterward He was hungry .
40004003	And approaching Him , the tempter said , " If You are the Son of God , speak so that these stones may become bread . "
40004004	But He answered and said , " It is written , ' Man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God . ' "
40004005	Then the devil took Him up into the holy city , and set Him on the pinnacle of the temple ,
40004006	and said to Him , " If You are the Son of God , throw Yourself down . For it is written : ' He shall give His angels orders concerning you , ' and , ' In their hands they will lift you up , lest you dash your foot against a stone . ' "
40004007	Jesus said to him , " Again , it is written , ' You shall not tempt the LORD your God . ' "
40004008	Again , the devil took Him up on a very high mountain , and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world , and their glory .
40004009	And he said to Him , " All these things will I give You , if You will fall down and worship me . "
40004010	Then Jesus said to him , " Get behind Me , Satan ! For it is written , ' You shall worship the LORD your God , and Him alone you shall serve . ' "
40004011	Then the devil left Him , and behold , angels came and ministered to Him .
40004012	Now when Jesus heard that John had been imprisoned , He departed into Galilee .
40004013	And leaving Nazareth behind , He came and settled down in Capernaum , which is by the sea , in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali ,
40004014	so that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet , saying :
40004015	" The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali , by the way of the sea , beyond the Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ,
40004016	the people sitting in darkness have seen a great light , and to those who sat in the land and the shadow of death , light sprang up on them . "
40004017	From that time Jesus began to preach and to say , " Repent , for the kingdom of heaven is at hand . "
40004018	Now as He was walking alongside the Sea of Galilee , He saw two brothers , Simon called Peter , and Andrew his brother , casting a net into the sea ; for they were fishermen .
40004019	Then He said to them , " Come after Me , and I will make you fishers of men . "
40004020	They immediately left their nets and followed Him .
40004021	And having gone forth from there , He saw two other brothers , James the [ son ] of Zebedee , and John his brother , in the boat with Zebedee their father , mending their nets . And He called them .
40004022	And immediately they left the boat and their father , and followed Him .
40004023	And Jesus went about all of Galilee , teaching in their synagogues , preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every disease and every illness among the people .
40004024	And the report of Him went throughout all Syria ; and they brought to Him all those who were ill , and [ who were ] suffering with various diseases and torments , and those who were demon-possessed , epileptics , and paralytics ; and He healed them .
40004025	And large crowds followed Him from Galilee and from Decapolis , and Jerusalem , and Judea , and beyond the Jordan .
40005001	And seeing the crowds , He went up into the mountain , and after He had sat down , His disciples approached Him .
40005002	And opening His mouth , He began to teach them , saying :
40005003	" Blessed [ are ] the poor in spirit , for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005004	Blessed [ are ] those who mourn , for they will be comforted .
40005005	Blessed [ are ] the meek , for they shall inherit the earth .
40005006	Blessed [ are ] those who hunger and thirst after righteousness , for they shall be filled .
40005007	Blessed [ are ] the merciful , for they shall obtain mercy .
40005008	Blessed [ are ] the pure in heart , for they shall see God .
40005009	Blessed [ are ] the peacemakers , for they shall be called sons of God .
40005010	Blessed [ are ] those who have been persecuted for righteousness' sake , for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005011	" Blessed are you whenever they revile you , and they persecute you , and they say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake .
40005012	Rejoice and be exceedingly glad , for great is your reward in heaven , for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you .
40005013	" You are the salt of the earth ; but if the salt becomes tasteless , with what shall it be salted ? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and to be trampled underfoot by men .
40005014	You are the light of the world . A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden .
40005015	Nor do they light a lamp and put it under a basket , but on a lampstand , and it shines on everything in the house .
40005016	Thus let your light shine before men , so that they may see your good works , and they may glorify your Father who is in heaven .
40005017	" Do not think that I came to abolish the Law or the Prophets . I did not come to abolish , but to fulfill .
40005018	For assuredly I say to you , until heaven and earth may pass away , one iota or one tittle shall by no means pass away from the law until all things are fulfilled .
40005019	Whoever therefore shall break one of the least of these commandments , and shall teach men thus , will be called least in the kingdom of heaven ; but whoever does [ them ] and teaches [ them ] , he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
40005020	For I say to you , that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees , you shall by no means enter the kingdom of heaven .
40005021	" You have heard that it was said to the ancients , ' You shall not kill , ' and whoever kills will be liable to the judgment .
40005022	But I say to you that whoever gets angry with his brother without cause will be liable to the judgment . And whoever says to his brother , ' Empty-head ! ' will be liable to the council . But whoever says , ' fool ! ' will be liable to the fiery hell .
40005023	Therefore if you offer your gift on the altar , and there you remember that your brother has something against you ,
40005024	leave your gift there before the altar , and go , first be reconciled with your brother , and then come and offer your gift .
40005025	Make friends with your adversary quickly , while you are on the road with him , lest your adversary hand you over to the judge , and the judge hand you over to the officer , and you be cast into prison .
40005026	Assuredly I say to you , you will by no means get out of there till you have paid the last penny .
40005027	" You have heard that it was said , ' You shall not commit adultery . '
40005028	But I say to you , that whoever looks at a woman in order to lust after her has already committed adultery [ with ] her in his heart .
40005029	If your right eye causes you to stumble , pluck it out and cast it from you ; for it is better for you that one of your members be lost , than for your whole body to be cast into hell .
40005030	And if your right hand causes you to stumble , cut it off and cast it from you ; for it is better for you that one of your members be lost , than for your whole body to be cast into hell .
40005031	" Furthermore it has been said , ' Whoever divorces his wife , let him give her a divorce certificate . '
40005032	" But I say to you that whoever divorces his wife , except for a matter of sexual immorality , makes her commit adultery ; and whoever marries a divorcee commits adultery .
40005033	" Again you have heard that it was said to the ancients , ' You shall not swear falsely , but you shall pay your oaths to the Lord . '
40005034	" But I say to you , do not swear at all : neither by heaven , for it is God's throne ;
40005035	nor by the earth , for it is His footstool ; nor by Jerusalem , for it is the city of the great King .
40005036	Nor shall you swear by your head , because you are not able to make one hair white or black .
40005037	But let your word be ' Yes ' , ' yes , ' ; [ or ] ' No , ' ' no . ' For whatever is more than these is from the evil [ one ] .
40005038	" You have heard that it was said , ' An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth . '
40005039	But I say to you not to resist an evil person . But whoever shall slap you on your right cheek , turn to him the other also .
40005040	And to the [ one ] desiring to sue you and to take your tunic , let him have your cloak also .
40005041	And whoever compels you to go one mile , go with him two .
40005042	Give to the [ one ] asking you , and to the [ one ] desiring to borrow from you , do not turn away .
40005043	" You have heard that it was said , ' You shall love your neighbor , and you shall hate your enemy . '
40005044	But I say to you , love your enemies , bless those who curse you , do good to those who hate you , and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you ,
40005045	so that you may prove to be sons of your Father in heaven ; because He makes His sun rise on the evil and on the good , and He sends rain on the just and on the unjust .
40005046	For if you love those who love you , what reward have you ? Do not even the tax collectors do the same ?
40005047	And if you greet your friends only , what more are you doing [ than others ] ? Do not even the tax collectors do so ?
40005048	You therefore be perfect , just as your Father in heaven is perfect .
40006001	" Take care not to be doing your charitable giving before men , so as to be seen by them . Otherwise , you have not a reward from your Father in heaven .
40006002	Whenever therefore you do charitable giving , do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , so that they may be praised by men . Assuredly I say to you , they receive their reward in full .
40006003	But when you do charitable giving , do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing ,
40006004	so that your charitable giving may be in secret ; and your Father , who sees in secret , will Himself reward you openly .
40006005	" And whenever you pray , you shall not be like the hypocrites , because they love to pray standing in the synagogues , and on the streetcorners , so that they may be seen by men . Assuredly I say to you , that they receive their reward in full .
40006006	But you , whenever you pray , enter into your room , and when you have shut your door , pray to your Father who is in secret ; and your Father , who sees in secret , will reward you openly .
40006007	But when you pray , do not babble like the heathen , for they think that they will be heard for their many words .
40006008	Therefore do not be like them . For your Father knows what things [ ] you have need of before you ask Him .
40006009	Therefore pray in this manner : Our Father in heaven , hallowed be Your name .
40006010	Your kingdom come , Your will be done , on earth as [ it is ] in heaven .
40006011	Give us this day our daily bread .
40006012	And forgive us our debts , as we forgive our debtors .
40006013	And lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from the evil [ one ] . For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever . Amen .
40006014	" For if you forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly Father will also forgive you .
40006015	But if you do not forgive men their trespasses , neither will your Father forgive your trespasses .
40006016	" Moreover , when you fast , do not become gloomy , like the hypocrites , for they disfigure their faces that they may appear to men [ to be ] fasting . Assuredly I say to you , that they receive their reward in full .
40006017	But you , when you fast , anoint your head and wash your face ,
40006018	so that you do not appear to men [ to be ] fasting , but to your Father in secret ; and your Father , who sees in secret , will reward you .
40006019	" Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on the earth , where moth and rust corrupt , and where thieves dig through and steal ;
40006020	but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust corrupts , and where thieves do not dig through and steal .
40006021	For where your treasure is , there your heart will be also .
40006022	" The lamp of the body is the eye . If therefore your eye is sound , your whole body will be full of light .
40006023	But if your eye is evil , your whole body will be dark . If therefore the light that is in you is darkness , how great is that darkness !
40006024	" No one is able to serve two masters ; for either he will hate the one , and he will love the other , or else he will be devoted to the one , and he will despise the other . You cannot serve God and money .
40006025	" Because of this I say to you , do not worry [ about ] your life - what you shall eat , or what you shall drink - nor [ about ] your body , what you shall put on . Is not life more than food and the body [ more than ] clothing ?
40006026	Look at the birds of the air , for they neither sow nor reap , nor do they gather into barns ; yet your heavenly Father feeds them . Are you not worth more than they ?
40006027	Which of you by worrying is able to add one cubit to his stature ?
40006028	So why do you worry about clothes ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow ; they neither labor , nor spin ;
40006029	and yet I say to you , that not even Solomon in all his glory was arrayed like one of these .
40006030	But if God thus clothes the grass of the field , which exists today , and tomorrow is cast into the oven , [ will He ] not much more [ clothe ] you , [ O you ] of little faith ?
40006031	Therefore do not worry , saying , ' What shall we eat ? ' or ' What shall we drink ? ' or ' What shall we put on ? '
40006032	" For after all these things the Gentiles seek . For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things .
40006033	But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness , and all these things shall be added to you .
40006034	Therefore do not worry about tomorrow , for tomorrow will worry about its own affairs . Each day has enough trouble of its own .
40007001	" Judge not , lest you be judged .
40007002	For with what judgment you judge , you will be judged ; and with what measure you measure , it will be measured [ back ] to you .
40007003	And why do you look at the speck in your brother's eye , but do not notice the plank in your own eye ?
40007004	Or how will you say to your brother , ' Permit me to remove the speck from your eye ' ; and look , [ there is ] a plank in your own eye ?
40007005	Hypocrite ! First remove the plank out of your own eye , and then you will see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother's eye .
40007006	Do not give what is holy to the dogs ; nor cast your pearls before swine , lest they trample them under their feet , and turn and tear you in pieces .
40007007	" Ask , and it shall be given to you ; seek , and you shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened to you .
40007008	For everyone that asks receives , and he that seeks finds , and to him that knocks , it shall be opened .
40007009	Or what man is there among you who , if his son should ask for bread , will give to him a stone ?
40007010	And if he should ask for a fish , he will give to him a serpent ?
40007011	If you then , being evil , know how to give good gifts to your children , by how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him !
40007012	Therefore , whatever you want men to do to you , thus also you do to them , for this is the Law and the Prophets .
40007013	" Enter in through the narrow gate ; because wide is the gate , and broad is the way which leads to destruction , and many are those who enter in through it .
40007014	How narrow the gate , and confined the way which leads to life , and there are few who find it !
40007015	" But beware of false prophets , who come to you in sheep's clothing , but inwardly they are ravenous wolves .
40007016	You will know them by their fruits . Do men gather grape clusters from thorns , or figs from thistles ?
40007017	Thus every good tree produces good fruit , but a rotten tree produces evil fruit .
40007018	A good tree cannot produce evil fruit , nor can a rotten tree produce good fruit .
40007019	Every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire .
40007020	Consequently , by their fruits you shall know them .
40007021	" Not everyone who says to Me , ' Lord , Lord , ' will enter the kingdom of heaven , but he who does the will of My Father who is in heaven .
40007022	Many will say to Me in that day , ' Lord , Lord , did we not prophesy in Your name , and in Your name we cast out demons , and in Your name we did many mighty works ? '
40007023	" And then I will confess to them , ' I never knew you ! Depart from Me , you who work iniquity ! '
40007024	" Therefore , everyone who hears these words of Mine and does them , I will compare him to a wise man who built his house upon the rock :
40007025	and the rain came down , and the floods came , and the winds blew and fell against that house ; and it did not fall , for it had been founded upon the rock .
40007026	And everyone who hears these words of Mine and does not do them , will be compared to a foolish man who built his house on the sand :
40007027	and the rain came down , and the floods came , and the winds blew and beat on that house ; and it fell . And its fall was great . "
40007028	And so it was , when Jesus finished these words , the crowds were astonished at His teaching ,
40007029	for He taught them as one having authority , and not like the scribes .
40008001	When He had come down from the mountain , great crowds followed Him .
40008002	And behold , a leper came and worshipped Him , saying , " Lord , if You are willing , You can make me clean . "
40008003	And reaching out His hand , Jesus touched him , saying , " I am willing ; be cleansed . " Immediately his leprosy was cleansed .
40008004	And Jesus said to him , " See that you tell no one ; but go , show yourself to the priest , and offer the gift which Moses commanded , as a testimony to them . "
40008005	Now when He had entered Capernaum , a centurion approached Him , begging Him ,
40008006	and saying , " Lord , my servant has been laid up in the house a paralytic , being tormented terribly . "
40008007	And Jesus said to him , " I will come and heal him . "
40008008	The centurion answered and said , " Lord , I am not worthy that You should come under my roof . But just say the word and my servant will be healed .
40008009	For I also am a man under authority , having soldiers under me . And I say to this [ one ] , ' Go , ' and he goes ; and to another , ' Come , ' and he comes ; and to my servant , ' Do this , ' and he does it . "
40008010	When Jesus heard it , He marveled , and said to those who were following , " Assuredly , I say to you , I have not found such great faith , not even in Israel !
40008011	And I say to you that many shall come from east and west , and recline [ to eat ] with Abraham , Isaac , and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven ;
40008012	but the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into outer darkness . There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth . "
40008013	Then Jesus said to the centurion , " Go ; and as you believed , may it be unto you . " And his servant was healed that same hour .
40008014	Now when Jesus had come into Peter's house , He saw his wife's mother having been laid up , and burning with fever .
40008015	And He touched her hand , and the fever left her ; and she got up , and began to serve Him .
40008016	When evening had come , they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed . And He cast out the spirits with a word , and He healed all that were ill ,
40008017	so that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet , saying : " He Himself took our infirmities , and bore our diseases . "
40008018	And when Jesus saw great crowds around Him , He gave orders to depart to the other side .
40008019	Then a certain scribe approached , and said to Him , " Teacher , I will follow You wherever You go . "
40008020	And Jesus said to him , " Foxes have dens , and birds of the air have nests , but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head . "
40008021	Then another of His disciples said to Him , " Lord , permit me first to go and bury my father . "
40008022	But Jesus said to him , " Follow Me , and leave the dead to bury their own dead . "
40008023	Now when He got into a boat , His disciples followed Him .

40010020	for you are not the [ ones ] speaking , but the Spirit of your Father who is speaking in you .

40010025	It is enough for a disciple that he become like his teacher , and the servant like his master . If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub , how much more will they call his household members !
40010026	Therefore do not fear them . For nothing is concealed that shall not be unveiled , and secret that shall not be made known .
40010027	" What I say to you in the dark , say in the light ; and what you hear in the ear , proclaim on the housetops .

40010036	and ' a man's enemies [ will be ] his own household members . '

40013004	And as he sowed , some seed fell alongside the road ; and the birds came and devoured them .
40013005	But others fell on the stony ground , where it did not have much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth .
40013006	But when the sun rose , it was scorched , and because it had no root , it withered away .
40013007	But others fell among thorns , and the thorns sprang up and choked them out .
40013008	But others fell on good ground and it was yielding fruit : some a hundred [ fold ] , some sixty , some thirty .

40013010	And the disciples approached and said to Him , " Why do You speak to them in parables ? "

40013013	Therefore I speak to them in parables , because seeing they do not see , and hearing they do not hear , nor do they understand .
40013014	And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah , which says : ' Hearing you shall hear and by no means understand , and seeing you shall see and by no means perceive .
40013015	For the heart of this people has become dull , and their ears are hard of hearing , and their eyes have closed , lest they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , lest they should understand with their hearts and turn back , that I should heal them . '

40013018	" Therefore hear the parable of the sower :
40013019	When anyone hears the word of the kingdom , and does not understand , then the evil [ one ] comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart . This is the [ seed ] being sown beside the road .
40013020	But the [ seed ] sown on stony ground , is he who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy ;
40013021	yet he has no root in himself , but is short-lived . For when tribulation or persecution comes because of the word , immediately he falls away .

40013024	Another parable He set before them , saying : " The kingdom of heaven is like a man sowing good seed in his field .

40013026	But when the stalk had sprouted and produced fruit , then the tares also appeared .

40013029	" But he said , ' No , lest gathering up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them .
40013030	Leave both to grow together until the harvest ; and at the time of harvest I will say to the reapers , " First gather together the tares , and bind them into bundles to burn them , but gather together the wheat into my barn . " ' "
40013031	Another parable He set before them , saying : " The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed , which a man took and sowed in his field ,

40013046	who , when he found one very precious pearl , went and sold everything he had and bought it . "

40021033	" Hear another parable : There was a certain landowner who planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it , dug a winepress in it and built a tower . And he leased it to farmers and went on a journey .

41003021	But when His relatives heard , they came out to seize Him , for they were saying , " He has lost His mind . "
41003022	And the scribes who were from Jerusalem came down and were saying , " He has Beelzebul , " and , " By the ruler of the demons He casts out demons . "
41003023	And having summoned them , he began to say to them in parables : " How can Satan cast out Satan ?
41003024	And if a kingdom is divided against itself , that kingdom is not able to stand .
41003025	And if a household is divided against itself , that household is not able to stand .
41003026	And if Satan has risen up against himself and has become divided , he is not able to stand , but is finished .
41003027	No one can enter a strong man's house and plunder his possessions , unless he first binds the strong man , and then he may plunder his house .
41003028	" Assuredly I say to you , all sins will be forgiven the sons of men , also blasphemies , as many as they may blaspheme ;
41003029	but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness , but is under sentence of eternal condemnation " -
41003030	because they were saying , " He has an unclean spirit . "
41003031	Then His brothers and His mother came , and as they stood outside they sent to Him , calling for Him .
41003032	And a crowd was sitting around Him ; and they said to Him , " Look , Your mother and Your brothers and Your sisters are seeking You outside . "
41003033	But He answered them , saying , " Who is My mother , or My brothers ? "
41003034	And when He had looked around in a circle at those sitting around Him , He said , " Here are My mother and My brothers !
41003035	For whoever does the will of God is My brother and My sister and mother . "
41004001	And again He began to teach beside the sea . And a large crowd was gathered to Him , so that He got aboard into the boat , and sat on the sea ; and all the crowd was upon the land by the sea .
41004002	And He was teaching them many [ things ] by parables , and said to them in His teaching :
41004003	" Listen ! Behold , a sower went out to sow .
41004004	And it happened , as he sowed , that some [ seed ] fell alongside the road ; and the birds came and devoured it .
41004005	And some fell on stony ground , where it did not have much earth ; and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of earth .
41004006	But when the sun rose it was scorched , and because it had no root it was withered up .
41004007	And some [ seed ] fell into the thorns ; and the thorns came up and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
41004008	But other [ seed ] fell on good ground , and it was yielding fruit coming up and growing , and it was producing - some thirty [ fold ] , some sixty [ , ] and some a hundred . "
41004009	And He said , " He that has ears to hear , let him hear ! "
41004010	But when He was by himself , those around Him together with the twelve asked Him about the parable .
41004011	And He said to them , " Unto you it has been given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God ; but to those who are outside , all things come to be [ spoken ] in parables ,
41004012	so that ' Seeing they may see and not perceive , and hearing they may hear and not understand ; Lest they should turn , and their sins be forgiven them . ' "
41004013	And He said to them , " Do you not know this parable ? How then will you know all the parables ?
41004014	The sower sows the word .
41004015	And these are the [ seeds ] beside the road where the word is sown , and whenever they hear , immediately Satan comes and takes away the word which was sown in their hearts .
41004016	And these are similarly the [ seeds ] being sown on stony ground which , whenever they hear the word , immediately they receive it with joy ;
41004017	and they have no root in themselves , but are shortlived . Afterward , when trials or persecution arise because of the word , immediately they fall away .
41004018	And these are the [ seeds ] being sown in the thorns ; they are the [ ones ] who are hearing the word ,
41004019	and the anxieties of this age , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the desires for other things coming in choke out the word , and it becomes fruitless .
41004020	And these are the [ seeds ] sown on good ground , such as who hear the word and welcome it , and bear fruit : some thirty [ fold ] , some sixty , and some a hundred . "
41004021	And He said to them , " A lamp is not brought so that it may be put under a measuring basket or under a bed , [ is it ? ] [ Is it ] not [ brought ] so that it may be put on a lampstand ?
41004022	For there is nothing hidden which shall not be made manifest , nor was it hidden but that it might come to light .
41004023	If anyone has ears to hear , let him hear . "
41004024	Then He said to them , " Watch what you hear . By what measure you measure , it will be measured out to you ; and [ more ] will be added to you who hear .
41004025	For whoever has , [ more ] will be given to him ; and he who does not have , even what he has will be taken away from him . "
41004026	And He said , " Thus is the kingdom of God as if a man should cast the seed on the ground ,
41004027	and should sleep by night and rise by day , and the seed should sprout and should grow , he himself does not know how .
41004028	For the earth produces fruit of itself : first a shoot , then a head of grain , then full wheat in the head of grain .
41004029	But whenever the fruit permits , immediately he sends forth the sickle , because the harvest has come . "
41004030	Then He said , " To what shall we compare the kingdom of God ? Or by what sort of parable shall we illustrate it ?
41004031	It is like a mustard seed , which whenever it is sown on the ground , is smaller than all the seeds on the earth ;
41004032	but whenever it is sown , it comes up and becomes greater than all the garden vegetables , and produces great branches , so that the birds of heaven are able to nest under its shade . "
41004033	And by many such parables He would speak the word to them , just as they were able to hear it .

41007001	Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes gathered together to Him , having come from Jerusalem .
41007002	Now when they saw some of His disciples eat bread with ceremonially unclean , that is , with unwashed [ hands ] , they found fault .
41007003	For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands with [ their ] fist , holding the tradition of the elders .

41014005	For it was possible [ for ] this to be sold for more than three hundred denarii , and to be given to the poor . " And they were scolding her .

41014007	For you always have the poor with you , and whenever you wish you are able to do them good ; but you do not always have Me .
41014008	This [ woman ] did what she could ; she undertook beforehand to anoint My body for burial .
41014009	And assuredly I say to you , wherever this gospel is proclaimed in the whole world , what this woman did will also be spoken as a memorial of her . "
41014010	Then Judas Iscariot , one of the twelve , went off to the chief priests to betray Him to them .
41014011	And having heard , they rejoiced and promised to give him money . So he was seeking how at some good time he might deliver Him up .
41014012	Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread , when the Passover lamb was sacrificed , His disciples said to Him , " Where do You desire that we go and prepare , that You may eat the Passover ? "
41014013	And He sent two of His disciples and said to them , " Go into the city , and a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water ; follow him .
41014014	And wherever he may enter , say to the master of the house , ' The Teacher says , " Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples ? " '
41014015	" Then he will show you a large upper room , furnished and ready ; there prepare for us . "
41014016	So His disciples went away , and came into the city , and found it just as He had said to them ; and they prepared the Passover .
41014017	And when it was evening , He came with the twelve .
41014018	And while they were reclining and eating , Jesus said , " Assuredly , I say to you , one of you eating with Me will betray Me . "
41014019	And they began to be sorrowful , and to say to Him one by one , " [ Is it ] I ? " And another said , " [ Is it ] I ? "
41014020	But answering He said to them , " [ It is ] one of the twelve , the [ one ] dipping with Me in the bowl .
41014021	The Son of Man indeed is going away just as it is written of Him , but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is betrayed ! It would have been better for that man not to have been born . "
41014022	And as they were eating , Jesus took bread , blessed and broke it , and gave it to them and said , " Take , eat ; this is My body . "
41014023	And taking the cup and giving thanks , He gave it to them , and they all drank from it .
41014024	And He said to them , " This is My blood of the new covenant , which is shed for many .
41014025	Assuredly I say to you , I will no longer drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God . "
41014026	And having sung hymns , they went out to the Mount of Olives .

41014028	" But after I am raised , I will go before you into Galilee . "
41014029	But Peter said to Him , " Even if all will be made to stumble , yet not I . "
41014030	Jesus said to him , " Assuredly I say to you , that you , today on this night , before the rooster crows twice , you will deny Me three times . "
41014031	But he kept saying all the more profusely , " If it is necessary for me to die with You , by no means will I deny You ! " And they all said likewise .
41014032	And they came to a place which was named Gethsemane ; and He said to His disciples , " Sit here while I pray . "
41014033	And He took Peter , James , and John with Him , and He began to be greatly amazed , and deeply depressed .
41014034	Then He said to them , " My soul is deeply grieved to the point of death . Remain here and watch . "
41014035	And having gone forward a little , He fell on the ground , and He was praying , that if it were possible , the hour might pass from Him .
41014036	And He said , " Abba , Father , all things are possible to You . Take this cup away from Me ; nevertheless , not what I will , but what You [ will ] . "
41014037	Then He came and found them sleeping , and He said to Peter , " Simon , are you sleeping ? Were you not strong [ enough ] to watch one hour ?
41014038	Watch and pray , lest you enter into temptation . Indeed the spirit is eager , but the flesh is weak . "
41014039	And He went away again and He prayed , saying the same thing .
41014040	And having returned , He found them sleeping again , for their eyes were heavy ; and they did not know what they should answer Him .
41014041	Then He came the third time and said to them , " Sleep on now , and take your rest . It is enough ! The hour has come . Behold , the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners .
41014042	Rise up , let us go . See , the [ one ] who betrays Me is at hand . "
41014043	And immediately , while He was still speaking , Judas arrived , being one of the twelve , and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs , [ sent ] from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders .
41014044	Now His betrayer had given to them a sign , saying , " Whomever I shall kiss , He is [ the One ] ; take Him and lead [ Him ] away safely . "
41014045	And when he arrived , immediately he approached Him and said to Him , " Rabbi , Rabbi ! " and he affectionately kissed Him .
41014046	Then they laid their hands on Him and seized Him .
41014047	But a certain one of those standing by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest , and cut off his ear .
41014048	Then Jesus answered and said to them , " Have you come out , as against a bandit , with swords and clubs to arrest Me ?
41014049	Daily I was with you in the temple teaching , and you did not seize Me . But that the Scriptures may be fulfilled . "
41014050	Then they all forsook Him and fled .
41014051	Now a certain young man had followed Him , having a linen cloth thrown around his naked body . And the young men seized him ,
41014052	but leaving behind the linen cloth , he fled from them naked .
41014053	And they led Jesus away to the high priest ; and with him were assembled all the chief priests , the elders , and the scribes .
41014054	But Peter followed Him from a distance , right into the courtyard of the high priest , and he was sitting together with the attendants and warming himself at the fire .
41014055	Now the chief priests and the whole council were seeking testimony against Jesus , in order to put Him to death , but found none .
41014056	For many were testifying falsely against Him , but their testimonies were not the same .
41014057	Then some stood up and were testifying falsely against Him , saying ,

41014059	But not even in this way was their testimony the same .
41014060	And the high priest stood up and came forward and questioned Jesus , saying , " Do You answer nothing ? What are these men testifying against You ? "
41014061	But He kept silent and answered nothing . Again the high priest was questioning Him , saying to Him , " Are You the Christ , the Son of the Blessed ? "
41014062	And Jesus said , " I am . And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power , and coming with the clouds of heaven . "
41014063	Then the high priest tore his clothes and said , " What further need do we have of witnesses ?

41014068	But he denied it , saying , " I neither know nor understand what you are saying . " And he went outside into the forecourt , and a rooster crowed .

41014070	But again he was denying [ it ] . And a little later those who were standing by said to Peter again , " Truly you are one of them ; for you are also a Galilean , and your accent is like [ theirs ] . "
41014071	Then he began to curse and to swear , " I do not know this Man whom you are speaking of "
41014072	And for the second [ time ] a rooster crowed . Then Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said to him , " Before a rooster crows twice , you will deny Me three times . " And when he thought about it , he began to weep .
41015001	Immediately , in the morning , the chief priests held a consultation , along with the elders and scribes and the whole Sanhedrin ; and having bound Jesus , they led [ Him ] away , and delivered [ Him ] to Pilate .
41015002	Then Pilate asked Him , " Are You the King of the Jews ? " And He answered and said to him , " You are saying [ what is so ] . "
41015003	And the chief priests were accusing Him of many things .
41015004	Then Pilate questioned Him again , saying , " Do You answer nothing ? See how many things they testify against You ! "
41015005	But Jesus no longer answered anything , so that Pilate marveled .
41015006	Now at the feast he would release one prisoner to them , whomever they would request .
41015007	And there was one called Barabbas , having been bound with his fellow rebels , who had committed murder in the rebellion .
41015008	Then the crowd cried out and began to request [ that ] just as always he would do [ this ] for them .
41015009	But Pilate answered them , saying , " Do you desire that I release to you the King of the Jews ? "
41015010	For he knew that because of envy the chief priests had delivered Him up .
41015011	But the chief priests stirred up the crowd , so that he should rather release Barabbas to them .
41015012	But Pilate answered and said to them again , " What then do you desire [ that ] I should do [ with Him ] whom you call King of the Jews ? "

41015014	But Pilate said to them , " Why , what evil did He do ? " But they cried out all the more , " Crucify Him ! "
41015015	So Pilate , wanting to gratify the crowd , released Barabbas to them ; and he delivered up Jesus , after he had Him flogged , so that He might be crucified .
41015016	Then the soldiers led Him away into the courtyard , which is the Praetorium , and assembled the whole garrison .
41015017	And they clothed Him with purple ; and they twisted a crown of thorns , and they put it around His head ,
41015018	and they began to salute Him , " Hail , King of the Jews ! "
41015019	And they were striking His head with a reed and were spitting on Him ; and bowing the knee , they [ mockingly ] worshipped Him .
41015020	And when they had mocked Him , they stripped Him of the purple , and dressed Him in His own clothing . And led Him out so that they might crucify Him .
41015021	And they pressed into service a certain [ man ] [ that was ] passing by [ named ] Simon , a Cyrenian , the father of Alexander and Rufus , as he was coming from the country , that he might carry His cross .
41015022	And they brought Him to the place [ called ] Golgotha , which is translated , Place of a Skull .
41015023	And they gave Him wine mingled with myrrh to drink , but He did not take it .
41015024	And having crucified Him , they divided His clothes by casting lots over them , [ to determine ] who would take what .
41015025	Now it was the third hour , and they crucified Him .
41015026	And there was the inscription of His charge having been inscribed : THE KING OF THE JEWS .
41015027	And together with Him they crucified two bandits , one on His right side and the one on His left .
41015028	So the Scripture was fulfilled which says , " And He was numbered with the transgressors . "
41015029	And those passing by were blaspheming Him , shaking their heads and saying , " Aha ! You who destroy the temple and build it in three days ,
41015030	save Yourself , and come down from the cross ! "

41015032	Let the Christ , the King of Israel , come down now from the cross , so that we may see and believe Him . " Even those who were crucified with Him were reviling Him .
41015033	Now when the sixth hour had come , darkness came upon the whole land until the ninth hour .
41015034	And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice , saying , " Eloi , Eloi , lima sabachthani ? " which is translated , " My God , My God , why have You forsaken Me ? "
41015035	Some of those standing by when they heard , said , " Look , He is calling Elijah . "
41015036	And one , running and having filled a sponge [ with ] vinegar , and having put it around a reed , was giving a drink to Him , saying , " Leave Him alone ; let us see if Elijah is coming to take Him down . "

41015038	Then the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom .
41015039	Now when the centurion who stood across from Him saw that He cried out like this and breathed His last , he said , " Truly this Man was the Son of God ! "
41015040	There were also women looking on from a distance , among whom were both Mary Magdalene , Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joses , and Salome ,
41015041	who also would follow Him and would minister to Him when He was in Galilee ; and many other women who had come up together with Him to Jerusalem .
41015042	And now evening having come , since it was Preparation Day , which is the day before the Sabbath ,
41015043	Joseph of Arimathea , a prominent council member , who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God , coming and taking courage , he went in to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus .
41015044	And Pilate wondered if He was already dead ; and having summoned the centurion , he questioned him if He had been dead long .
41015045	And when he found out from the centurion , he granted the body to Joseph .
41015046	And having bought linen cloth , and having taken Him down , he wrapped Him in the linen cloth and set Him down in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock , and rolled a stone upon the door of the tomb .
41015047	And Mary Magdalene and Mary [ the mother ] of Joses were observing where He was placed .
41016001	Now when the Sabbath was past , Mary Magdalene , and Mary [ the mother ] of James , and Salome bought spices , so that they might come and anoint Him .
41016002	And very early on the first day of the week , they came to the tomb when the sun had risen .
41016003	And they said to one another , " Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us ? "
41016004	And having looked up , they saw that the stone had been rolled away - for it was exceedingly large .
41016005	And entering into the tomb , they saw a young man sitting on the right clothed with a white robe , and they were alarmed .

41016018	they shall pick up serpents ; and if they drink anything deadly , it shall by no means hurt them ; they shall lay hands on [ the ] sick , and they shall be well . "
41016019	So then , after the Lord had spoken to them , He was taken up into heaven , and sat down at the right hand of God .
41016020	And they went out and preached everywhere , the Lord working with [ them ] and confirming the word through the accompanying signs . Amen .
42001001	Since many have attempted to arrange a narrative about the matters which have taken place among us ,
42001002	just as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word delivered [ them ] to us ,
42001003	it seemed good to me also , having followed up accurately all things from above , to write to you in orderly fashion , most distinguished Theophilus ,
42001004	so that you may know the certainty of those things in which you were instructed .
42001005	There was in the days of Herod , the king of Judea , a certain priest named Zacharias , of the division of Abijah . His wife was of the daughters of Aaron , and her name was Elizabeth .
42001006	And they were both righteous before God , walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless .
42001007	But they had no children , because Elizabeth was barren , and they were both well advanced in years .
42001008	So it was , that while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division ,
42001009	according to the custom of the priesthood , he was selected to burn incense when he entered into the temple of the Lord .
42001010	And all the multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense .
42001011	Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him , standing on the right side of the altar of incense .
42001012	And when Zacharias saw him , he was troubled , and fear fell upon him .
42001013	But the angel said to him , " Do not be afraid , Zacharias , because your prayer has been heard ; and your wife Elizabeth will bear a son to you , and you shall call his name John .
42001014	And you will have joy and gladness , and many will rejoice at his birth .
42001015	For he shall be great before the Lord , and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink . He will also be filled with the Holy Spirit , while still in his mother's womb .
42001016	And he will turn many of the sons of Israel to the Lord their God .
42001017	And he himself will go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah , ' to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children , ' and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous , to make ready a people prepared for the Lord . "
42001018	And Zacharias said to the angel , " How shall I know this ? For I am an old man , and my wife is well advanced in years . "
42001019	And the angel answered and said to him , " I am Gabriel , who stands before God , and I was sent to speak to you and to proclaim the good news to you of these things [ . ]
42001020	But behold , you shall be silent and not able to speak until the day these things take place , because you did not believe my words which shall be fulfilled in their season . "
42001021	And the people waited for Zacharias , and they marveled at his delaying in the temple .
42001022	But having come out , he was unable to speak to them ; and they recognized that he had seen a vision in the temple , for he was making signs to them and remained speechless .
42001023	And it happened , as soon as the days of his service were fulfilled , that he went away to his house .
42001024	Now after those days Elizabeth his wife conceived ; and stayed in seclusion five months , saying ,
42001025	" Thus the Lord has dealt with me , in the days when He looked on [ me ] , to take away my reproach among men . "
42001026	Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth ,
42001027	to a virgin betrothed to a man named Joseph , of the house of David . The virgin's name [ was ] Mary .
42001028	And the angel came to her and said , " Greetings , O favored [ one ] , the Lord is with you ; blessed [ are ] you among women ! "
42001029	But when she saw [ him ] , she was greatly perplexed by his saying , and she wondered what sort of greeting this was .
42001030	Then the angel said to her , " Fear not , Mary , for you have found grace with God .
42001031	And behold , you shall conceive in your womb and bring forth a Son , and you shall call His name JESUS .
42001032	He shall be great , and shall be called the Son of the Most High ; and the Lord God shall give Him the throne of His father David .
42001033	And He shall reign over the house of Jacob forever , and of His kingdom there shall be no end . "
42001034	Then Mary said to the angel , " How can this be , since I do not know a man ? "
42001035	And the angel answered and said to her , " The Holy Spirit shall come upon you , and the power of the Most High shall overshadow you ; therefore , also , that Holy Baby which is to be born shall be called the Son of God .
42001036	And behold , Elizabeth your relative has also conceived a son in her old age ; and this is now the sixth month for she who was called barren .
42001037	For with God nothing shall be impossible . "
42001038	Then Mary said , " Behold the maidservant of the Lord ! May it be to me according to your word . " And the angel departed from her .
42001039	Now Mary rose up in those days and traveled into the hill country with haste , to a city of Judah ,
42001040	and entered the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth .
42001041	And it came to pass , that when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary , that the baby leaped in her womb ; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit .
42001042	Then she spoke out with a loud voice and said , " Blessed are you among women , and blessed is the fruit of your womb !
42001043	And why am I favored thus , that the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
42001044	For behold , as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears , the baby leaped for joy in my womb .
42001045	And blessed is she who has believed , because there shall be a fulfillment to the things having been spoken to her from the Lord . "
42001046	And Mary said : " My soul magnifies the Lord ,
42001047	and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior .
42001048	Because He looked upon the lowly state of His maidservant ; for behold , henceforth all generations will call me blessed .
42001049	For He that is mighty has done great things for me , and holy is His name .
42001050	And His mercy is on those who fear Him from generation to generation .
42001051	He has shown strength with His arm ; He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts .
42001052	He has overthrown the mighty from their thrones , and exalted the lowly .
42001053	He has filled the hungry with good things , and the rich He has sent away empty .
42001054	He has helped His servant Israel , in remembrance of His mercy ,
42001055	As He spoke to our fathers , to Abraham and to his seed forever . "
42001056	And Mary remained with her about three months , and she returned to her house .
42001057	Now Elizabeth's full time came for her to be delivered , and she bore a son .
42001058	And when her neighbors and relatives heard how the Lord had shown great mercy to her , they rejoiced with her .
42001059	Now it came to pass on the eighth day , [ that ] they came to circumcise the child ; and they started to call him by the name of his father , Zacharias .
42001060	His mother answered and said , " No ; he shall be called John . "
42001061	But they said to her , " There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name . "
42001062	So they made signs to his father about what he wished him to be called .
42001063	And asking for a writing tablet , he wrote , saying , " His name is John . " And they all marveled .
42001064	Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed , and he started to speak , praising God .
42001065	Then fear came on all who lived around them ; and all these things were being talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea .
42001066	And all those who heard them kept them in their hearts , saying , " What kind of child will this be ? " And the hand of the Lord was with him .
42001067	Now his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit , and he prophesied , saying ,
42001068	" Blessed be the Lord God of Israel , for He has visited and redeemed His people ,
42001069	and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of His servant David ,
42001070	as He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets , who have been since the world began ,
42001071	that we should be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us ,
42001072	to perform the mercy [ promised ] to our fathers and to remember His holy covenant ,
42001073	the oath which He swore to our father Abraham :
42001074	to grant us that we , being delivered from the hand of our enemies , might serve Him without fear ,
42001075	in holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life .
42001076	" And you , child , will be called the prophet of the Highest ; for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways ,
42001077	to give knowledge of salvation to His people by the remission of their sins ,
42001078	through the tender mercy of our God , with which the Dayspring from on high has visited us ;
42001079	to give light to them that sit in darkness and [ in ] the shadow of death , to guide our feet into the way of peace . "
42001080	So the child grew and became strong in spirit , and was in the deserts till the day of his manifestation to Israel .
42002001	And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that a census be taken of all the empire .
42002002	This census [ was ] the first [ one ] while Quirinius was governing Syria .
42002003	And all were traveling to be registered , each to his own city .
42002004	Joseph also went up from Galilee , out of the city of Nazareth , into Judea , to the city of David , which is called Bethlehem , because he was of the house and family of David ,
42002005	to be registered with Mary , his betrothed wife , who was pregnant .
42002006	So it was , that while they were there , the days were completed [ for ] her to bear .
42002007	And she bore her firstborn Son , and wrapped Him in swaddling cloths , and laid Him in a manger , because there was no place for them in the inn .
42002008	And shepherds were in the same country , living in the fields and keeping watch over their flock by night .
42002009	And behold , an angel of the Lord stood before them , and the glory of the Lord shone around them , and they were greatly afraid .

42002019	But Mary treasured all these things and pondered [ them ] in her heart .

42002021	And when eight days were completed , so they could circumcise Him , His name was called JESUS , the [ name ] given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb .

42007023	And blessed is he who is not offended because of Me . "
42007024	Now when John's messengers had departed , He began to speak to the crowds concerning John : " What have you gone out into the wilderness to see ? A reed shaken by the wind ?
42007025	But what have you gone out to see ? A man clothed in soft garments ? Indeed those who are gorgeously appareled and live in luxury are in royal [ palaces ] .
42007026	But what have you gone out to see ? A prophet ? Yes , I say to you , and much more than a prophet .
42007027	This is he about whom it is written : ' Behold , I send My messenger before Your face , who will prepare Your way before You . '
42007028	" For I say to you , among those born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist ; but he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater [ than ] he . "
42007029	And when all the people heard Him , even the tax collectors justified God , having been baptized with the baptism of John .
42007030	But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God for themselves , because they had not been baptized by him .
42007031	" Therefore to what shall I compare the men of this generation , and what are they like ?
42007032	They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling to one another , saying : ' We played the flute for you , and you did not dance ; we mourned for you , and you did not weep . '
42007033	" For John the Baptist has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine , and you say , ' He has a demon . '
42007034	The Son of Man has come eating and drinking , and you say , ' Look , a glutton and a drunkard , a friend of tax collectors and sinners ! '
42007035	And so wisdom is justified by all her children . "
42007036	Then one of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him . And entering into the Pharisee's house , He reclined [ to eat ] .
42007037	And behold , a woman in the city who was a sinner , when she found out that He was reclining in the Pharisee's house , brought an alabaster flask of perfume ,
42007038	and standing by His feet behind Him weeping ; and she began to wash His feet with her tears , and was wiping [ them ] with the hair of her head ; and she was kissing His feet and anointing [ them ] with the perfume .
42007039	Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this , he spoke within himself , saying , " This [ Man ] , if He were a prophet , would know who and what sort of woman [ this is ] who touches Him , for she is a sinner . "
42007040	And Jesus answered and said to him , " Simon , I have something to say to you . " And he said , " Teacher , say it . "
42007041	There was a certain creditor who had two debtors . One owed five hundred denarii , and the other [ owed ] fifty .
42007042	And when they had nothing with which to pay back , he freely forgave them both . Tell [ Me ] , therefore , which of them will love him more ? "
42007043	Simon answered and said , " I suppose [ it is the one ] to whom he forgave more . " And He said to him , " You have judged correctly . "
42007044	And turning to the woman , He said to Simon , " Do you see this woman ? I entered into your house ; you gave Me no water for My feet , but this [ woman ] has washed My feet with her tears and wiped them with the hair of her head .
42007045	You gave Me no kiss , but this [ woman ] has not stopped kissing My feet since the time I came in .
42007046	You did not anoint My head with oil , but this [ woman ] has anointed My feet with perfume .
42007047	For which reason I say to you , her many sins have been forgiven , because she loved much . But to whom little is forgiven , the same loves little . "
42007048	Then He said to her , " Your sins are forgiven . "
42007049	And those who were reclining at the table with Him began to say within themselves , " Who is this who even forgives sins ? "
42007050	Then He said to the woman , " Your faith has saved you . Go in peace . "
42008001	Now it came to pass afterward , that He was traveling through every city and village , preaching and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom of God , and the twelve were with Him ,
42008002	and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities ; Mary called Magdalene , from whom seven demons had gone out ,
42008003	and Joanna the wife of Chuza , a supervisor of Herod , and Susanna , and many others who were ministering to them from their belongings .
42008004	And when a large crowd had gathered , and the [ people ] came to Him from every city , He spoke by a parable :
42008005	A sower went out to sow his seed . And as he sowed , some fell alongside the road ; and it was trampled down , and the birds of the air devoured it .
42008006	And other [ seed ] fell on rock ; and when it grew up , it withered away because it had no moisture .
42008007	And other [ seed ] fell among thorns , and when the thorns grew up with it , they choked it .
42008008	But other [ seed ] fell into good ground , and when it grew up , it produced fruit a hundredfold . " Saying these things He was calling out , " He who has ears to hear , let him hear ! "
42008009	Then His disciples asked Him , saying , " What does this parable mean ? "
42008010	And He said , " To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God , but to the rest [ they are ] in parables , that ' Seeing they may not see , and hearing they may not understand . '
42008011	" Now this is the parable : The seed is the word of God .
42008012	And those beside the road are they that hear ; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts , lest they believe and be saved .
42008013	But those on the rock are they that , whenever they hear , receive the word with joy ; and these have no root , who believe for a while and in time of testing fall away .
42008014	And that which fell among thorns , these are those , who when they heard , go out and are choked with anxieties , riches , and pleasures of life , and bring no fruit to maturity .
42008015	But that which fell on the good ground , these are such who when they heard the word , with a noble and good heart , hold on to it and bear fruit with endurance .
42008016	" No one , when he has lit a lamp , covers it with a vessel or puts [ it ] under a bed , but sets it on a lampstand , so that those who enter may see the light .
42008017	For there is nothing hidden which will not become manifest , nor anything concealed which will not be known and come to light .
42008018	Therefore take heed how you hear . For whoever has , [ more ] shall be given to him ; and whoever does not have , even what he thinks he has shall be taken away from him . "
42008019	Then His mother and brothers came to Him , and could not approach Him because of the crowd .
42008020	And it was told Him by some , who said , " Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside , desiring to see You . "
42008021	But He answered and said to them , " My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it . "
42008022	Now it came to pass on a certain day , that He got into a boat with His disciples . And He said to them , " Let us go across to the other side of the lake . " And they put out to sea .
42008023	But as they sailed , He fell asleep . And a windstorm came down onto the lake , and they were being filled [ with water ] , and were in danger .
42008024	And they came to Him and awoke Him , saying , " Master , Master , we are perishing ! " Then He arose and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water . And they ceased , and there was a calm .
42008025	But He said to them , " Where is your faith ? " But becoming afraid , they marveled , saying to one another , " Who then is this ? For He commands both the winds and the water , and they obey Him ! "
42008026	Then they sailed to the region of the Gadarenes , which is opposite Galilee .
42008027	And when He got out on the land , there met Him a certain man from the city who had demons for a long time . And he wore no clothes , nor did he live in a house , but among the tombs .
42008028	And seeing Jesus and crying out , he fell down before Him , and with a loud voice he said , " What have I to do with You , Jesus , Son of the Most High God ? I beg You , do not torment me ! "
42008029	For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out from the man . For it had seized him at times , and he was bound , kept under guard , with chains and shackles ; and he broke the bonds and was driven by the demon into the wilderness .
42008030	Jesus asked him , saying , " What is your name ? " And he said , " Legion , " because many demons had entered into him .
42008031	And he kept imploring Him that He would not command them to go out into the abyss .
42008032	Now there was a herd of many swine feeding there on the mountain . And they kept imploring Him that He would permit them to enter them . And He permitted them .
42008033	Then when the demons came out from the man , they entered into the swine , and the herd ran violently down the steep bank into the lake and drowned .
42008034	And when those who fed [ them ] saw what had happened , they fled and reported [ it ] in the city and in the country .
42008035	Then they went out to see what had happened , and they came to Jesus , and found the man from whom the demons had come out [ of ] , sitting at the feet of Jesus , clothed and being of sound mind . And they were afraid .
42008036	And those also who saw reported to them how the demon-possessed man was healed .
42008037	Then the whole multitude from the surrounding region of the Gadarenes asked Him to go away from them , because they were gripped with great fear . And He got into the boat and returned .
42008038	Now the man from whom the demons had come out was begging Him that he might be with Him . But Jesus sent him away , saying ,
42008039	" Return to your house , and tell what great things God has done for you . " And he departed , proclaiming throughout the whole city all the things that Jesus did for him .
42008040	So it was , when Jesus returned , that the crowd welcomed Him , for they were all waiting for Him .
42008041	And behold , there came a man named Jairus , and he was a leader of the synagogue . And falling at the feet of Jesus , he was imploring Him to enter into his house ,
42008042	for he had an only daughter about twelve years of age , and she was dying . But as He was going , the crowds were pressing against Him .
42008043	Now a woman , having a flow of blood for twelve years , who though she had spent [ her ] whole livelihood on physicians , was not able to be healed by anyone ,
42008044	approaching from behind , touched the hem of His garment . And immediately her flow of blood stopped .
42008045	And Jesus said , " Who touched Me ? " When all denied it , Peter and those with him said , " Master , the crowds are pressing You hard and crowding You , and You say , ' Who touched Me ? '
42008046	But Jesus said , " Someone touched Me , for I perceived that power has gone out from Me . "
42008047	Now when the woman saw that she was not hidden , she came trembling ; and falling down before Him , she recounted to Him before all the people the reason why she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately .
42008048	And He said to her , " Take courage , daughter , your faith has healed you . Go in peace . "
42008049	While He was still speaking , someone came from the ruler of the synagogue's house , saying to him , " Your daughter has died . Do not trouble the Teacher . "
42008050	But when Jesus heard it , He answered him , saying , " Do not be afraid ; only believe , and she will be healed . "
42008051	When He came into the house , He permitted no one to enter except Peter , John , and James , and the father and mother of the child .
42008052	Now all were weeping and mourning for her ; but He said , " Do not weep ; she is not dead , but asleep . "
42008053	And they were ridiculing Him , knowing that she had died .
42008054	But He sent them all outside , and having grasped her hand , He called , saying , " Child , arise . "
42008055	Then her spirit returned , and she arose immediately . And He commanded [ something ] to be given to her to eat .
42008056	And her parents were amazed , but He charged them to tell no one what had happened .
42009001	And having called together the twelve , He gave them power and authority over all demons , and to heal diseases .
42009002	And He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick .

42009006	As they went out , they were going about village by village , preaching the gospel and healing everywhere .
42009007	Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all the things [ ] being done by Him ; and he was perplexed , because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead ,
42009008	and by others that Elijah had appeared , and by others that one of the ancient prophets had arisen .

42010001	Now after these things the Lord appointed seventy others also , and He sent them two by two before His face into every city and place where He Himself was about to come .

42011020	But if I cast out demons by the finger of God , then the kingdom of God has come upon you .
42011021	When a strong man , fully armed , guards his own palace , his possessions are in peace .
