43019036	For these things were done that the Scripture should be fulfilled , " Not a bone of His shall be broken . "
43019037	And again another Scripture says , " They shall look at [ Him ] whom they pierced . "
43019038	After these things [ , ] Joseph of Arimathea , being a disciple of Jesus , but secretly , for fear of the Jews , asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus ; and Pilate gave him permission . So he came and took away the body of Jesus .
43019039	And Nicodemus , who at first came to Jesus by night , also came , bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes , about a hundred pounds .
43019040	Then they took the body of Jesus , and bound it in linen strips with the spices , as the custom of the Jews is to bury .
43019041	Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden , and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had yet been buried .
43019042	So there they laid Jesus , because of the Jews' Preparation Day , because the tomb was near .
43020001	On the first day of the week Mary Magdalene went to the tomb early , while it was still dark , and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb .
43020002	Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter , and to the other disciple , whom Jesus loved , and said to them , " They have taken the Lord out of the tomb , and we do not know where they have laid Him . "
43020003	Peter therefore went out , and the other disciple , and were going to the tomb .
43020004	And the two together were running , and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first .
43020005	And stooping to look in , he saw the linen strips lying there ; however he did not go in .
43020006	Then Simon Peter came , following him , and entered into the tomb ; and he saw the linen strips lying there ,
43020007	and the facecloth which had been on His head , not lying with the linen strips , but apart from [ them , ] having been rolled up in one place .
43020008	Then the other disciple , who came to the tomb first , went in also ; and he saw and believed .
43020009	For as yet they did not know the Scripture , that He must rise again from the dead .
43020010	Then the disciples went away again to their own homes .
43020011	But Mary stood outside facing the tomb weeping . Therefore as she was weeping , she stooped down [ and ] [ looked ] into the tomb .
43020012	And she saw two angels in white sitting , one at the head and the other at the feet , where the body of Jesus had lain .
43020013	Then they said to her , " Woman , why are you weeping ? " She said to them , " Because they have taken away my Lord , and I do not know where they put Him . "
43020014	And having said these things , she turned back and saw Jesus standing there , and did not know that it was Jesus .
43020015	Jesus said to her , " Woman , why are you weeping ? Whom do you seek ? " She , supposing Him to be the gardener , said to Him , " Sir , if You carried Him away , tell me where You put Him , and I will take Him away . "
43020016	Jesus said to her , " Mary ! " She turned and said to Him , " Rabboni ! " ( which means , Teacher ) .
43020017	Jesus said to her , " Do not cling to Me , for I have not yet ascended to My Father ; but go to My brothers and say to them , ' I am ascending to My Father and your Father , and to My God and your God . ' "
43020018	Mary Magdalene went reporting to the disciples that she had seen the Lord , and [ that ] He had spoken these things to her .
43020019	Then , the same day at evening , being the first day of the week , when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled , for fear of the Jews , Jesus came and stood in the midst , and said to them , " Peace to you . "
43020020	And having said this , He showed them His hands and His side . Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord .
43020021	Therefore Jesus said to them again , " Peace to you ! Just as the Father has sent Me , I also send you . "
43020022	And when He had said this , He breathed on them , and said to them , " Receive the Holy Spirit .
43020023	If you forgive the sins of any , they are forgiven them ; if you retain [ the sins ] of any , they have been retained . "
43020024	But Thomas , one of the twelve , the [ one ] called the Twin , was not with them when Jesus came .
43020025	The other disciples therefore said to him , " We have seen the Lord . " So he said to them , " Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails , and put my finger into the print of the nails , and put my hand into His side , I will by no means believe . "
43020026	And after eight days His disciples were again inside , and Thomas with them . Jesus came , the doors having been closed , and stood in the midst , and said , " Peace to you ! "
43020027	Then He said to Thomas , " Bring your finger here , and see My hands ; and bring your hand here , and put [ it ] into My side . Be not unbelieving , but believing . "
43020028	And Thomas answered and said to Him , " My Lord and my God ! "
43020029	Jesus said to him , " Because you have seen Me , you have believed . Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed . "
43020030	And truly Jesus did many other signs in the presence of His disciples , which are not written in this book ;
43020031	but these have been written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ , the Son of God , and that [ by ] believing you may have life in His name .
43021001	After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias , and in this manner He showed Himself :
43021002	Simon Peter , Thomas called the Twin , Nathanael of Cana in Galilee , the [ sons ] of Zebedee , and two others of His disciples were together .
43021003	Simon Peter said to them , " I am going fishing . " They said to him , " We are coming with you also . " They went out and immediately got into the boat , and that night they caught nothing .
43021004	But as daybreak had already come , Jesus stood upon the shore ; however the disciples did not know that it was Jesus .
43021005	Then Jesus said to them , " Children , have you any food ? " They answered Him , " No . "
43021006	And He said to them , " Cast the net on the right side of the boat , and you will find [ some ] . " Therefore they cast , and they were not able to haul it in because of the multitude of fish .
43021007	Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter , " It is the Lord ! " Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord , he put on his outer garment ( for he had removed it ) , and he threw himself into the sea .
43021008	But the other disciples came in the little boat ( for they were not far from the land , but about two hundred cubits ) , dragging the net with fish .
43021009	Then as they got off onto the land , they saw a charcoal fire laid there , and fish placed on it , and bread .
43021010	Jesus said to them , " Bring [ some ] of the fish which you have just caught . "
43021011	Simon Peter went up and hauled the net onto the land , full of large fish , one hundred and fifty-three ; and although there were so many , the net was not torn .
43021012	Jesus said to them , " Come , eat breakfast . " Yet none of the disciples dared to question Him , " Who are You ? " - knowing that it was the Lord .
43021013	Jesus then came and took the bread and gave it to them , and likewise the fish .
43021014	This [ was ] now the third time Jesus was manifested to His disciples , having been raised from the dead .
43021015	So when they had eaten breakfast , Jesus said to Simon Peter , " Simon , [ son ] of Jonah , do you love Me more than these ? " He said to Him , " Yes , Lord ; You know that I care for You . " He said to him , " Feed My lambs . "
43021016	He said to him again a second time , " Simon , [ son ] of Jonah , do you love Me ? " He said to Him , " Yes , Lord ; You know that I care for You . " He said to him , " Shepherd My sheep . "
43021017	He said to him the third time , " Simon , [ son ] of Jonah , do you care for Me ? " Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time , " Do you care for Me ? " And he said to Him , " Lord , You know all things ; You know that I care for You . " Jesus said to him , " Feed My sheep .
43021018	Most assuredly I say to you , when you were younger , you used to dress yourself and used to walk where you wished ; but when you are old , you will stretch out your hands , and another will dress you and will carry [ you ] where you do not wish . "
43021019	But this He said , signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God . And when He had spoken this , He said to him , " Follow Me . "
43021020	Then Peter , turning around , saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following , who also had reclined on His chest at the supper , and said , " Lord , who is the one who betrays You ? "
43021021	Peter , seeing him , said to Jesus , " But Lord , what [ about ] this [ man ] ? "
43021022	Jesus said to him , " If I will that he remain till I come , what is [ that ] to you ? You follow Me . "
43021023	Therefore this saying went out among the brothers that this disciple would not die . Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die , but , " If I will that he remain till I come , what is [ that ] to you ? "
43021024	This is the disciple who testifies of these things , and wrote these things ; and we know that his testimony is true .
43021025	And there are also many other things which Jesus did , which if they were written one by one , I suppose that not even the world itself would have room for the books which would be written . Amen .
44001001	The former account I made concerning all things , O Theophilus , which Jesus began both to do and teach ,

44002001	And when the day of Pentecost had fully come , they were all with one accord in one place .

44003001	Now Peter and John were going up together to the temple at the hour of prayer , [ which was ] the ninth [ hour ] .

44005021	And when they heard that , they entered the temple about daybreak and were teaching . Now when the high priest and those with him arrived , they called together the council , even all the elders of the sons of Israel , and sent to the prison for them to be brought .
44005022	But when the attendants arrived , and did not find them in the jail , they returned and announced ,
44005023	saying , " Indeed we found the prison shut in all security , and the guards standing before the doors ; but when we opened them , we found no one [ inside ] ! "
44005024	Now when they heard these words , both the high priest and the captain of the temple , and the chief priests , they were greatly perplexed about them , as to what would come of this .
44005025	So one came and reported to them , [ saying ] , " Behold , the men whom you put in jail are standing in the temple and teaching the people ! "
44005026	Then the captain went with the officers and brought them without violence , for they were afraid of the people , lest they be stoned .
44005027	And they brought them , and set them before the council . And the high priest asked them ,
44005028	saying , " Did we not give you strict orders not to continue teaching in this name ? And behold , you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching , and you want to bring on us the blood of this Man ! "
44005029	But Peter and the apostles answered , and said : " We must obey God rather than men .
44005030	The God of our fathers raised up Jesus , whom you murdered by hanging upon a cross .
44005031	Him God has exalted to His right hand as Prince and Savior , to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins .
44005032	And we are His witnesses of these words , and so also is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey Him . "
44005033	But when they heard this , they were infuriated and were resolving to kill them .
44005034	Then someone in the council stood up , a Pharisee named Gamaliel , a teacher of the law held in honor by all the people , and commanded them to put the apostles outside for a short time .
44005035	And he said to them : " Men of Israel , take heed to yourselves to these men , as to what you are about to do .
44005036	For before these days , Theudas rose up , claiming himself to be someone , to whom was joined a number of men , about four hundred . He was slain , and all who obeyed him were scattered and came to nothing .
44005037	After this arose Judas the Galilean , in the days of the census , and caused considerable number of people after him to revolt . He too perished , and as many as were persuaded by him were scattered .
44005038	And now I say to you , keep away from these men and let them alone ; for if the counsel or this work is of men , it will come to nothing ;
44005039	but if it is of God , you cannot overthrow it - lest you even be found fighting against God . "
44005040	And they were persuaded by him , and when they called the apostles and beaten them , they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus , and released them .
44005041	Then they departed from the presence of the council , rejoicing because they were counted worthy to be dishonored on behalf of the name of Jesus .
44005042	And daily in the temple , and from house to house , they did not cease teaching and proclaiming the gospel of Jesus the Christ .
44006001	Now in those days , as the disciples were increasing in number , there arose a complaint from the Greek speaking Jews against the Aramaic speaking Jews , because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution .
44006002	Then the twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said , " It is not pleasing to us that we should forsake the word of God to serve tables .
44006003	Therefore , brothers , select seven men from among you , of good reputation , full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom , whom we may appoint for this need .
44006004	But we will faithfully engage in prayer and in the ministry of the word . "
44006005	And the word was pleasing before all the congregation , and they chose Stephen , a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit , and Philip , Prochorus , Nicanor , Timon , Parmenas , and Nicolas , a proselyte from Antioch ,
44006006	whom they set before the apostles ; and when they had prayed , they laid their hands on them .
44006007	And the word of God was growing , and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem was being multiplied exceedingly , and a great many of the priests were obeying the faith .
44006008	And Stephen , full of faith and power , was performing great wonders and signs among the people .
44006009	But there arose some men from what was called the Synagogue of the Freedmen , both of the Cyrenians and the Alexandrians , and of those from Cilicia and Asia , debating with Stephen .
44006010	And they were not able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit with which he spoke .
44006011	Then they secretly instigated men to say , " We have heard him speaking blasphemous words against Moses and God . "
44006012	And they aroused the people and the elders and the scribes ; and coming upon him , they seized him , and led him to the council .
44006013	And they put forward false witnesses saying , " This man does not cease to speak blasphemous words against this holy place and the law ;
44006014	for we have heard him say that this Nazarene , Jesus , will destroy this place and change the customs which Moses handed down to us . "
44006015	And looking intently at him , all those who sat in the council saw that his face was like [ ] the face of an angel .
44007001	Then the high priest said , " Are these things so ? "
44007002	And he said , " Men , brothers and fathers , listen : The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia , before he dwelt in Haran ,
44007003	and said to him , ' Go out from your land and from your relatives , and come to a land which I will show you . '
44007004	Then he went forth from the land of the Chaldeans and settled down in Haran . And from there , after his father was dead , He moved him to this land in which you now dwell .
44007005	And He gave him no inheritance in it , not even a place to put his foot on , and He promised to give it to him for a possession , and to his descendants after him , though he had no child .
44007006	But God spoke in this way : that his offspring would dwell in a foreign land , and that they would enslave them , and they would treat them badly four hundred years .
44007007	' And the nation which they will serve , I will judge , ' said God , ' and after these things they will come out and serve Me in this place . '
44007008	Then He gave him the covenant of circumcision ; and so Abraham fathered Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day ; and Isaac fathered Jacob , and Jacob fathered the twelve patriarchs .
44007009	" And the patriarchs , being jealous of Joseph , sold him into Egypt ; and God was with him ,
44007010	and delivered him out of all his afflictions , and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh , king of Egypt ; and he made him ruler over Egypt and all his house .
44007011	And a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan , and great affliction , and our fathers could find no provisions .
44007012	And Jacob , hearing that there was grain in Egypt , he sent out our fathers first .
44007013	And the second [ visit ] Joseph was made known to his brothers , and Joseph's family became known to Pharaoh .
44007014	Then Joseph sent and summoned his father Jacob and all his relatives , seventy-five people .
44007015	So Jacob went down to Egypt ; and he died , he and our fathers .
44007016	And they were brought back to Shechem , and were placed in the tomb which Abraham bought for a price of silver from the sons of Hamor , the father of Shechem .
44007017	Now when the time of the promise drew near which God swore to Abraham , the people increased and multiplied in Egypt ,
44007018	until there arose a different king , who did not know Joseph .
44007019	This [ king ] took advantage of our race , and oppressed our fathers , to make their babies exposed , in order that they might not preserve their lives .
44007020	At this time Moses was born , and he was well pleasing to God ; who was brought up in his father's house for three months .
44007021	But when he was exposed , the daughter of Pharaoh took him up , and brought him up for herself as a son .
44007022	And Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and he was mighty in words and deeds .
44007023	Now when he had turned forty years old , it came into his heart to look upon his brothers , the sons of Israel .
44007024	And seeing someone being wronged , he retaliated , and avenged him who was being oppressed , and struck the Egyptian .
44007025	For he supposed that his brothers understood that God was giving to them deliverance by his hand , but they did not understand .
44007026	And on the next day he appeared to them as they were fighting , and [ tried to ] reconcile them to peace , saying , ' Men , you are brothers ; why do you wrong one another ? '
44007027	" But the one wronging his neighbor pushed him away , saying , ' Who appointed you a ruler and a judge over us ?
44007028	' Do you desire to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday ? '
44007029	Now Moses , at this saying , fled and became a stranger in the land of Midian , where he fathered two sons .
44007030	And forty years having been fulfilled , an Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire in a bush , in the wilderness of Mount Sinai .
44007031	And Moses , seeing it , marveled at the sight ; and as he approached it to observe closely , the voice of the Lord came to him ,
44007032	saying , ' I am the God of your fathers - the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob . ' And Moses was trembling and was not bold enough to look closely .
44007033	' Then the LORD said to him , " Remove your sandals from your feet , for the place where you stand is holy ground .
44007034	" I have certainly seen the mistreatment of My people in Egypt ; I have heard their groaning and I have come down to deliver them . And now come , I will send you to Egypt . " '
44007035	This Moses whom they denied , saying , ' Who appointed you a ruler and a judge ? ' This man God sent as a ruler and redeemer by the hand of the Angel who appeared to him in the bush .
44007036	He led them out , and did wonders and signs in the land of Egypt , and at the Red Sea , and in the wilderness forty years .
44007037	" This is that Moses who said to the sons of Israel , ' The LORD our God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your brothers .
44007038	This is he who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the Angel who was speaking to him on Mount Sinai , and [ with ] our fathers , the one who received the living oracles to give to us ,
44007039	whom our fathers did not desire to be obedient , but they rejected [ him ] and returned in their heart back to Egypt ,
44007040	saying to Aaron , ' Make for us gods who will go before us ; as for this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt , we do not know what has happened to him . '
44007041	And they made a calf in those days , offered a sacrifice to the idol , and were rejoicing in the works of their hands .
44007042	But God turned away and gave them over to serve the host of heaven , just as it is written in the book of the Prophets : ' Did you offer Me slaughtered animals and sacrifices during forty years in the wilderness , O house of Israel ?
44007043	Indeed you carried up the tabernacle of Moloch , and the star of your god Remphan , the images which you made to worship them ; and I will relocate you beyond Babylon . '
44007044	" The tabernacle of the testimony was with our fathers in the wilderness , just as the One speaking to Moses commanded him , to make it according to the pattern that he had seen ,
44007045	which also our fathers , having received in turn , also brought in with Joshua into the possession of the Gentiles , whom God drove out before the face of our fathers until the days of David ,
44007046	who found favor before God and asked [ opportunity ] to find a dwelling place for the God of Jacob .
44007047	But Solomon built Him a house .
44007048	However , the Most High does not dwell in hand-made sanctuaries , just as the prophet says :
44007049	' Heaven is My throne , and [ the ] earth is My footstool . What kind of house will you build for Me ? says the LORD , or what is the place of My rest ?
44007050	Did not My hand make all these things ? '
44007051	" You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears ! You always resist the Holy Spirit ; as your fathers did , you also do .
44007052	Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute ? And they killed those who foretold about the coming of the Righteous One , of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers ,
44007053	who have received the law as [ the ] ordinances of angels and you did not keep it . "
44007054	Now hearing these things they were infuriated in their hearts , and were gnashing their teeth at him .
44007055	But being full of the Holy Spirit , looking intently into heaven , he saw the glory of God , and Jesus standing at the right hand of God ,
44007056	and he said , " Behold ! I see the heavens opened , and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God ! "
44007057	Then they cried out with a loud voice , covered their ears , and ran at him with one purpose ;
44007058	and casting him outside the city , they stoned him . And the witnesses laid down their clothes beside the feet of a young man named Saul .
44007059	And they stoned Stephen as he was calling on God and saying , " Lord Jesus , receive my spirit . "
44007060	Then he knelt down and cried out with a loud voice , " Lord , do not charge them with this sin . " And having said this , he fell asleep . "
44008001	Now Saul was agreeing with them in his murder . And in that day there arose a great persecution against the church which was in Jerusalem ; and they all were scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria , except the apostles .
44008002	And godly men buried Stephen , and they mourned deeply for him .
44008003	But Saul was doing injury to the church , going in from house to house , and dragging away both men and women , and putting them in prison .
44008004	Therefore those who were scattered went about preaching the good news of the word .
44008005	And Philip , going down to a city of Samaria , was preaching to them the Christ .
44008006	And the crowds with one accord gave heed to the things spoken by Philip , hearing and seeing the signs which he was doing .
44008007	For many of those having unclean spirits [ had ] cried out with a loud voice , [ and the spirits ] came out ; and many who were paralyzed and lame were healed .
44008008	And there was great joy in that city .
44008009	Now a certain man named Simon was previously in the city practicing magic and astounding the people of Samaria , claiming himself to be someone great ,
44008010	to whom they gave heed , from the least to the greatest , saying , " This man is the great power of God . "
44008011	But they gave heed to him because of the long time that he had astonished them with the magic arts .
44008012	But when they believed Philip as he preached the good news of the things concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ , they were baptized , both men and women .

44008014	Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God , they sent to them Peter and John ,
44008015	who , coming down , prayed concerning them in order that they might receive the Holy Spirit .

44008020	But Peter said to him , " Your money perish with you , because you thought to acquire the gift of God through money !
44008021	You have neither part nor portion in this word , for your heart is not right before God .
44008022	Repent therefore from this your wickedness , and make petition to God , if perhaps the intent of your heart will be forgiven you .
44008023	For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of unrighteousness . "
44008024	Then Simon answered and said , " Pray to the Lord for me , that none of the things which you have spoken may come upon me . "

44008026	Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip , saying , " Get up and go toward the south on the road which goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza . " This is desolate .
44008027	So he got up and went ; and behold , a man of Ethiopia , a eunuch , a court official of Candace the queen of the Ethiopians , who was over all her treasury , and had come to Jerusalem worshipping ,
44008028	and he was returning . And sitting upon his chariot , he was reading the prophet Isaiah .
44008029	Then the Spirit said to Philip , " Go near , and join yourself to this chariot . "
44008030	And Phillip , running up to it , heard him reading the prophet Isaiah , and said , " Do you understand what you are reading ? "
44008031	And he said , " How can I , unless someone helps me ? " And he urged Philip to come up and sit with him .
44008032	Now the portion of the Scripture which he was reading was this : " He was led as a sheep to the slaughter ; and as a lamb before its shearer is silent , thus He opened not His mouth .
44008033	In His humiliation His justice was taken away , and who will recount His generation ? For His life is taken away from the earth . "

44008035	And Philip , opening his mouth , and beginning from this Scripture , preached the good news [ about ] Jesus to him .
44008036	Now as they were going down the road , they came upon some water . And the eunuch said , " Behold , [ here is ] water : what prevents me from being baptized ? "
44008038	And he ordered the chariot to stop , and they both went down into the water , both Phillip and the eunuch , and he baptized him .
44008039	Now when they came up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord caught up Philip , and the eunuch did not see him any longer ; and he went on his way rejoicing .
44008040	But Philip was found at Azotus . And as he passed through , he preached the gospel to all the cities until he came to Caesarea .
44009001	Then Saul , still breathing murderous threats against the disciples of the Lord , went to the high priest
44009002	and requested from him letters [ of authority ] to the synagogues of Damascus , that if he should find any who were of the Way , both men or women , he might bring them , having been bound , to Jerusalem .
44009003	And as he was going , it came about that he drew near to Damascus , and suddenly a light shone around him from heaven .

44010001	Now there was a certain man in Caesarea named Cornelius , a centurion of what was called the Italian [ Regiment ] ,
44010002	a devout [ man ] , and one that feared God , together with all his household , who often gave alms to the people , and making petition to God always .

44011002	And when Peter came up to Jerusalem , those of the circumcision were contending with him ,
44011003	saying , " You went in to uncircumcised men and ate with them ! "
44011004	But Peter , beginning [ to speak , ] was setting forth to them in order , saying ,
44011005	" I was in the city of Joppa praying ; and in a trance I saw a vision , a certain vessel coming down like a great sheet , being lowered by the four corners from heaven ; and it came as far as me ;
44011006	on which , looking intently , I was contemplating , and I saw the four-footed [ animals ] of the earth , and the wild beasts , and the reptiles , and the birds of the air .
44011007	And I heard a voice saying to me , ' Arise , Peter ; kill and eat . '
44011008	" But I said , ' By no means , Lord ! For nothing common or unclean has ever entered into my mouth . '
44011009	" But the voice answered me a second [ time ] from heaven , ' What God has made clean , you must not make common . '
44011010	" And this was done three times , and again all things [ ] were drawn up into heaven .
44011011	And behold , immediately three men stood before the house in which I was , having been sent from Caesarea to me .
44011012	And the Spirit said to me to go with them , without wavering . Now these six brothers also went with me , and we entered into the house of the man .
44011013	And he related to us how he had seen the angel in his house , standing and saying to him , ' Send men to Joppa , and send for Simon whose surname is Peter ,
44011014	' who will speak words to you by which you and all your household shall be saved . '
44011015	" And when I began to speak , the Holy Spirit fell on them , as also on us in the beginning .
44011016	And I remembered the word of the Lord , how He said , ' John indeed baptized with water , but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit . '
44011017	" If then God has given to them the same gift as He gave to us , when we believed on the Lord Jesus Christ , who was I to hinder God ? "
44011018	And hearing these things , they remained silent , and [ they ] glorified God , saying , " Then God has also granted even to the Gentiles repentance unto life . "
44011019	Then those who were scattered because of the tribulation coming about over Stephen , went about as far as Phoenicia , and Cyprus , and Antioch , speaking the word to no one except Jews only .
44011020	But some of them were men from Cyprus and Cyrene , who , entering into Antioch spoke to the Greek speaking Jews , preaching the good news of the Lord Jesus .
44011021	And the hand of the Lord was with them , and a great number believed , [ ] and turned to the Lord .
44011022	And the word about them was heard in the ears of the church in Jerusalem , and they sent forth Barnabas to go as far as Antioch ;
44011023	who , arriving and seeing the grace of God , was glad , and encouraged them all with purpose of heart to continue with the Lord ,
44011024	for he was a good man , full of the Holy Spirit and of faith . And a considerable crowd was added to the Lord .
44011025	And Barnabas went forth to Tarsus to seek out Saul ,
44011026	and having found him , he brought him to Antioch . And it came about that for a whole year they assembled with the church and instructed many people . And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch .
44011027	Now in these days prophets went down from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	And rising up , one of them named Agabus , foretold by the Spirit of a great famine about to happen in all the world , which also came to pass in the time of Claudius Caesar .
44011029	Then the disciples , each according to his ability , determined as a ministry to send relief to the brothers dwelling in Judea ;
44011030	which they also did , sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	Now at that time Herod the king put [ forth ] his hands to harm some from the church .
44012002	And he put to death James the brother of John with the sword .
44012003	And seeing that it was pleasing to the Jews , he proceeded further to arrest Peter also ( these were during the Days of Unleavened Bread ) ,
44012004	whom also seizing , he put him in prison , and handed him over to four four-man squads of soldiers to guard him , planning after the Passover to bring him again to the people .
44012005	Therefore Peter was kept in prison ; but earnest prayer was being made by the church to God [ on ] behalf of him .
44012006	But when Herod was about to bring him forth , on that night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , having been bound with two chains ; and guards before the door were keeping the prison .
44012007	And behold , an angel of the Lord stood [ there ] , and a light shined in the prison room ; and striking the side of Peter , he roused him saying , " Arise quickly ! " And his chains fell away from his hands .
44012008	And the angel said to him , " Gird yourself and put on your sandals " ; and he did so . And he said to him , " Put on your cloak and follow me . "
44012009	And going out , he was following him , and did not know that the thing taking place by the angel was true , but he was thinking that he was seeing a vision .
44012010	And going though the first and the second guard [ posts ] , they came to the iron gate which leads into the city , which was opened to them of its own accord ; and going out , they went forward one street , and immediately the angel withdrew from him .
44012011	And Peter , having come to himself , said , " Now I know truly that the Lord has sent forth His angel , and has delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the Jews . "
44012012	And realizing [ this ] , he came to the house of Mary , the mother of John whose surname was Mark , where a considerable [ number ] were gathered together and were praying .
44012013	And when Peter knocked at the door of the gate , a servant girl came to answer , named Rhoda .
44012014	When she recognized Peter's voice , because of her gladness she did not open the gate , but running in , she announced that Peter stood at the gate .
44012015	But they said to her , " You are mad ! " Yet she kept insisting that it was so . So they said , " It is his angel . "
44012016	But Peter was continuing knocking ; and opening [ the door ] they saw him , and were astounded .
44012017	And motioning to them with his hand to be silent , he related to them how the Lord had led him out of the prison . And he said , " Tell these things to James and to the brothers . " And going out , he went to another place .
44012018	Now when day came , there was no small disturbance among the soldiers , as to what had become of Peter .
44012019	And Herod , seeking for him and not finding him , he examined the guards , and commanded that they be executed . And going down from Judea to Caesarea , he was spending time [ there ] .
44012020	Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon ; and with one purpose they came to him , and persuading Blastus , the one over the king's bedroom , they asked for peace , because their country was fed from the king's [ country ] .
44012021	And on an appointed day Herod , clothing himself with royal apparel , and sitting on the judgment seat , was delivering an address to them .
44012022	And the crowds kept calling out , " [ This is the ] voice of a god and not of a man ! "
44012023	Then immediately an angel of the Lord struck him , because he did not give glory to God . And he was eaten by worms and died .
44012024	But the word of God increased and multiplied .
44012025	And Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem , having fulfilled their ministry , taking along with [ them ] John also , whose surname was Mark .
44013001	Now there were some in the church being in Antioch [ who were ] prophets and teachers : both Barnabas , and Simeon who was called Niger , Lucius of Cyrene , Manaen , brought up with Herod the tetrarch , and Saul .
44013002	Now as they were ministering to the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said , " Now separate to Me Barnabas and Saul for the work which I have called them . "
44013003	Then , fasting and praying , and laying their hands on them , they sent them away .
44013004	These two therefore , having been sent forth by the Holy Spirit , went down to Seleucia , and from there they sailed to Cyprus .
44013005	And arriving in Salamis , they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews . They also had John as their assistant .
44013006	And going across the island as far as Paphos , they found a certain sorcerer , a false prophet , a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus ,
44013007	who was with the proconsul , Sergius Paulus , an intelligent man . This man summoned Barnabas and Saul , and sought to hear the word of God .
44013008	But Elymas the sorcerer ( for so his name is translated ) resisted them , seeking to turn away the proconsul from the faith .
44013009	But Saul , who also is [ called ] Paul , was filled with the Holy Spirit , and gazing intently at him ,
44013010	[ he ] said , " O full of all guile and all craft , [ you ] son of [ the ] devil , [ you ] enemy of all righteousness , will you not cease perverting the straight ways of the Lord ?
44013011	And now behold , the hand of the Lord is upon you , and you shall be blind , not seeing the sun for a season . " And immediately a mistiness and darkness fell upon him , and going about , he sought someone to lead him by the hand .
44013012	Then when the proconsul saw what had happened , he believed , being amazed at the teaching of the Lord .
44013013	Now Paul and his companions put to sea from Paphos , and came to Perga of Pamphylia ; But John deserted them and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	But they went from Perga , and arrived in Antioch of Pisidia , and entering into the synagogue on the Sabbath day , they sat down .
44013015	Now after the reading of the Law and the Prophets , the synagogue leaders sent to them , saying , " Men and brothers , if there is by you a word of encouragement for the people , speak . "
44013016	And Paul , arising and motioning with his hand , said , " Men , Israelites , and you who fear God , listen :
44013017	The God of this people chose our fathers , and lifting up the people during their sojourn in the land of Egypt , and with an uplifted arm brought them out from it .
44013018	Now for a time of about forty years He put up with them in the wilderness .
44013019	And destroying seven nations in the land of Canaan , He gave their land to them as an inheritance .
44013020	And after these things , [ for ] about four hundred and fifty years , He gave [ them ] judges until [ the time of ] Samuel the prophet .
44013021	And then they asked for a king , and God gave them Saul the son of Kish , a man of the tribe of Benjamin , for forty years .
44013022	And removing him , He raised up for them David as king , to whom He also said bearing witness , ' I have found David the son of Jesse , [ to be ] a man after My [ own ] heart , who will do all My will . '
44013023	God , from the seed of this [ man , ] according to the promise , has brought to Israel salvation ,
44013024	after John had first proclaimed before His coming , the baptism of repentance to Israel .
44013025	Now as John was finishing his course , he said , ' Whom do you suppose me to be ? I am not He . But behold , there comes One after me , the sandal of whose feet I am not worthy to loosen . '
44013026	" Men , brothers , sons of the race of Abraham , and those among you who fear God , to you the message of this salvation has been sent .
44013027	For those dwelling in Jerusalem , and their rulers , because they did not know Him , nor the voices of the Prophets which are read according to each Sabbath , condemning [ him ] , they fulfilled [ the Scriptures . ]
44013028	And finding no cause for death , they asked Pilate that He be executed .
44013029	And when they finished all the things having been written about Him , taking Him down from the tree , they put [ Him ] in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised Him from the dead ;
44013031	who appeared for [ many ] days more to those going up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who are His witnesses to the people .
44013032	And we proclaim to you the good news of the promise which was made to the fathers ,
44013033	that God has fulfilled this promise for us to their children , when He raised up Jesus , as it is also written in the second Psalm : ' You are My Son , today I have begotten You . '
44013034	" And that He raised Him from the dead , no longer being about to return to corruption , thus He has said : ' I will give you the sure decrees of God concerning David . '
44013035	" Therefore also in another [ Psalm ] He says , ' You will not allow Your Holy One to see corruption . '
44013036	" For David indeed in his own generation , having served by the purpose of God , died , and was buried with his fathers , and saw corruption ;
44013037	but He whom God raised up did not see corruption .
44013038	Therefore let it be known to you , brothers , that through this Man forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you ,
44013039	and from all [ ] things [ ] from which you could not ( by the Law of Moses ) be justified , by Him everyone that believes is justified .
44013040	Watch therefore , lest there come upon you that which was spoken of in the prophets :
44013041	" Behold , you despisers , and marvel and perish ! For I will work a work in your days which you will by no means believe , though one were to declare it to you . ' "
44013042	Now as the Jews were going out of the synagogue , the Gentiles begged that these words might be spoken to them the next Sabbath .
44013043	And when the synagogue service was broken up , many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas , who , speaking [ to them ] , persuaded them to continue in the grace of God .
44013044	On the coming Sabbath , almost all the city was assembled to hear the word of God .
44013045	And the Jews , seeing the crowds , they were filled with jealousy and spoke against the things being said by Paul , contradicting and blaspheming .
44013046	But Paul and Barnabas , speaking boldly said , " It was necessary for the word of God to be spoken to you first ; but since you thrust it away , and judge yourselves not worthy of eternal life ; behold , we turn to the Gentiles .
44013047	For so the Lord has commanded us : ' I have set you to be a light of the nations , that you should be for salvation to the end of the earth . ' "
44013048	Now when the Gentiles heard this , they rejoiced and glorified the word of the Lord . And as many as were appointed to eternal life believed .
44013049	And the word of the Lord was being spread throughout all the region .
44013050	But the Jews incited the devout and prominent women and the leading [ men ] of the city , and raised up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and cast them out from their borders .
44013051	But shaking off the dust from their feet against them , they went to Iconium .
44013052	And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	And it came to pass in Iconium that they went in together into the synagogue of the Jews , and they spoke in a way so that a great multitude , both of the Jews and of the Greeks , believed .
44014002	But the disbelieving Jews aroused and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers .
44014003	Therefore they spent a considerable time there , speaking boldly in the Lord , who was bearing witness to the word of His grace , giving signs and wonders to take place by their hands .
44014004	And the multitude of the city was divided : and some were with the Jews , and others with the apostles .
44014005	And when an attempt was made by both the Gentiles and the [ ] Jews , together with their rulers , to mistreat and to stone them ,
44014006	they became aware of it and fled to the cities of Lycaonia , Lystra and Derbe , and to the surrounding region .
44014007	And there , they were preaching the gospel .
44014008	And a certain man in Lystra , powerless in his feet , was sitting , lame from his mother's womb , who had never walked .
44014009	This [ man ] heard Paul speaking ; who , gazing intently on him and seeing that he had faith to be healed ,
44014010	said with a loud voice , " Stand up straight on your feet ! " And he was jumping and walking about .
44014011	And the crowds , seeing what Paul did , raised their voice , saying in the Lycaonian language , " The gods have been made like men and have come down to us ! "
44014012	And Barnabas they called Zeus , and Paul , Hermes , since he was the leader in speaking .
44014013	And the priest of Zeus , whose temple was before their city , bearing bulls and garlands to the gates , together with the crowds , was desiring to sacrifice [ to them . ]
44014014	But when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , heard this , they tore their clothes and rushed in to the crowd , crying out
44014015	and saying , " Men ! Why are you doing these things ? We men are of the same nature as you , preaching the gospel to you , that you must turn from these useless things to the living God , who made the heaven , and the earth , and the sea , and all the things in them ,
44014016	who in the generations having gone by permitted all the Gentiles to walk in their ways .
44014017	And yet He did not leave Himself without witness , in that He did good , giving to you rain from heaven and fruit bearing seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness . "
44014018	And saying these things , they scarcely stopped the crowds from sacrificing to them .
44014019	But there arrived from Antioch and Iconium [ certain ] Jews , and having persuaded the crowds and having stoned Paul , they dragged [ him ] outside the city , thinking he was dead .
44014020	But when the disciples encircled him , he stood and entered into the city . And the next day he went out together with Barnabas to Derbe .
44014021	And having preached the gospel to that city and having made many disciples , they returned to Lystra , and Iconium , and Antioch ,
44014022	strengthening the souls of the disciples , urging [ them ] to continue in the faith , [ saying , " ] Through many tribulations we must enter into the kingdom of God . "
44014023	And having chosen elders for them in every church , [ and ] having prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed .
44014024	And having crossed Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
44014025	And having spoken the word in Perga , they went down to Attalia .
44014026	From there they sailed to Antioch , from where they were commended to the grace of God for the work which they had completed .
44014027	Now arriving and gathering the church together , they related all that God had done with them , and that He had opened the door of faith for the Gentiles .
44014028	And they spent a long time there with the disciples .
44015001	And certain men coming down from Judea were teaching the brothers , " If you are not circumcised in the custom of Moses , you cannot be saved . "
44015002	Therefore when there arose a serious dissension and debate with Paul and Barnabus , they determined that Paul and Barnabas and some others of them should go up to the apostles and elders in Jerusalem concerning this issue .
44015003	Therefore , being sent forth by the church , they were passing through Phoenicia and Samaria , telling in detail [ about ] the conversion of the Gentiles ; and they were causing great joy to all the brothers .
44015004	And having come to Jerusalem , they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders ; and they declared all that God had done with them .
44015005	But some of those from the sect of the Pharisees rose up , saying , " It is necessary to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses . "
44015006	And the apostles and elders gathered together to see about this matter .
44015007	And after much dispute , Peter arose and said to them : " Men , brothers , you know that from early days God chose among us , that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe .
44015008	And God , who knows the heart , bore witness to them by giving them the Holy Spirit , just as also [ He did ] to us ,
44015009	and made no distinction between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
44015010	Now therefore , why do you test God by putting a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
44015011	But through the grace of the Lord Jesus , we believe that we will be saved in the same manner as they . "
44015012	Then all the multitude stopped speaking and listened to Barnabas and Paul telling as many signs and wonders as God had done among the Gentiles through them .
44015013	Now after they had finished speaking , James answered , saying , " Men and brothers , listen to me :
44015014	Simeon has declared how God first visited [ them ] to take from the Gentiles a people for His name .
44015015	And with this the words of the prophets agree , just as it is written :
44015016	" After this I will return , and I will build again the tabernacle of David , which has fallen ; and its ruins I will rebuild , and I will restore it ,
44015017	in order that the rest of men may seek out the LORD , and all the Gentiles who are called by My name , says the LORD who does all these things . '
44015018	" Known from everlasting to God are all His works .
44015019	Therefore I judge that we must not cause trouble for those who are turning to God from [ among ] the Gentiles ;
44015020	but that we write to them to abstain from things polluted by idols , and from sexual immorality , from things strangled , and [ from ] blood .
44015021	" For Moses has had from ancient generations those who proclaim him in each city , being read in the synagogues from one Sabbath to another . "
44015022	Then it seemed best to the apostles and the elders , together with the whole church , to send men being chosen from them to Antioch , together with Paul and Barnabas , namely , Judas who was also named Barsabas , and Silas , leading men among the brothers .
44015023	Writing by their hand these things : The apostles , the elders , and the brothers , to the brothers in Antioch , and Syria , and Cilicia who are of the Gentiles : Greetings .
44015024	Inasmuch as we have heard that some went out from among us and troubled you with words , unsettling your souls , saying , ' that you must be circumcised and keep the law ' - to whom we gave no [ such ] command -
44015025	it seemed best to us , having come to be of the same mind , to send men being chosen to you , with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
44015026	men having given over their lives for the sake of the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
44015027	We have therefore sent Judas and Silas , who will also tell you the same things by word [ of mouth ] .
44015028	For it seemed best to the Holy Spirit , and to us , to put on you no greater burden except for these necessary things :
44015029	that you abstain from meat offered to idols , and from blood , and from [ anything ] strangled , and from fornication ; from which keeping yourselves back , you will do well . Farewell .
44015030	Then having been dismissed , they came to Antioch ; and having gathered the multitude together , they delivered the letter .
44015031	And when they had read it , they rejoiced over its encouragement .
44015032	Now Judas and Silas , themselves being prophets also , encouraged and strengthened the brothers with many words .
44015033	And when time had passed , they were dismissed with peace from the brothers to the apostles .
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas spent time in Antioch , teaching and preaching the good news of the word of the Lord , with many others also .

44015037	But Barnabas desired to take along with them John called Mark .
44015038	But Paul considered it fitting not to take along with them the one who withdrew from them in Pamphylia , and who had not gone together with them to the work .
44015039	Therefore a sharp disagreement arose so that they were separated from one another . And Barnabas , taking along Mark , sailed to Cyprus .
44015040	But Paul , choosing Silas , departed , being given over to the grace of God by the brothers .
44015041	And he passed through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the churches .
44016001	Now he arrived at Derbe and Lystra . And behold , a certain disciple was there named Timothy , the son of a certain Jewish woman who believed , but his father was Greek ,
44016002	who had a good testimony by the brothers in Lystra and Iconium .
44016003	Paul wanted [ Timothy ] to accompany him , and taking him , he circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places , for they all knew that his father was Greek .
44016004	And as they were going through the cities , they were delivering to them the decrees to keep , which had been decided by the apostles and the elders at Jerusalem .
44016005	Therefore the churches were strengthened in the faith , and were growing in number each day .
44016006	Now when they had gone through Phrygia and the Galatian region , they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit from speaking the word in Asia ,
44016007	having come to Mysia they attempted to go to Bithynia , but the Spirit did not permit them .
44016008	So they bypassed Mysia , and went down to Troas .
44016009	And a vision appeared during the night to Paul . A certain man of Macedonia was standing , urging him , and saying , " Come across to Macedonia and help us . "
44016010	Now when he saw the vision , immediately we sought to go out to Macedonia , concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the gospel to them .
44016011	Therefore , putting to sea from Troas , we ran a straight course to Samothrace , and the next day came to Neapolis ,
44016012	and from there to Philippi , which is chief of that part of Macedonia , a colony . And we were spending some days in that very city .
44016013	And on the Sabbath day we went outside the city beside a river , where prayer was customarily made ; and having sat down we spoke to the women who assembled together [ there ] .
44016014	And a certain woman named Lydia , a dealer of purple cloth of the city of Thyatira , who worshipped God , heard us , whose heart the Lord opened to give heed to the things spoken by Paul .
44016015	And when she and her household were baptized , she urged us , saying , " If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come to my house and stay . " So she persuaded us .
44016016	Now it came to pass , as we went to prayer , that a certain slave girl , having a spirit of Python , met us , who brought much profit to her masters by fortune telling .
44016017	This girl , following after Paul and us , was crying out , saying , " These men are the servants of the Most High God , who proclaim to us the way of salvation . "
44016018	And this she did for many days . But Paul , being greatly annoyed and turning around , said to the spirit , " I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . " And he came out in that very hour .
44016019	And when her masters saw that the hope of their profit was gone , they took Paul and Silas , and dragged [ them ] to the marketplace to the rulers .
44016020	And bringing them to the magistrates they said , " These men , being Jews , are agitating our city ;
44016021	and they are proclaiming customs which are not lawful for us to receive or to do , since we are Romans . "
44016022	And the crowd rose up together against them ; and the magistrates tore their clothes and ordered [ men ] to beat [ them ] with rods .
44016023	And when they laid many strokes on them , they cast them into prison , commanding the prison keeper to keep them securely ;
44016024	who , having received such a command , cast them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks .
44016025	Now about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken ; and immediately all the doors were opened and all the bonds were loosed .
44016027	And becoming awake , the prison keeper , seeing the doors of the prison open , drawing a sword , he was about to kill himself , supposing the prisoners to have escaped .
44016028	But Paul called out with a loud voice , saying , " Do not harm yourself , for we are all here . "
44016029	And asking for a light he rushed in , and he came trembling , and fell before Paul and Silas ,
44016030	and he brought them forth outside and said , " Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? "
44016031	And they said , " Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and you shall be saved , you and your household . "
44016032	And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all those in his house .
44016033	And taking them along in that same hour of the night and washed their wounds , and immediately he and all his family were baptized .
44016034	And bringing them up into his house , he set a meal before them ; and he rejoiced with his whole house , having believed in God .
44016035	Now when it became day , the magistrates sent the officers , saying , " Release those men . "
44016036	And the prison keeper announced these words to Paul , saying , " The magistrates have sent so that you may be released . Now therefore depart , and go in peace . "
44016037	But Paul said to them , " They beat us publicly , although we were uncondemned Romans , and they cast [ us ] into prison , and now do they cast us out secretly ? No indeed ! Let them come themselves and lead us out . "
44016038	And the officers related to the magistrates these words , and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans .
44016039	And coming , they appealed to them , and bringing them out , they asked them to depart from the city .
44016040	And coming out from the prison , they entered into [ the house of ] Lydia ; and seeing the brothers , they encouraged them and departed .
44017001	Now traveling through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where there was a synagogue of the Jews .
44017002	And according to Paul's custom , he went in to them , and for three Sabbaths he reasoned with them from the Scriptures ,
44017003	interpreting and pointing out that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer , and to arise from the dead , and [ saying ] that " This is the Christ , Jesus , whom I proclaim to you . "
44017004	And some of them were persuaded and were joined with Paul and Silas , both of the devout Greeks , a great multitude , and not a few of the chief women .
44017005	And the Jews who did not believe [ ] took some wicked men from the marketplace , and forming a mob , [ they ] threw the city into disorder , and came upon the house of Jason , and sought to bring them to the people .
44017006	But when they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some brothers to the rulers of the city , crying out , " The men who have upset the whole world , these have come here , too ;
44017007	whom Jason has received ; and these all practice contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying there is another king - Jesus . "
44017008	And they troubled the crowd and the rulers of the city when they heard these things .
44017009	And having taken the security bond from Jason and the rest , they released them .
44017010	Then the brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away during the night to Berea . When they arrived , they went into the synagogue of the Jews .
44017011	And these were more noble-minded than [ ] those in Thessalonica , who received the word with all readiness , each day examining the Scriptures [ to see ] whether these things might be so .
44017012	Therefore many of them believed , and not a few of the prominent Greek women and men .
44017013	But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul in Berea , they came there also , agitating the crowds .
44017014	Then immediately the brothers sent Paul away , to go toward the sea ; but both Silas and Timothy remained there .
44017015	And those conducting Paul brought him to Athens ; and receiving a command for Silas and Timothy , that as quickly as possible they should come to him , they departed .
44017016	And in Athens , while Paul waited for them , his spirit was provoked within him when he saw that the city was full of idols .
44017017	Therefore he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and with the [ Gentile ] worshippers , and in the marketplace daily with those coming by .
44017018	And also some of the Epicurean and of the Stoic philosophers were conversing with him . And some were saying , " What does this seed-picker wish to say ? " But others [ said ] , " He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign deities , " because he was preaching the good news of Jesus and the resurrection .
44017019	And taking hold of him , they brought [ him ] to the Areopagus , saying , " Are we able to know what this new doctrine is you speak about ?
44017020	For you are bringing some strange things to our ears . Therefore we desire to know what these things might mean . "
44017021	Now all the Athenians and the strangers staying there as visitors spent their time in nothing other than to say or to hear some new thing .
44017022	Then Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus and said , " Men , Athenians , according to all things I perceive you as [ being ] very religious ;
44017023	for as I passed by and considered the objects of your worship , I found also an altar on which it had been inscribed : TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Therefore , [ Him ] whom being ignorant of you worship , this [ One ] I announce to you :
44017024	The God who made the world and all the things in it , Him being Lord of heaven and earth , does not dwell in temples made by human hands ,
44017025	nor by the hands of men is He served , as though He needed anything , for He gives to all life , and breath , with respect to all things .
44017026	And He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell upon all the face of the earth , and He ordained their preappointed times and the boundaries of their dwellings ,
44017027	[ in order for them ] to seek the Lord , if perhaps indeed they might grope for Him and find [ Him ] , and yet being indeed not far from each one of us ;
44017028	for in Him we live and move and have our being , as also some of your own poets have said , ' For we are also His offspring . '
44017029	" Therefore , being the offspring of God , we ought not to suppose that the Godhead is like gold or silver or stone , something shaped by art and the imagination of man .
44017030	So then these times of ignorance God overlooked , but now He commands all men everywhere to repent ,
44017031	because He has appointed a day in which He is going to judge the world in righteousness by [ the ] Man whom He has appointed , having given proof to all , by raising Him from the dead . "
44017032	But when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some were scoffing , but others said , " We will hear you again concerning this . "
44017033	And thus Paul went forth from their midst .
44017034	However , some men were joined to him and believed , among whom were also Dionysius the Areopagite , a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	Now after these things , having departed from Athens , Paul came to Corinth .
44018002	And he found a certain Jew named Aquila , a native of Pontus , having recently come from Italy with Priscilla his wife ( because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to depart from Rome ) ; he came to them ,
44018003	and because he was of the same trade , he remained with them and worked , for they were tentmakers by trade .
44018004	And he reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath , and persuaded both Jews and Greeks .
44018005	Now when both Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia , Paul was compelled by the Spirit , solemnly bearing witness to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ .
44018006	But because they were opposing and blaspheming , he shook off his clothes and said to them , " Your blood [ be ] on your [ own ] heads ; I am clean . From now on I will go to the Gentiles . "
44018007	And having gone over from there , he went into the house of a certain [ man ] named Justus , who worshipped God , whose house was next door to the synagogue .
44018008	And Crispus , the ruler of the synagogue , believed in the Lord , together with all his household . And many of the Corinthians , hearing , were believing and were being baptized .
44018009	Now the Lord spoke to Paul by a vision in the night , [ saying ] , " Do not fear , but speak , and do not keep silent ;
44018010	for I am with you , and no one will attack you to harm you ; for I have many people in this city . "
44018011	And he settled [ there ] a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
44018012	Now while Gallio was proconsul of Achaia , the Jews with one purpose rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat ,
44018013	saying , " This [ man ] persuades men to worship God contrary to the law . "
44018014	And when Paul was about to open his mouth , Gallio said to the Jews , " If then it was some misdeed or wicked crime , O Jews , according to reason I would bear with you .
44018015	But if it is a question about a word and names and your own law , see [ to it ] yourselves ; for I do not wish to be a judge of these things . "
44018016	And he drove them away from the judgment seat .
44018017	Then all the Greeks , taking hold of Sosthenes the ruler of the synagogue , were beating him before the judgment seat . And none of these things was a concern to Gallio .
44018018	Now Paul still remained there a good while , then bid farewell to the brothers , and sailed away for Syria , and Priscilla and Aquila were with him . He had his hair cut off in Cenchrea , for he had taken a vow .
44018019	And he arrived in Ephesus , and he left those [ two ] there ; but he , having entered into the synagogue , reasoned with the Jews .
44018020	And when they asked him to remain with them for a longer time , he did not consent ,
44018021	but bid farewell to them saying , " I must by all means keep this coming feast which is in Jerusalem ; but I will return again to you , God willing . " And he put out to sea from Ephesus .
44018022	And having gone down to Caesarea , and having gone up and greeted the church , he went down to Antioch .
44018023	After having spent some time there , he went out , going through in order the Galatian region and the Phrygian [ region ] , strengthening all the disciples .
44018024	Now a certain Jew named Apollos , a native of Alexandria , an eloquent man and mighty in the Scriptures , had arrived in Ephesus .
44018025	This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in spirit , he spoke and taught accurately the things about the Lord , although he knew only the baptism of John .
44018026	And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue . And when Aquila and Priscilla heard him , they took him aside and explained to him the way of God more accurately .
44018027	And when he desired to go across to Achaia , having urged him on , the brothers wrote to the disciples [ there ] to receive him ; and when he arrived , he assisted greatly with those who had believed through grace ;
44018028	for he was powerfully refuting the Jews publicly , demonstrating by the Scriptures [ that ] Jesus was the Messiah .
44019001	And it came about , while Apollos was in Corinth , that Paul , having gone through the interior regions , came to Ephesus . And finding some disciples
44019002	[ he ] said to them , " Did you receive the Holy Spirit , having believed ? " So they said to him , " We have not even heard whether there is a Holy Spirit . "
44019003	And he said to them , " Into what then were you baptized ? " So they said , " Into John's baptism . "
44019004	But Paul said , " John indeed baptized with a baptism of repentance , saying to the people that they should believe in the One coming after him , that is , in Christ Jesus . "
44019005	And when they heard [ this ] , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	And when Paul laid his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came upon them , and they spoke in tongues and prophesied .
44019007	Now all the men were about twelve .
44019008	And he entered into the synagogue and spoke boldly for three months , debating and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
44019009	But when some became hardened and disbelieving , speaking evil against the Way before the multitude , he withdrew from them and separated the disciples , each day debating in the school of a certain Tyrannus .
44019010	Now this took place for two years , so that all who were dwelling in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
44019011	And God was doing extraordinary miracles by the hands of Paul ,
44019012	so that even handkerchiefs or aprons from his skin were brought to those who were sick , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out from them .
44019013	Then some of the wandering Jews , exorcists , attempted to name the name of the Lord Jesus over those having the evil spirits , saying , " We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches . "
44019014	Now there were seven sons of Sceva , a Jewish high priest , doing this .
44019015	But the evil spirit answered and said , " Jesus I know , and Paul I recognize ; but who are you ? "
44019016	Then the man in whom was the evil spirit leaped upon them , and having subdued them , prevailed against them , so that they ran out of the house naked and wounded .
44019017	Now this became known to all both Jews and Greeks who were dwelling in Ephesus ; and fear fell upon them all , and they were praising the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019018	And many of those who had believed were coming , confessing and disclosing their deeds .
44019019	And many of those who were practicing magic brought together their books and burned them up before everyone . And they counted up the prices of them , and [ found it to be ] fifty thousand [ pieces ] of silver .
44019020	Thus the word of the Lord was growing powerfully and prevailed .
44019021	When these things were fulfilled , Paul resolved in his spirit , having gone through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , " After I have been there , I must also see Rome . "
44019022	And having sent to Macedonia two of those who were ministering to him , Timothy and Erastus , he himself stayed on for a time in Asia .
44019023	Now there arose during that time a serious disturbance concerning the Way .
44019024	For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , who made silver shrines of Artemis , providing no little trade [ for ] the craftsmen ,
44019025	whom he gathered , with the workers of similar occupation , and said : " Men , you know out of this trade is our prosperity .
44019026	And you observe and hear that not only at Ephesus , but almost in all of Asia , this Paul has persuaded and turned away a great multitude , saying that they are not gods which are made by human hands .
44019027	And not only is this business of ours in danger to come into disrepute , but also the temple of the great goddess Artemis may be despised and also her magnificence , about to be destroyed , she whom all Asia and the world worship . "
44019028	And hearing [ this ] , and becoming full of anger , they were crying out saying , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! "
44019029	And the whole city was filled with confusion , and they rushed with one purpose into the theater , having seized Gaius and Aristarchus , Macedonians , traveling companions of Paul .
44019030	Now when Paul wished to enter in among the crowd , the disciples would not permit him .
44019031	And also some of the officials of Asia , being friends with him , sent word to him and urged him not to present himself in the theater .
44019032	Then others were calling out something different , for the assembly was confused , and the majority did not know for what reason they had come together .
44019033	And from the crowd they brought forward Alexander , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander motioned with his hand , and desired to make a defense to the people .
44019034	But recognizing he was a Jew , there arose one voice from [ them ] all , calling out for two hours , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! "
44019035	And having quieted the crowd , the city clerk said : " Men of Ephesus , for what man is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is the temple keeper of the great goddess Artemis , and of the [ image ] fallen from heaven ?
44019036	Therefore , since these things are undeniable , it is necessary for you to be quieted and to do nothing rash .
44019037	For you brought these men , neither temple thieves nor blasphemers of your goddess .
44019038	Therefore , if Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a word against anyone , the courts are in session , and there are proconsuls . Let them bring charges against one another .
44019039	But if you are wanting to know anything about other [ matters ] , it shall be determined by the lawful assembly .
44019040	For we also are in danger of being accused of insurrection concerning today , there being no cause for which we will be able to give , [ as ] an explanation for this commotion .
44019041	And having said these things , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	Now after the disturbance had ceased , Paul , summoning the disciples and greeting them , went away to go to Macedonia .
44020002	And going through those parts , and encouraging them with many words , he came to Greece
44020003	and spent three months [ there ] . And as a plot by the Jews developed against him , as he was to put to sea for Syria , a decision came about to return through Macedonia .
44020004	And Sopater , a Berean , was accompanying him to Asia - also Aristarchus of the Thessalonians , and Secundus , and Gaius of Derbe , and Timothy , and Tychicus and Trophimus , [ the ] Asians .
44020005	These [ men ] , having gone ahead , were waiting for us in Troas .
44020006	And we sailed away after the Days of Unleavened Bread , from Philippi , and we came to them in Troas within five days , where we spent seven days .
44020007	Now on the first [ day ] of the week , the disciples being assembled to break bread , Paul was discussing with them , being about to leave on the next day , and extended his message until midnight .
44020008	And there were a considerable number of lamps in the upper room where we were assembled .
44020009	And a certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window , being overwhelmed by a deep sleep . While Paul was speaking for a while longer , having been overwhelmed by sleep , he fell down from the third story and was taken up dead .
44020010	But Paul , going down , fell upon him , and embracing him said , " Do not be troubled , for his life is in him . "
44020011	And going up and breaking bread and eating , and talking for a considerable time , until daybreak , thus he departed .
44020012	And they brought the boy living , and they were encouraged greatly .
44020013	Now we , having gone ahead on the ship , put to sea for Assos , from there intending to take Paul on board ; for thus it had been arranged , since he intended to go on foot .
44020014	And when he met us at Assos , having taken him aboard , we came to Mitylene .
44020015	And having sailing away from there , on the next day we arrived opposite Chios . The following day we approached to Samos and remained in Trogyllium . The following day we came to Miletus .
44020016	For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus , in order that it might not happen to him to spend time in Asia ; for he was hurrying , if it was possible for him to be in Jerusalem [ on ] the Day of Pentecost .
44020017	Now from Miletus , having sent to Ephesus , he summoned the elders of the church .
44020018	And when they were present with him , he said to them : " You know from the first day which I arrived in Asia , how I was with you the whole time ,
44020019	serving the Lord with all humility , and many tears and trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews ;
44020020	how I kept back nothing that was profitable , but declared it to you , teaching you publicly and from house to house ,
44020021	solemnly bearing witness to both Jews and to Greeks , the repentance toward God and faith toward our Lord Jesus .
44020022	And now behold , I , having been bound in the spirit , am going to Jerusalem , not knowing the things that will happen to me there ,
44020023	except that the Holy Spirit in every city is solemnly bearing witness , saying that bonds and tribulations are waiting for me .
44020024	But I count myself as nothing ; nor do I regard my life as valuable to myself , so that I may complete my course with joy , and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus , to bear solemn testimony to the gospel of the grace of God .
44020025	And now behold , now I know that you all , among whom I have passed through preaching the kingdom of God , will no longer see my face .
44020026	Therefore I testify to you this very day , that I am innocent of all blood .
44020027	For I did not draw back from declaring to you the whole counsel of God .
44020028	Therefore take heed to yourselves and to all the flock , in which the Holy Spirit placed you [ as ] overseers , to shepherd the church of the Lord , and of God , which He purchased with His own blood .
44020029	For I know this , that savage wolves will come in after my departure , not sparing the flock .
44020030	Also from among you yourselves will arise men speaking things having been distorted , [ in order ] to draw away the disciples after them .
44020031	Therefore be alert , remembering that for three years , night and day I did not cease , with tears , exhorting each one .
44020032	So for the present , I entrust you , brothers , to God and to the word of His grace , which is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who have been sanctified .
44020033	I have desired the silver or gold or clothes of no one .
44020034	You yourselves know that these hands rendered service to my needs , and those who were with me .
44020035	By all things I have shown you , that thus laboring it is necessary to help [ those ] being weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , that He said , ' It is more blessed to give than to receive . ' "
44020036	And having said these things , he knelt down , together with them all , and prayed .
44020037	And there was considerable weeping by all , and falling on Paul's neck , they kissed him ,
44020038	feeling pain most of all for the words which he said , that they were about to see his face no more . And they accompanied him to the ship .
