44021001	Now when it came to pass that we had put to sea , having withdrawn from them , running a straight course we came to Cos , and on the next [ day ] to Rhodes , and from there to Patara .
44021002	And having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia , we boarded it and put to sea .
44021003	When we had sighted Cyprus , and had left it behind [ on the ] left , we sailed to Syria , and put in to harbor in Tyre , for the ship was unloading its cargo .
44021004	And having discovered disciples , we stayed there seven days . They said to Paul through the Spirit not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021005	But when it came about that we had completed the days [ there ] , having gone out we departed , all [ of them ] accompanying us , together with [ their ] wives and children , until [ we were ] outside the city . And having bowed [ our ] knees on the shore , we prayed .
44021006	And having greeted one another , we went up into the ship , and they returned to their own [ homes ] .
44021007	And completing our voyage from Tyre , we arrived in Ptolemais , and having greeted the brothers , we stayed one day with them .
44021008	On the next day those accompanying Paul went forth and came to Caesarea , and entering into the house of Philip the evangelist , who was one of the seven , we stayed with him .
44021009	Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied .
44021010	And while we remained there several days , a certain prophet from Judea named Agabus came down .
44021011	And coming to us and taking Paul's belt , and binding his feet and hands , he said , " Thus says the Holy Spirit , ' The man whose belt this is , the Jews will bind in this way in Jerusalem , and they will deliver [ him ] into the hands of the Gentiles . ' "
44021012	Now when we heard these things , both we and the local residents urged him not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul answered , " Why are you weeping and breaking my heart ? For I am ready not only to be bound , but also to die at Jerusalem , for the name of the Lord Jesus . "
44021014	And when he remained unpersuaded , we were silent and said , " Let the will of the Lord be done . "
44021015	Now after those days , having prepared , we went up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Also some of the disciples from Caesarea went with us and brought with them a certain Cypriot named Mnason , a long-standing disciple , with whom we would stay as a guest .
44021017	And when we arrived in Jerusalem , the brothers gladly received us .
44021018	On the next day Paul was going in with us to James , and all the elders were present .
44021019	And having greeted them , he reported one by one those [ ] things which God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	And hearing this , they were glorifying the Lord , saying to him , " You see , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are who have believed , and they are all zealous for the law ;
44021021	and they have been informed about you , that you are teaching defection from Moses , to all the Jews who are among the Gentiles , saying for them not to circumcise their children nor to walk in our customs .
44021022	What then ? It is necessary for an assembly to come together ; for they will hear that you have come .
44021023	Therefore do this , which we say to you : There [ ] are four men with us who have taken a vow upon themselves .
44021024	Take them and purify yourself with them , and pay for them that they may have their head shaved , and that all may know that those things of which they have been informed about you are nothing , but [ that ] you are agreeing with and keeping the law yourself .
44021025	But as for the Gentile believers , we wrote , having judged that they should keep no such thing , except that they should keep themselves from things offered to idols , from blood , and [ from anything ] strangled , and from fornication . "
44021026	Then Paul , having taken the men , on the next day having been purified with them , entered into the temple , [ thus ] giving notice to the completion of the days of the purification , until [ the time ] when the offering was offered in behalf of each one of them .
44021027	Now when the seven days were about to be completed , the Jews from Asia , seeing him in the temple , were stirring up all the crowd and put their hands on him ,
44021028	crying out , " Men of Israel , help us ! This is the man who is teaching all [ people ] everywhere against the people and the Law and this place ; and furthermore he has brought Greeks into the temple and has defiled this holy place . "
44021029	For they had seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple .
44021030	And all the city was aroused ; and there was a mob forming among the people , and taking hold of Paul they were dragging him outside the temple ; and immediately the doors were shut .
44021031	And seeking to kill him , a report went up to the commander of the garrison that all Jerusalem had been stirred up ,
44021032	who immediately having taken along soldiers and centurions , ran down among them . And when they saw the commander and the soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	And the commander , approaching , took hold of him , and ordered him to be bound with two chains ; and he was inquiring who he might be and what he had done .
44021034	But others among the crowd were crying out one thing and some another ; and because he was unable to ascertain the truth because of the noise , he commanded him to be brought into the barracks .
44021035	But when he arrived at the stairs , he had to be carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd .
44021036	For the multitude of the people was following , calling out , " take him away ! "
44021037	Then as Paul was about to be led into the barracks , he said to the commander , " Is it permitted from me to speak to you ? " And he said , " Do you know Greek ?
44021038	Are you not then the Egyptian who rose up before these days , and led forth the four thousand men of the assassins into the wilderness ? "
44021039	But Paul said , " I am a Jew from Tarsus of Cilicia , a citizen of no obscure city ; and I request of you , permit me to speak to the people . "
44021040	And permitting him , Paul stood on the stairs and motioned with his hand to the people . And when there was a great silence , he addressed them in the Hebrew language , saying ,
44022001	" Men , brothers and fathers , hear my defense to you now . "
44022002	And hearing that he was addressing them in the Hebrew language , they granted [ him ] more silence . And he said :
44022003	" I am indeed a Jew , having been born in Tarsus of Cilicia , but having been brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , having been educated according to the exactness of the law of our forefathers , being zealous for God just as you all are today .
44022004	I , who persecuted this Way to death , binding and handing over to prisons both men and women ,
44022005	as also the high priest testifies of me , along with the council of the elders , from whom I also received letters to the brothers , and went to Damascus in order to bring those who were there , having been bound , to Jerusalem , that they might be punished .
44022006	Now it happened , as I was going and approaching Damascus , about midday , suddenly from heaven a great light shone about me .
44022007	And I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ' Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting Me ? '
44022008	" So I answered , ' Who are You , Lord ? ' And He said to me , ' I am Jesus the Nazarene , whom you are persecuting . '
44022009	" And those who were with me observed the light and became terrified , but they did not hear the voice of the [ One ] speaking to me .
44022010	So I said , ' What shall I do , Lord ? ' And the Lord said to me , ' Arise and go into Damascus , and it will be told to you about all the [ ] things which it has been appointed for you to do . '
44022011	" And since I could not see because of the brightness of that light , being led by the hand by those who were with me , I came into Damascus .
44022012	And Ananias , a certain devout man according to the law , being testified of by all the Jews dwelling in Damascus ,
44022013	came to me and he stood and said to me , ' Brother Saul , see again . ' And I , in that very hour , looked up at him .
44022014	And he said , ' The God of our fathers has chosen you to know His will , and to see the Righteous One , and hear the voice from His mouth .
44022015	For you shall be a witness for Him to all men of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	And now , what are you going to do ? Arise and be baptized , and wash away your sins , calling on the name of the Lord . '
44022017	" And it happened to me , having returned to Jerusalem and praying in the temple , that I came to be in a trance ,
44022018	and saw Him saying to me , ' Hurry and go out quickly from Jerusalem , for they will not receive your witness about Me . '
44022019	" And I said , ' Lord , they know that in every synagogue I was imprisoning and beating those believing on You .
44022020	And when the blood of Your witness Stephen was shed , I myself was standing by consenting to his murder , and guarding the clothes of those murdering him . '
44022021	" Then He said to me , ' Go , for I will send you far away to the Gentiles . ' "
44022022	Now they were listening to him until this statement , and they lifted their voice saying , " Take away such a [ man ] from the earth , for it is not fitting [ for ] him to live ! "
44022023	And as they were crying out and throwing off their clothes , and throwing dust in the air ,
44022024	the commander ordered him to be brought into the barracks , and said for him that he should be given a hearing with scourging , so that he might learn why they were crying thus against him .
44022025	But as they were stretching him out with the thongs , Paul said to the centurion standing there , " Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman , and uncondemned ? "
44022026	And the centurion , hearing this , going to the commander he reported , saying , " Watch what you are about to do , for this man is a Roman . "
44022027	Then the commander came and said to him , " Tell me , are you a Roman ? " He said , " Yes . "
44022028	And the commander answered , " I acquired this citizenship with much money . " And Paul said , " But I was born [ a citizen ] . "
44022029	Then immediately those who were about to interrogate him withdrew from him ; and even the commander was afraid , having learned he was a Roman , and that he had bound him .
44022030	Now on the next day , desiring to know the truth [ as to ] why he was accused by the Jews , he released him from the bonds , and ordered the chief priests and their whole council to come , and brought Paul down and presented [ him ] to them .
44023001	Then Paul , looking intently at the council , said , " Men , brothers , I have lived with all good conscience toward God until this day . "
44023002	But the high priest Ananias commanded those standing by him to strike his mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , " God is about to strike you , you whitewashed wall ! For you sit judging me according to the law , and contrary to the law do you command that I should be struck ? "
44023004	But those standing by said , " Do you revile the high priest of God ? "
44023005	Then Paul said , " I did not know , brothers , that he is the high priest ; for it is written , ' You shall not speak wickedly of a ruler of your people . ' "
44023006	But when Paul perceived that one part was of the Sadducees and the other of the Pharisees , he cried out in the Sanhedrin , " Men , brothers , I am a Pharisee , a son of a Pharisee ; concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged ! "
44023007	And when he had spoken this , there came to be a dispute between the Pharisees and the Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection - nor angel nor spirit ; but the Pharisees confess both .
44023009	And there came to be a great outcry , and the scribes of the Pharisees' party stood up and contended sharply , saying , " We find no evil in this man ; but if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him , let us not fight against God . "
44023010	And when much dissension developed , the commander , fearing lest Paul might be torn apart by them , commanded the detachment of soldiers to go down and seize him from the midst of them , and to bring [ him ] into the barracks .
44023011	Now on the next night the Lord stood by him and said , " Take courage , Paul ; for as you solemnly testified about the things concerning Me in Jerusalem , so you must also testify in Rome . "
44023012	Now when it was day , some of the Jews joined in a conspiracy and bound themselves by a curse , saying neither would they eat nor drink until they would kill Paul .
44023013	And there were over four hundred who had made this plot ;
44023014	who came to the chief priests and to the elders and said , " We have bound ourselves by oath with a curse to taste nothing until we kill Paul .
44023015	Now you , therefore , together with the council , suggest to the commander that he be brought down to you tomorrow , as though you are going to determine more accurately the things concerning him ; but we , before he comes near , are prepared to kill him . "
44023016	But when Paul's sister's son heard about the ambush , he came and entered into the barracks , and told [ this ] to Paul .
44023017	And Paul , summoning one of the centurions and said , " Lead this young man away to the commander , for he has something to tell him . "
44023018	Therefore taking him along , he brought him to the commander and said , " The prisoner Paul , having summoned me , asked me to bring this young man to you , for he has something to say to you . "
44023019	And the commander , taking him by his hand , withdrew to a private place and inquired , " What is it that you have to tell me ? "
44023020	And he said , " The Jews have agreed to ask that tomorrow you bring Paul down to the Sanhedrin , as though they are going to learn something more accurate concerning him .
44023021	Therefore you [ must ] not be persuaded by them ; for more than four hundred of them are lying in wait for him , who have bound themselves by a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they kill him ; and now they are prepared , waiting for the promise from you . "
44023022	Then the commander dismissed the young man , and commanded him , " Tell no one that you have made known these things to me . "
44023023	And having summoned two of the centurions he said , " Make ready two hundred soldiers , and seventy horsemen , and two hundred spearmen , in order that they may go to Caesarea , to leave at the third hour of the night ;
44023024	and place mounts at [ their ] disposal , in order that they may put Paul on them , and bring him safely to Felix the governor . "
44023025	And he wrote a letter which contained this content :
44023026	Claudius Lysias , to the most excellent governor Felix : Greetings .
44023027	This man , having been arrested by the Jews , was about to be killed by them . I came upon [ them ] with the detachment of soldiers and rescued him , having learned that he is a Roman .
44023028	And desiring to know the cause for which they were accusing him , I took him down to their council ;
44023029	and I found that he was accused concerning questions of their law , [ but ] had no accusation [ against him ] worthy of death or chains .
44023030	And when it became known to me that a plot against the man by the Jews was about to happen , I sent him at once to you , and also commanded the accusers to state the charges against him before you . Farewell .
44023031	Then the soldiers , as they were commanded , took Paul and brought him during the night to Antipatris .
44023032	And on the next day they left the horsemen to go on with him , and returned to the barracks .
44023033	When they entered into Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor , [ they ] also presented Paul to him .
44023034	And when the governor read the letter , he asked what province he was from . And learning that he was from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , " I will give you a hearing when your accusers arrive . " And he commanded him to be guarded in Herod's Praetorium .
44024001	Now after five days Ananias the high priest came down with the elders and a certain attorney named Tertullus , who made known to the governor the charges against Paul .
44024002	And when he had been called , Tertullus began to accuse [ him ] , saying : " Attaining much peace by you and successes coming about for this nation by your foresight ,
44024003	both in everything and everywhere we accept [ it ] , most excellent Felix , with all thanksgiving .
44024004	But that I not weary you any longer , I beseech you to hear us briefly in your graciousness .
44024005	For [ we ] have found this man [ to ] be a plague , and [ one ] causing discord among all the Jews throughout the world , and a leader of the Nazarenes sect ,
44024006	who also attempted to profane the temple , whom we also arrested ,
44024008	from whom you will be able , having judged [ him ] yourself , to learn about all these things of which we are accusing him . "
44024009	And the Jews also joined in the attack , asserting that these things were so .
44024010	But Paul answered ( the governor , having nodded for him to speak ) : " Knowing that you have been a judge of this nation for many years , the more cheerfully I defend the things concerning myself ,
44024011	because you being able to know that it has not been more than twelve days since I went up to worship in Jerusalem .
44024012	And they did not find me with anyone in the temple disputing , or inciting a crowd to rise up , neither in the synagogues nor in the city .
44024013	Nor are they able to prove [ against ] me the things about which they are now accusing me .
44024014	But I confess this to you , that according to the Way which they call a sect , so I worship the God of my fathers , believing in all things which are written throughout the Law and in the Prophets ,
44024015	having hope in God , which even they themselves are waiting for , that there is going to be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and the unjust .
44024016	And in this I myself am engaging , having a conscience blameless toward God and men through everything .
44024017	And after many years I arrived to bring alms and offerings to my nation ,
44024018	among whom some Jews from Asia found me , having been purified in the temple , not with a crowd nor with turmoil ,
44024019	who ought to be present before you and to make accusation if anything they might have against me .
44024020	Or let these themselves say what wrong they found in me , when I stood before the council ,
44024021	unless it is because of this one statement which I cried out , standing among them , ' Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged by you today . ' "
44024022	And when he heard these things , Felix adjourned them , knowing more accurately the things [ ] concerning the Way , and said , " When Lysias the commander comes down , I will decide your case . "
44024023	And ordering the centurion to keep watch over Paul and to let him have some liberty , and not to forbid [ any ] of his own to serve or to come to him .
44024024	Now after some days , when Felix arrived with Drusilla his wife , who was Jewish , he sent for Paul and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
44024025	And as he reasoned about righteousness , self-control , and the judgment which is going to be , Felix became afraid and answered , " Go away for now ; but when I have opportunity I will summon you . "
44024026	Meanwhile he also hoped that money would be given him by Paul , that he might release him . Therefore sending for him more often , he was conversing with him .
44024027	But after two years had passed , Felix received Porcius Festus as his successor ; and Felix , desiring to grant favors to the Jews , left Paul in prison .
44025001	Now when Festus had set foot in the province , after three days he went up to Jerusalem from Ceasarea .
44025002	And the high priest and the prominent men of the Jews made known to him the case against Paul ; and they were appealing to him ,
44025003	asking for favor against him , that he would summon him to Jerusalem - while planning an ambush to kill him along the way .
44025004	But Festus answered that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he was about to go there shortly .
44025005	" Therefore , " he said , " the prominent men among you , let them go with me and accuse this man , if there is anything in this man . "
44025006	And when he had stayed among them more than ten days , he went down to Caesarea . And the next day , sitting on the judgment seat , he commanded Paul to be brought .
44025007	When he arrived , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him , bringing many and serious accusations against Paul , which they were not able to prove ,
44025008	while he defended himself , [ saying , ] " Neither against the law of the Jews , nor against the temple , nor against Caesar did I commit any sin . "
44025009	But Festus , desiring to grant a favor to the Jews , answered Paul and said , " Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and there be judged before me concerning these things ? "
44025010	But Paul said , " I am standing before the judicial bench of Caesar , by whom it is necessary [ for ] me to be judged . I have done no wrong to the Jews , as also you know very well .
44025011	For if I am doing wrong , and have done anything worthy of death , I am not trying to escape a death sentence ; but if there is nothing in these things of which these [ people ] are accusing me , no one is able to deliver me to them . I appeal to Caesar . "
44025012	Then Festus , having talked together with the council , answered , " Have you appealed to Caesar ? Before Caesar you shall go ! "
44025013	And after some days King Agrippa and Bernice arrived in Caesarea and greeted Festus .
44025014	And as he was spending many days there , Festus laid before the king the charges against Paul , saying : " There is a certain man who was left a prisoner by Felix ,
44025015	about whom the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , when I was in Jerusalem , asking for punishment against him .
44025016	To them I answered , ' It is not a custom with Romans to deliver any man to destruction before the [ one ] being accused may meet his accusers face to face , and may receive an opportunity for defense concerning the charge . '
44025017	" Therefore when they had assembled here , having made no delay , on the next day I took my seat at the judicial bench , and I commanded the man to be brought [ in ] ;
44025018	concerning whom , when the accusers stood , they brought no accusation of the [ ] things which I was supposing ,
44025019	but had some questions against him about their own religion and about a certain Jesus , who had died , whom Paul affirmed to be living .
44025020	And being uncertain [ as to ] the investigation concerning this , I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these charges .
44025021	But when Paul appealed that he be kept for the decision of His Majesty the Emperor , I commanded him to be kept until I may send him to Caesar . "
44025022	Then Agrippa said to Festus , " I also was wishing to hear the man myself . " " Tomorrow , " he said , " you shall hear him . "
44025023	Therefore on the next day , when Agrippa and Bernice had come with all pomp , and had entered into the auditorium together with the commanders and the prominent men of the city , and when Festus had commanded , Paul was brought .
44025024	And Festus said : " King Agrippa and all the men who are with us , observe this man about whom the people of the Jews petitioned me , both in Jerusalem and here , crying against [ him ] that it is not fitting [ for ] him to live any longer .
44025025	But when I came to understand him to have done nothing worthy of death , and also he had appealed to His Majesty the Emperor , I decided to send him .
44025026	About whom I have nothing certain to write to my lord . Therefore I have brought him before you , and especially before you King Agrippa , in order that when this hearing is finished I may have something to write .
44025027	For it seems unreasonable to me to send a prisoner and not to signify the accusations against him . "
44026001	Then Agrippa said to Paul , " It is permitted for you to speak for yourself . " So Paul , having extended his hand , spoke in his own defense :
44026002	I have considered myself fortunate , King Agrippa , being able to speak in my own defense today , concerning all the things of which I am accused of by the Jews ,
44026003	especially since you are well versed both in all the customs and questions in relation to the Jews ; therefore I beg you to hear me patiently .
44026004	Therefore my way of life from my youth , which from the beginning was spent among my own nation in Jerusalem , all the Jews know ,
44026005	since they have known me for a long time , if they are willing to testify , that according to the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
44026006	And now for the hope of the promise having been made by God to the fathers , I stand before you judged ,
44026007	[ a promise ] to which our twelve tribes , as they earnestly serve God night and day , hope to attain . Concerning which hope I am accused by [ the ] Jews , King Agrippa .
44026008	Why is it considered [ such ] an unbelievable thing by you [ people ] if God raises the dead ?
44026009	Therefore I thought in myself that it was necessary to do many hostile things against the name of Jesus the Nazarene ;
44026010	which also I did in Jerusalem , and many of the saints I shut up in prisons , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were being put to death , I cast my vote against them .
44026011	And I punished them often in all the synagogues , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly enraged against them , I persecuted them even as far as to foreign cities .
44026012	" In which [ pursuits ] also , as I traveled to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
44026013	at midday , O king , along the road I saw a light from heaven , brighter than the sun , shining around me and those traveling with me .
44026014	And when we all had fallen down to the ground , I heard a voice speaking to me and saying in the Hebrew language , ' Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting Me ? It is hard for you to kick against the goads . '
44026015	" So I said , ' Who are You , Lord ? ' And He said , ' I am Jesus , whom you are persecuting .
44026016	But arise and stand on your feet ; for I have appeared to you , to appoint you a minister and a witness both [ of the things ] which you have seen , and [ of the things ] which I will yet reveal to you ,
44026017	delivering you from the people , and from the Gentiles , to whom I am sending you ,
44026018	to open their eyes , in order to turn them from darkness to light , and from the authority of Satan to God , [ in order for ] them to receive forgiveness of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in Me . '
44026019	" Therefore , King Agrippa , I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision ,
44026020	but to those first in Damascus and in Jerusalem , and throughout all the region of Judea , and to the Gentiles , proclaiming that they must repent and turn to God , and do works worthy of repentance .
44026021	Because of these things the Jews arrested me in the temple and attempted to kill me .
44026022	Therefore , having obtained help from God , until this day I stand , witnessing both to common [ people ] and great [ people ] , saying nothing except the things which both the prophets and Moses spoke of as being about to happen ,
44026023	that the Christ was to suffer , that as the first to rise from the dead , He was about to proclaim light to the Jewish people and to the Gentiles . "
44026024	Now as he spoke these things , Festus said with a loud voice , " You are mad , Paul ! Your higher learning is driving you to madness ! "
44026025	But he said , " I am not mad , most excellent Festus , but I boldly declare words of truth and reason .
44026026	For the king knows about these things , to whom also I speak freely ; for I am persuaded that none of these things escapes his notice , since this thing was not done in a corner .
44026027	" Do you believe the prophets , King Agrippa ? I know that you believe . "
44026028	And Agrippa said to Paul , " In a short time , you are persuading me to become a Christian ! "
44026029	And Paul said , " I would pray to God , both in a short time and a long time , not only you , but also all who are hearing me today , would become such as I am , except for these chains . "
44026030	When he had said these things , the king stood up , as well as the governor and Bernice and those sitting together with them ;
44026031	and when they withdrew , they were speaking among themselves , saying , " This man practices nothing worthy of death or chains . "
44026032	Then Agrippa said to Festus , " This man could have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar . "
44027001	Now when it was decided that we should sail away to Italy , they handed over both Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius , of the Augustan Regiment .
44027002	And having boarded a ship of Adramyttium , scheduled to sail to the ports along the Asian coasts , we put to sea . Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
44027003	And the next day we put in to harbor at Sidon . And Julius treated Paul kindly , and permitted [ him ] to go to [ his ] friends to find care .
44027004	And from there having put to sea , we sailed under the sheltered side of Cyprus , because the winds were against us .
44027005	And having sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia , we docked at Myra , in Lycia .
44027006	And there the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing to Italy , and he put us aboard in it .
44027007	And sailing slowly many days , and with difficulty arriving down off Cnidus , since the wind would not permit us to go on , we sailed under the sheltered side of Crete , down off Salmone .
44027008	And with difficulty sailing past it , we came to a place called Fair Havens , near the city of Lasea .
44027009	Now when much time had been spent , the voyage having already become dangerous , because the Fast had already gone by , Paul recommended ,
44027010	saying to them , " Men , I perceive this voyage is going to be with hardship and much loss , not only of the cargo and of the ship but also our lives . "
44027011	But the centurion was persuaded by the helmsman and the ship owner , rather than by the things being said by Paul .
44027012	And because the harbor was not suitable to winter in , the majority gave counsel to put to sea from there , if perhaps they might be able to get to Phoenix to spend the winter there , a harbor of Crete opening toward the southwest and to the northwest .
44027013	And when a south wind blew gently , supposing they had attained their purpose , they weighed anchor and sailed along close in shore to Crete .
44027014	But not long after , a head wind like a hurricane arose , called [ a ] Euroclydon ;
44027015	and when the ship was seized by it , and not being able to face into the wind , we were being driven along , [ having ] given in [ to the wind . ]
44027016	And running under the sheltered side of a certain little island called Clauda , we secured the skiff with difficulty .
44027017	And having hoisted it up , they used cables for undergirding the ship ; and being afraid lest they run aground in the Syrtes [ Shallows ] , they let down the driving anchor , thus they were being driven along [ by the wind . ]
44027018	And because we were exceedingly tempest - tossed , the next day they lightened the ship .
44027019	And on the third day we threw off the equipment of the ship with our own hands .
44027020	And neither the sun nor stars appeared for many days , and no small storm pressed on us , finally all hope for us to be saved was taken away .
44027021	Now when they had abstained from food for a long time , then stood Paul in the midst of them and said , " Men , you should have followed my advice and not put to sea from Crete , and to spare [ yourselves ] this hardship and loss .
44027022	And now I urge you to keep up [ your ] courage , for there will be loss of not one life among you , only of the ship .
44027023	For there stood by me this night an angel of the God to whom I belong , whom also I serve ,
44027024	saying , ' Do not be afraid , Paul ; for it is necessary for you to stand before Caesar ; and behold , God has granted you all those sailing with you . '
44027025	" Therefore keep up your courage , men ; for I believe God that it will be in the very manner it has been spoken to me .
44027026	However , it is necessary [ for ] us to run aground on a certain island . "
44027027	Now when it was the fourteenth night , as we were driven about in the Adriatic Sea , in the middle of the night the sailors sensed that land was approaching them .
44027028	And having taken a sounding , they found it to be twenty fathoms ; and when they had gone a little farther , they took soundings again and found it to be fifteen fathoms ;
44027029	and being afraid lest we should run aground on the rocks , they threw out four anchors from the stern , and were praying for day to come .
44027030	Now as the sailors were seeking to flee from the ship , and letting down the skiff into the sea , in pretense of spreading out anchors from the prow ,
44027031	Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers , " If these men do not remain in the ship , you cannot be saved . "
44027032	Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the skiff and let it fall off .
44027033	And until the [ time ] was about to be day , Paul was urging them all to receive their share of food , saying , " Today is the fourteenth day you continue waiting without eating , having taken nothing .
44027034	Therefore I urge you to take food , for this is for your deliverance ; for not a hair from your head shall fall . "
44027035	And having said these things and having taken bread , he gave thanks to God in the presence of all , and having broken it , he began to eat .
44027036	And they all became cheerful and also took food themselves .
44027037	And in all we were two hundred and seventy-six persons on the ship .
44027038	And having eaten enough , they began lightening the ship and throwing out the wheat into the sea .
44027039	Now when it became day , they did not recognize the land ; but they noticed a certain bay which had a beach , on which they resolved , if possible , to run the ship ashore .
44027040	And casting off the anchors , they were leaving them in the sea , meanwhile loosening the ropes of the rudders ; and having raised the mainsail to the wind , they began steering toward the beach .
44027041	But they struck a reef and ran the vessel aground , and the prow became stuck and remained unmoved , but the stern was being broken up by the violence of the waves .
44027042	And the soldiers' decision was that they would kill the prisoners , lest any should swim away and escape .
44027043	But the centurion , wanting to rescue Paul , hindered them in their intention , and commanded that those who were able to swim to jump down first to go toward the land ,
44027044	and the rest , some on boards and others on parts from the ship . And in this way it came about that all were brought to safety .
44028001	And when they were rescued , then they learned that the island was called Malta .
44028002	And the natives were showing us extraordinary kindness ; for having kindled a fire they accepted us all into [ their ] society , because of the rain which had begun , and because of the cold .
44028003	But when Paul had gathered a large bundle of sticks and put them on the fire , a viper having come out because of the heat , fastened on his hand .
44028004	And when the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand , they said to one another , " Certainly this man is a murderer , whom though he was rescued from the sea , justice does not permit to continue living . "
44028005	Then , having shaken off the creature into the fire , he suffered nothing harmful .
44028006	And they were expecting him to be about to swell up or suddenly fall down dead . But after they had waited for a long time and observed nothing unusual happening to him , they changed their minds and said that he was a god .
44028007	Now in the areas around that place were pieces of land [ belonging ] to the leading citizen of the island , named Publius , who welcomed us , and received us hospitably as guests for three days .
44028008	And it came to pass that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and dysentery , to whom Paul came in and prayed , and laying his hands on him , healed him .
44028009	Then after this happened , also the rest who were ill on the island were coming to him and were being healed ,
44028010	who also honored us with many honors , and when we put to sea , they gave us the things that we needed .
44028011	Now after three months we put to sea in a ship that had wintered on the island , [ belonging ] to Alexandria , with the figurehead of the Twin Brothers .
44028012	And putting in to harbor at Syracuse , we stayed there three days ,
44028013	from where having sailed around we arrived at Rhegium . And after one day arose a south wind , on the second day we came to Puteoli ,
44028014	where having found brothers , we were urged by them to stay for seven days ; and so we came to Rome .
44028015	And from there the brothers , when they heard about our circumstances , they came to meet with us as far as Appii Forum and Three Inns , whom when Paul saw , he gave thanks to God and took courage .
44028016	Now when we came to Rome , the centurion handed over the prisoners to the captain of the guard ; but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier guarding him .
44028017	And it came to pass after three days that Paul called together those who were prominent among the Jews ; and when they had come together , he said to them : " Men , brothers , though I have done nothing against the people or the customs of our forefathers , yet I was handed over as a prisoner from Jerusalem , into the hands of the Romans ,
44028018	who , when they had examined me , were wanting to release me because there was no cause for my case .
44028019	But when the Jews spoke in opposition , I was compelled to appeal to Caesar , not that I had anything of which to accuse my nation .
44028020	Therefore for this reason I have requested you , to see and to speak to you , for because of the hope of Israel I am wearing this chain . "
44028021	Then they said to him , " We neither received letters from Judea concerning you , nor have any of the brothers who arrived report or speak anything evil about you .
44028022	But we request to hear from you the [ ] things which you think ; for concerning this sect , it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against . "
44028023	And having appointed for him a day , many came to him at his house , to whom he was explaining and solemnly testifying to the kingdom of God , and persuading them of the things concerning Jesus from both the Law of Moses and from the Prophets , from morning till evening .
44028024	And some were persuaded by the things being said , but others refused to believe .
44028025	And being in disagreement with one another , they went away after Paul had said one word : " The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah the prophet to our fathers ,
44028026	saying , ' Go to this people and say : " Hearing you will hear , and by no means understand ; and seeing you shall see , and by no means perceive ;
44028027	For the hearts of this people has become dull . Their ears are hard of hearing , and their eyes have closed , lest they should see with their eyes and they should hear with their ears , lest they should understand with their heart and turn back , so that I should heal them . " '
44028028	" Therefore let it be known to you that the salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles , and they will hear it ! "
44028029	And when he had said these things , the Jews went away , having a great dispute among themselves .
44028030	Then Paul remained two full years in his own rented house , and he was receiving all those who were coming to him ,
44028031	preaching the kingdom of God and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness , without hindrance .
45001001	Paul , a bondservant of Jesus Christ , called [ to be ] an apostle , having been separated unto the gospel of God
45001002	which He promised beforehand through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures ,
45001003	concerning His Son , who came of [ the ] seed of David according to the flesh ,
45001004	who was declared Son of God with power according to the Spirit of holiness by the resurrection of [ the ] dead , Jesus Christ our Lord ,
45001005	through whom we received grace and apostleship for [ the ] obedience of faith among all the nations for His name ,
45001006	among whom you also are the called of Jesus Christ :
45001007	To all those who are in Rome , beloved of God , called [ to be ] saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001008	First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all , that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world .
45001009	For God is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of His Son , that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers ,
45001010	requesting if somehow now at sometime I shall succeed in the will of God to come to you .
45001011	For I long to see you , so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift , that you may be established -
45001012	that is , that I may be encouraged together with you through the mutual faith both of you and me .
45001013	Now I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , that often I planned to come to you ( and I was hindered until now ) , that I might have some fruit among you also , just as among the other Gentiles .
45001014	I am a debtor both to Greeks and to barbarians , both to [ the ] wise and to [ the ] unwise .
45001015	So , as much as is in me , I am eager to preach the gospel to you who are in Rome also .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ , for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believes , both to the Jew first and to the Greek .
45001017	For in it [ the ] righteousness of God is revealed from faith to faith ; as it is written , " The just shall live by faith . "
45001018	For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven upon all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men who suppress the truth in unrighteousness .
45001019	Because that which is known of God is manifest in them , for God has shown [ it ] to them .
45001020	For the invisible things of Him from the creation of [ ] the world are clearly seen , being understood by the things made , both His eternal power and divinity , so that they are without excuse .
45001021	Because , having known God , they did not glorify [ Him ] as God , or give thanks , but became vain in their reasonings , and their foolish heart was darkened .
45001022	Asserting themselves to be wise , they became fools ,
45001023	and changed the glory of the incorruptible God for a likeness of an image of corruptible man and of birds and four-footed animals and reptiles .
45001024	Therefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of the own hearts , to dishonor their own bodies among themselves ,
45001025	who exchanged the truth of God for the lie , and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator , who is blessed forever . Amen .
45001026	For this reason God gave them up to shameful lusts , for even their women exchanged the natural use for that which is contrary to nature ,
45001027	and likewise also the men , having forsaken the natural use of the woman , were inflamed by their lust for one another , men with men , committing what is shameful , and receiving in themselves the recompense which was fitting for their error .
45001028	And just as they did not approve to have God in their knowledge , God gave them up to a reprobate mind , to do the things which are not fitting ;
45001029	having been filled with all unrighteousness , fornication , wickedness , greed , malice ; full of envy , murder , strife , deceit , maliciousness ; they are whisperers ,
45001030	slanderers , haters of God , insolent men , proud , braggarts , inventors of evil things , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	without understanding , untrustworthy , unloving , unforgiving , unmerciful ;
45001032	who , having known the righteous judgment of God , that those practicing such things are worthy of death , not only do them , but also approve of those who practice them .
45002001	Therefore you are inexcusable , O man , everyone who judges , for in whatever you judge another you condemn yourself , for you who judge are practicing the same things .
45002002	But we know that the judgment of God is according to truth upon those practicing such things .
45002003	But do you suppose this , O man , you who judge those practicing such things yet doing them , that you will escape the judgment of God ?
45002004	Or do you despise the riches of His kindness and tolerance and patience , not knowing that the kindness of God leads you to repentance ?
45002005	But according to your hardness and impenitent heart you are storing up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation , and of the righteous judgment of God ,
45002006	who will recompense to each one according to his works :
45002007	to those who by the endurance of good works are seeking glory and honor and incorruption - eternal life .
45002008	But to those who are contentious , and who disobey the truth , but obey unrighteousness - indignation and wrath ,
45002009	tribulation and anguish , upon every soul of man that works evil , of the Jew first and also of the Greek ;
45002010	but glory , honor , and peace to everyone that works good , both to the Jew first and to the Greek .
45002011	For there is no partiality with God .
45002012	For all who have sinned without the law shall also perish without the law , and all who have sinned under the law shall be judged by the law
45002013	( for [ it is ] not the hearers of the law [ who ] are righteous before God , but the doers of the law shall be justified ;
45002014	for whenever Gentiles , who do not have the law , by nature do what the law requires , these , not having the law , are a law unto themselves ,
45002015	who show the work of the law written in their hearts , their conscience witnessing with [ them ] , and among themselves their thoughts accuse or even defend [ them ] ) ,
45002016	in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men according to my gospel through Jesus Christ .
45002017	Behold , you are called a Jew , and rely on the law , and boast in God ,
45002018	and know His will , and approve the things that are more excellent , being instructed out of the law ,
45002019	and are convinced that you are a guide to the blind , a light to those in darkness ,
45002020	an instructor of the foolish , a teacher of the immature , having the embodiment of knowledge and of the truth in the law .
45002021	You , therefore , who teach another , do you not teach yourself ? You who preach that a man should not steal , do you steal ?
45002022	You who say , " Do not commit adultery , " do you commit adultery ? You who abhor idols , do you commit sacrilege ?
45002023	You who boast in the law , do you dishonor God through the transgression of the law ?
45002024	For " The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you , " just as it is written .
45002025	For indeed circumcision profits if you keep the law ; but if you are a transgressor of the law , your circumcision has become uncircumcision .
45002026	Therefore , if an uncircumcised man keeps the righteous requirements of the law , will not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision ?
45002027	And will not the physically uncircumcised , who keeps the law , judge you along with your written [ code ] and circumcision , as a lawbreaker ?
45002028	For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly , nor is circumcision that which is outward in flesh ;
45002029	but he [ is ] a Jew that [ is one ] inwardly ; and circumcision is of the heart , in [ the ] spirit , not in [ the ] letter , whose praise is not from men but from God .
45003001	What then [ is ] the superiority of the Jew , or what is the profit of circumcision ?
45003002	Much in every way ! First of all , that they were entrusted with the [ very ] words of God !
45003003	For what if some did not believe ? Will their unbelief nullify the faithfulness of God ?
45003004	By no means ! Indeed , let God be true but every man a liar , just as it is written : " That You may be justified in Your words , and You may prevail when You are judged . "
45003005	But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? [ Surely ] God , the [ One ] inflicting wrath is not unrighteous , is [ He ] ? ( I speak as a man ) .
45003006	By no means ! For otherwise how shall God judge the world ?
45003007	For if by my lie the truth of God has abounded to His glory , why am I also still judged as a sinner ?
45003008	And why not say , " Let us do evil so that good may come " ? - just as we are slandered , and just as some affirm that we say . [ The ] judgment of whom is just .
45003009	What then ? Are we [ any ] better ? Not at all . For we previously charged both Jews and Greeks that they are all under sin .
45003010	Just as it is written : " There is none righteous , no not one ,
45003011	There is none who understands ; there is none who seeks God .
45003012	All [ have ] turned aside ; together they became unprofitable ; there is not [ one ] doing kindness , there is not so much as one . "
45003013	" Their throat is an opened grave ; with their tongues they deceived " ; " [ the ] poison of asps is under their lips " ;
45003014	" Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness .
45003015	Their feet are swift to shed blood ;
45003016	Ruin and misery are in their ways ;
45003017	And the way of peace they did not know .
45003018	There is no fear of God before their eyes . "
45003019	Now we know that as many things as the law says , it speaks to those under the law , so that every mouth may be stopped , and all the world may become guilty before God .
45003020	Therefore by works of the law no flesh shall be justified in His sight , for through the law [ comes ] [ the ] knowledge of sin .
45003021	But now the righteousness of God apart from the law has been revealed , being witnessed to by the Law and the Prophets ,
45003022	even the righteousness of God , through [ the ] faithfulness of Jesus Christ , to all and upon all those that believe . For there is no distinction ;
45003023	for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God ,
45003024	being justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus ,
45003025	whom God set forth as a propitiation through faith in His blood , for a demonstration of His righteousness through the passing over of the sins having previously committed , in the forbearance of God ,
45003026	for a demonstration of His righteousness in the present time , that He might be just and the justifier of he who has [ the ] faith of Jesus .
45003027	Where then is the boasting ? It is excluded . Through what law ? Of works ? No , but through the law of faith .
45003028	Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith apart from works of the law .
45003029	Or is He the God of the Jews only ? But is He not also the God of the Gentiles ? Yes , of the Gentiles also ,
45003030	since there is one God who will justify [ the ] circumcision by faith , and the uncircumcised through faith .
45003031	Therefore do we nullify the law through faith ? By no means ! On the contrary , we uphold [ the ] law .
45004001	What then shall we say that Abraham our father has found according to the flesh ?
45004002	For if Abraham was justified by works , he has [ grounds for ] boasting , but not before God .
45004003	For what does the Scripture say ? " Abraham believed God , and it was credited to him as righteousness . "
45004004	Now to him who works , his wage is not reckoned as a gift , but as his due .
45004005	But to him who does not work but believes on Him who justifies the ungodly , his faith is credited as righteousness ,
45004006	just as David also speaks of the blessing of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works :
45004007	" Blessed [ are ] [ they ] whose lawless deeds have been forgiven , and whose sins have been covered ;
45004008	Blessed is the man to whom the LORD shall by no means impute sin . "
45004009	Does this blessing then come upon the circumcision , or also upon the uncircumcised ? For we say that faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness .
45004010	How then was it credited ? While he was circumcised , or in uncircumcision ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision .
45004011	And he received the sign of circumcision , a seal of the righteousness of the faith which [ he had while ] in uncircumcision , so that he should be the father of all those that believe , although uncircumcised , so that righteousness should also be imputed to them ,
45004012	and the father of circumcision to those not only of circumcision , but also to those following in the steps of the faith which our father Abraham [ had while ] in uncircumcision .
45004013	For the promise that he should be heir of the world was not to Abraham or to his seed through [ the ] law , but through [ the ] righteousness of faith .
45004014	For if those who are of [ the ] law are heirs , faith is made void and the promise has been nullified ,
45004015	because the law produces wrath ; for where there is no law neither is there transgression .
45004016	Therefore it is of faith that it may be according to grace , so that the promise might be sure to all the seed , not only to those [ ] of the law , but also to those of the faith of Abraham , who is the father of us all ,
45004017	( just as it is written , " I have appointed you a father of many nations " ) before God , whom he believed , the [ One ] who gives life to the dead and calls those things which are not as though they were ;
45004018	who , contrary to hope , on hope believed , so that he should become a father of many nations , according to what was spoken , " So shall your descendants be . "
45004019	And not weakening in faith , he did not consider his own body , already having been worn out ( being about a hundred years old ) , and the deadness of Sarah's womb ,
45004020	he did not waver at the promise of God in unbelief , but was empowered by faith , giving glory to God ,
45004021	and being fully convinced that what He had promised He was also able to do .
45004022	And therefore " it was credited to him as righteousness . "
45004023	Now it was not written for his sake alone that it was credited to him ,
45004024	but for us also , to whom it was going to be credited , those believing on Him who raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead ,
45004025	who was delivered up for our transgressions , and was raised for our justification .
45005001	Therefore , having been justified by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
45005002	through whom we have also obtained access by faith into this grace in which we stand , and we rejoice in hope of the glory of God .
45005003	And not only that , but we also rejoice in tribulations , knowing that tribulation produces endurance ;
45005004	and endurance , character ; and character , hope .
45005005	And hope does not put to shame , because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts by the Holy Spirit who was given to us .
45005006	For while we were still weak , in due time Christ died for the ungodly .
45005007	For scarcely on behalf of a righteous [ man ] will anyone die ; yet perhaps for a good man someone might even dare to die .
45005008	But God demonstrates His own love toward us , in that while we were still sinners , Christ died for us .
45005009	Much more then , having now been justified by His blood , we shall be saved from wrath through Him .
45005010	For if while we were enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of His Son , much more , having been reconciled , we shall be saved by His life .
45005011	And not only that , but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom now we received the reconciliation .
45005012	Therefore , just as through one man sin entered the world , and death through sin , and thus death passed to all men , because all sinned -
45005013	( For until the law sin was in the world , but sin is not imputed when there is no law .
45005014	Yet death reigned from Adam to Moses , even over those who did not sin according to the likeness of the transgression of Adam , who is a type of Him who was to come .
45005015	But the free gift is not like the transgression . For if by the transgression of the one man many died , much more the grace of God and the gift by the grace of the one Man , Jesus Christ , abounded to the many .
45005016	And the gift is not as by one having sinned . For the judgment [ which came ] from one [ transgression resulted ] in condemnation , but the free gift from many offenses [ brought ] justification .
45005017	For if by the transgression of the one man death reigned through the one [ man ] , much more those receiving the abundance of the grace and of the gift of righteousness will reign in life through the One , Jesus Christ ) .
45005018	So then , as through one [ man's ] transgression [ judgment came ] to all men , resulting in condemnation , even so through one [ Man's ] righteous act the free gift came to all men , resulting in justification of life .
45005019	For through the disobedience of the one man the many were constituted sinners , so also through the obedience of the One many shall be constituted righteous .
45005020	But [ the ] law came in alongside , so that the offense might abound . But where sin abounded , grace superabounded ,
45005021	so that just as sin reigned in death , so also grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	What shall we say then ? Shall we go on sinning so that grace may abound ?
45006002	By no means ! We died to sin - How shall we live any longer in it ?
45006003	Or do you not know that as many [ of us ] as were baptized into Christ Jesus have been baptized into His death ?
45006004	Therefore we were buried with Him through baptism into death , so that just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father , so we also should walk in newness of life .
45006005	For if we have been united together in the likeness of His death , certainly we shall also be [ in the likeness ] of [ His ] resurrection ;
45006006	knowing this , that our old man was crucified [ with Him ] , so that the body of sin may be done away with , [ that ] we should no longer serve sin .
45006007	For he who has died has been justified from sin .
45006008	But if we died with Christ , we believe that we also shall live together with Him ,
45006009	knowing that Christ , having been raised from the dead , no longer dies . Death is no longer master [ over ] Him .
45006010	For what [ death ] He died , He died to sin once for all ; but what [ life ] He lives , He lives to God .
45006011	Likewise you also , consider yourselves to be dead indeed to sin , but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45006012	Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body , that you should obey it in its lusts ,
45006013	nor present your members as instruments of unrighteousness to sin , but present yourselves to God as being alive from the dead , and your members as instruments of righteousness to God .
45006014	For sin shall not be master over you , for you are not under law but under grace .
45006015	What then ? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace ? By no means !
45006016	Do you not know that to whom you present yourselves as obedient slaves , you are slaves to whom you obey , whether of sin [ resulting ] in death , or of obedience [ resulting ] in righteousness ?
45006017	But thanks be to God , that though you used to be slaves of sin , yet you obeyed from [ your ] heart that form of doctrine to which you were delivered .
45006018	And having been freed from sin , you became enslaved to righteousness .
45006019	I speak in human terms on account of the weakness of your flesh . For just as you presented your members as slaves to uncleanness , and to lawlessness [ resulting ] in [ more ] lawlessness , so now present your members as slaves to righteousness [ resulting ] in sanctification .
45006020	For when you were slaves of sin , you were free in regard to righteousness .
45006021	So what fruit did you have then of which [ things ] you are now ashamed ? For the end of those things is death .
45006022	But now having been freed from sin , and having become enslaved to God , you have your fruit [ resulting ] in sanctification , and the end , eternal life .
45006023	For the wages of sin [ is ] death , but the gift of God [ is ] eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Or do you not know , brothers ( for I speak to those knowing the law ) , that the law has jurisdiction over a man as long as he lives ?
45007002	For the woman who is under a man has been bound by law to the living husband . But if the husband should die , she is released from the law of the husband .
45007003	So then , while the husband is living , she will be called an adulteress if she becomes [ married ] to a different husband ; but if her husband should die , she is free from the law , so that she is not an adulteress , having become [ married ] to a different husband .
45007004	Therefore , my brothers , you also were put to death to the law through the body of Christ , that you may be married to another - to Him who was raised from the dead , so that we might bear fruit to God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , the sinful passions aroused through the law were at work in our members to bear fruit to death .
45007006	But now we were released from the law , having died in [ that ] to which we were held fast , so that we should serve as slaves in the newness of the Spirit and not in the oldness of the letter .
45007007	What shall we say then ? Is the law sin ? By no means ! On the contrary , I would not have known sin except through the law . For I would not have known lust unless the law had said , " You shall not covet . "
45007008	But sin , taking opportunity through the commandment , produced in me every kind of lust . For apart from the law sin [ was ] dead .
45007009	For I was alive apart from the law once , but when the commandment came , sin revived , but I died .
45007010	And the commandment , which [ was ] to [ bring ] life , I found to [ bring ] death .
45007011	For sin , taking opportunity by the commandment , deceived me , and by it , killed me .
45007012	Therefore the law indeed is holy , and the commandment holy and righteous and good .
45007013	Then has that which is good become death to me ? By no means ! But sin , that it might appear sin , was producing death in me through that which is good , so that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful .
45007014	For we know that the law is spiritual , but I am carnal , having been sold under sin .
45007015	For what I am doing , I do not know . For what I want to do , I do not do ; but what I hate , this I do .
45007016	But if I do what I do not want to do , I agree with the law that [ it is ] good .
45007017	But now [ it is ] no longer I [ who ] am doing it , but the sin living in me .
45007018	For I know that in me ( that is , in my flesh ) nothing good dwells ; for to will is present with me , but [ how ] to do the good , I do not find .
45007019	For the good that I want to do I do not do ; but the evil I do not want to do , this I practice .
45007020	But if I do what I do not want to do , it is no longer I [ who ] do it , but the sin living in me .
45007021	Therefore I find this law , that [ when ] I wish to do the right [ thing ] , evil is right there with me .
45007022	For I delight in the law of God in my inner being .
45007023	But I see a different law in my members , waging war against the law of my mind , and capturing me by the law of sin which is in my members .
45007024	O wretched man that I am ! Who shall deliver me from this body of death ?
45007025	I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord ! So then , I myself with the mind serve the law of God , but with the flesh the law of sin .
45008001	[ There is ] therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus , who do not walk according to the flesh , but according to the Spirit .
45008002	For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and of death .
45008003	For what [ was ] impossible [ for ] the law to do in that it was weak through the flesh , God [ did ] by sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh , and concerning sin , He condemned sin in the flesh ,
45008004	so that the righteous requirement of the law might be fulfilled in us who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Spirit .
45008005	For those who are fleshly set their minds on the things of the flesh , but those [ who live ] according to the Spirit , the things of the Spirit .
45008006	For the mind set on the flesh is death , but the mind set on the Spirit is life and peace .
45008007	Because the mind set on the flesh is hostile toward God ; for it does not submit to the law of God , nor indeed can it .
45008008	And those that are in the flesh cannot please God .
45008009	But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit , if indeed the Spirit of God dwells in you . But if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ , he is not His .
45008010	But if Christ is in you , the body indeed is dead because of sin , but the Spirit is alive because of righteousness .
45008011	But if the Spirit of Him who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you , He who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through His Spirit indwelling in you .
45008012	Therefore , brothers , we are debtors - not to the flesh , to live according to the flesh .
45008013	For if you live according to the flesh you shall die ; but if by [ the ] Spirit you put to death the practices of the body , you will live .
45008014	For as many as are led by the Spirit of God , these are sons of God .
45008015	For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again unto fear , but you received the Spirit of adoption by whom we cry out , " Abba , Father . "
45008016	The Spirit Himself bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God .
45008017	And if children , then heirs - heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ , if indeed we suffer together , so that we may also be glorified together .
45008018	For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy [ to be compared ] with the coming glory to be revealed in us .
45008019	For the earnest expectation of the creation eagerly awaits the unveiling of the sons of God .
45008020	For the creation was subjected to futility , not willingly , but on account of Him who subjected it in hope ;
45008021	because even the creation itself shall be freed from the slavery of corruption into the freedom of the glory of the children of God .
45008022	For we know that all the creation groans together and labors in birth together until now .
45008023	And not only that , but also [ we ] ourselves having the firstfruits of the Spirit , even we ourselves groan within ourselves , eagerly waiting adoption , the redemption of our body .
45008024	For by this hope we were saved , but hope that is seen is not hope ; for why does one still hope for what he [ ] sees ?
45008025	But if we hope for what we do not see , we eagerly await it with endurance .
45008026	Likewise the Spirit also helps in our weaknesses . For we do not know what we should pray for as we ought , but the Spirit Himself intercedes for us with inexpressible groanings .
45008027	But He that searches the hearts knows what the mind of the Spirit is , because He intercedes on behalf of the saints according to [ the will ] [ of ] God .
45008028	And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God , to those who are called according to [ His ] purpose .
45008029	Because whom He foreknew , He also predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son , that He might be the firstborn among many brothers .
45008030	Moreover whom He predestined , these He also called ; and whom He called , these He also justified ; and whom He justified , these He also glorified .
45008031	What then shall we say to these things ? If God is for us , who [ can be ] against us ?
45008032	He who did not spare His own Son , but gave Him up on behalf of us all , how shall He not with Him also freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who shall bring an accusation against God's elect ? It is God who justifies .
45008034	Who is he that condemns ? Christ is the [ One ] having died , but rather also having been raised , who is even at [ the ] right [ hand ] of God , who also intercedes on our behalf .
45008035	Who shall separate us from the love of Christ ? Shall tribulation , or distress , or persecution , or famine , or nakedness , or danger , or sword ?
45008036	Just as it is written : " For Your sake we are put to death the whole day long ; we are accounted as sheep for slaughter . "
45008037	But in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us .
45008038	For I am convinced that neither death nor life , nor angels nor principalities nor powers , nor things present nor things to come ,
45008039	nor height nor depth , nor anything else in creation , shall be able to separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I am speaking the truth in Christ , I am not lying , my conscience witnessing with me in the Holy Spirit ,
45009002	that I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart .
45009003	For I could wish that I myself to be accursed from Christ on behalf of my brothers , my countrymen according to the flesh ,
45009004	who are Israelites , of whom are the adoption , and the glory , and the covenants , and the law-giving , and the worship , and the promises ;
45009005	of whom are the fathers and from whom Christ [ came ] , according to the flesh , He who is God over all , blessed forever . Amen .
45009006	But it is not as though the word of God has failed . For not all those of Israel [ are of ] Israel ,
45009007	nor [ are they ] all children because they are the seed of Abraham ; but , " In Isaac your seed shall be called . "
45009008	That is , those who are the children of the flesh are not the children of God ; but [ it is ] the children of the promise that are regarded as descendants .
45009009	For this is the word of promise : " At this time I will come and Sarah shall have a son . "
45009010	And not only this , but also Rebecca having conception from one [ man ] , our father Isaac ;
45009011	for [ the children ] not yet being born , nor having done anything good or evil , that the purpose of God according to election might abide , not of works but of Him who calls ,
45009012	it was said to her , " The older shall serve the younger . "
45009013	As it is written , " Jacob I loved , but Esau I hated . "
45009014	What shall we say then ? [ Is ] there unrighteousness with God ? By no means !
45009015	For He says to Moses , " I will have mercy on whomever I will have mercy , and I will have compassion on whomever I will have compassion . "
45009016	So then it is not of him that wills , nor of him that runs , but of God who shows mercy .
45009017	For the Scripture says to Pharaoh , " For this very purpose I have raised you up , that I may show My power in you , and that My name may be proclaimed in all the earth . "
45009018	So then He has mercy on whom He wills , and whom He wills He hardens .
45009019	You will say to me then , " Why does He still find fault ? For who can resist His will ? "
45009020	But indeed , O man , who are you to [ be ] answering back against God ? Shall the thing formed say to him who formed it , " Why have you made me like this ? "
45009021	Or does not the potter have the right over the clay , from the same lump to make one vessel for honor and the other for dishonor ?
45009022	But what if God , wanting to show His wrath and to make His power known , endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath prepared for destruction ,
45009023	and so that He might make known the riches of His glory on the vessels of mercy , which He had prepared beforehand for glory ,
45009024	even us whom He called , not only of the Jews , but also of the Gentiles ?
45009025	As also in Hosea He says : " I will call those My people who were not My people , and her beloved , who was not beloved . "
45009026	" And it shall be in the place where it was said to them , ' You are not My people , ' there they shall be called sons of the living God . "
45009027	Isaiah also cries out concerning Israel : " Though the number of the sons of Israel were as the sand of the sea , the remnant shall be saved ;
45009028	For He is finishing and cutting short an account in righteousness , because the LORD will make a short account upon the earth . "
45009029	And just as Isaiah foretold : " If the LORD of hosts had not left us a seed , we would have become like Sodom , and would have resembled Gomorrah . "
45009030	What shall we say then ? That Gentiles , who did not pursue righteousness , have attained righteousness , even the righteousness of faith ;
45009031	but Israel , pursuing a law of righteousness , did not attain to the law of righteousness .
45009032	Why ? Because [ they did ] not [ seek it ] by faith , but rather by the works of the law . For they stumbled at that stone of stumbling .
45009033	Just as it is written : " Behold , I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and rock of offense , and everyone believing on Him will not be put to shame . "
45010001	Brothers , the good pleasure of my heart and my supplication to God on behalf of Israel , is for [ their ] salvation .
45010002	For I testify concerning them , that they have a zeal for God , but not according to knowledge .
45010003	For they , being ignorant of the righteousness of God , and seeking to establish their own righteousness , have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God .
45010004	For Christ is the end of [ the ] law for righteousness to everyone that believes .
45010005	For Moses writes about the righteousness which [ is ] of the law , " That the man who does those things shall live by them . "
45010006	But the righteousness of faith says , " Do not say in your heart , ' Who shall ascend into heaven ? ' " ( that is , to bring Christ down )
45010007	or , " ' Who shall descend into the abyss ? ' " ( that is , to bring up Christ from the dead ) .
45010008	But what does it say ? " The word is near you , in your mouth and in your heart " ( that is , the word of faith which we proclaim ) :
45010009	that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and you believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead , you shall be saved .
45010010	For with the heart one believes and is justified , and with the mouth one confesses and is saved .
45010011	For the Scripture says , " Whoever believes on Him shall not be put to shame . "
45010012	For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek , for the same Lord of all is rich to all who call on Him .
45010013	For " whosoever shall call upon the name of the LORD shall be saved . "
45010014	How then shall they call on Him in [ ] whom they have not believed ? And how shall they believe in Him of whom they have not heard ? And how shall they hear apart from a preacher ?
45010015	And how shall they preach unless they are sent ? Just as it is written : " How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace , of those preaching the gospel of good things ! "
45010016	But they have not all obeyed the gospel . For Isaiah says , " Lord , who has believed our report ? "
45010017	So then faith [ comes ] by hearing , and hearing by [ the ] word of God .
45010018	But I say , have they not heard ? Yes , indeed [ they have ] : " Their voice went out to all the earth , and their words to the ends of the world . "
45010019	But I say , did Israel not know ? First Moses says : " I will provoke you to jealousy by [ those who are ] not a nation , by a foolish nation I will anger you . "
45010020	But Isaiah is very bold and says : " I was found by those who did not seek Me ; I was made manifest to those who did not ask for Me . "
45010021	But to Israel he says : " the whole day long I have stretched out My hands to a disobedient and obstinate people . "
45011001	I say then , has God cast away His people ? By no means ! For I too am an Israelite , of the seed of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not cast away His people whom He foreknew . Or do you not know [ what the Scripture says ] in Elijah , how he pleads with God against Israel , saying ,
45011003	" LORD , they killed Your prophets and they torn down Your altars , and I alone am left , and they are seeking my life " ?
45011004	But what does the divine response say to him ? " I have reserved for Myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal . "
45011005	So to then , at this present time , there is also a remnant according to the election of grace .
45011006	And if by grace , [ it is ] no longer of works ; otherwise grace is no longer grace . But if [ it is ] of works , it is no longer grace ; otherwise work is no longer work .
45011007	What then ? Israel has not obtained what it seeks ; but the elect have obtained [ it ] , and the rest were blinded .
45011008	Just as it is written : " God has given them a spirit of stupor , eyes that they should not see , and ears that they should not hear , down to this very day . "
45011009	And David says : " Let their table become a snare and a trap , a stumbling block and a recompense to them .
45011010	Let their eyes be darkened so that they cannot see , and their backs be bent forever . "
45011011	I say then , have they stumbled that they should fall ? By no means ! But by their transgression , salvation [ has come ] to the Gentiles , to provoke them to jealousy .
45011012	But if their transgression is [ the ] riches of the world , and their defeat is [ the ] riches of the Gentiles , how much more their fullness !
45011013	For I speak to you Gentiles ; inasmuch as I am indeed an apostle to the Gentiles , I glorify my ministry ,
45011014	if somehow I may provoke to jealousy my fellow Jews , and I may save some of them .
45011015	For if their casting away means reconciliation [ for the ] world , what will their acceptance be , if not life from the dead ?
45011016	For if the firstfruit is holy , [ so ] also the lump ; and if the root is holy , so also the branches .
