45011017	But if some of the branches were broken off , and you , being a wild olive tree , were grafted in [ among ] them , and became a partaker of the root and of the fatness of the olive tree ,
45011018	do not be arrogant towards the branches . But if you are arrogant , [ remember ] that it is not you that supports the root , but the root [ supports ] you .
45011019	You will say then , " Branches were broken off so that I might be grafted in . "
45011020	That is true . By unbelief they were broken off , but you stand by faith . Do not be arrogant , but fear .
45011021	For if God did not spare the natural branches , perhaps He may not spare you either .
45011022	Behold then the kindness and severity of God : upon those that fell , severity ; but upon you , kindness , if you continue in His kindness . Otherwise you also shall be cut off .
45011023	And they also , if they do not remain in unbelief , shall be grafted in , for God is able to graft them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature , and were grafted contrary to nature into a cultivated olive tree , how much more shall these , the natural ones , be grafted into their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I do not want you to be unaware of this mystery , brothers , lest you be wise in your own opinion , that blindness in part has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in .
45011026	And so all Israel shall be saved , as it is written : " The Deliverer shall come out of Zion , and He shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob ;
45011027	For this is My covenant with them , when I take away their sins . "
45011028	As regards to the gospel , [ they are ] enemies for your sake ; but as regards to election , [ they are ] beloved for the sake of the fathers .
45011029	For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable .
45011030	For just as you once were disobedient to God , but now you were shown mercy through their disobedience ,
45011031	even so these now were disobedient , that through the mercy shown you they also might be shown mercy .
45011032	For God has consigned all to disobedience , that He might show mercy to all .
45011033	Oh , the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and [ ] knowledge of God ! How unsearchable [ are ] His judgments and untraceable [ are ] His ways !
45011034	" For who has known [ the ] mind of the LORD ? Or who has been His counselor ? "
45011035	" Or who has first given to Him , and it shall be repaid to him ? "
45011036	For of Him and through Him and to Him [ are ] all things ; to Him [ be ] the glory forever ! Amen .
45012001	Therefore , brothers , I exhort you through the compassions of God , to present your bodies a living sacrifice , holy , well pleasing to God , [ which is ] your reasonable service .
45012002	And do not be conformed to this world , but be transformed by the renewing of your mind , that you may prove what is that good and well pleasing and perfect will of God .
45012003	For I say , through the grace given to me , to everyone who is among you , not to think of himself too highly , beyond what you should think , but to think soberly , as God has imparted to each one a measure of faith .
45012004	For just as we have many members in one body , but all the members do not have the same function ,
45012005	so we , [ being ] many , are one body in Christ , and individually members of one another .
45012006	Having then gifts differing according to the grace having been given to us , [ let us use them ] : whether prophecy , [ let us prophecy ] according to the proportion of faith ;
45012007	whether ministry , [ let us use it ] in our ministry ; whether teaching ; in the teaching ;
45012008	whether exhorting , in the exhortation ; whether sharing , with simplicity ; whether leading , with diligence ; whether showing mercy , with cheerfulness .
45012009	[ Let ] love [ be ] without hypocrisy . Abhor that which is evil . Cling to that which is good .
45012010	Be warmly affectionate to one another with brotherly love , in honor preferring one another ;
45012011	not lagging in diligence , fervent in spirit , serving the Lord ;
45012012	rejoicing in hope , enduring in tribulation , devoted to prayer ;
45012013	sharing in the needs of the saints , pursuing hospitality .
45012014	Bless those that persecute you ; bless and do not curse .
45012015	Rejoice with those that rejoice , and weep with those that weep .
45012016	Live in harmony with one another . Do not be proud , but [ rather ] associate with the humble . Do not be wise in your own opinion .
45012017	Repay no one evil for evil ; providing that which is good before all men .
45012018	If possible , as much as depends on you , keeping peace with all men .
45012019	Beloved , do not avenge yourselves , but give place to wrath ; for it is written , " Vengeance is Mine , I will repay , " says the Lord .
45012020	Therefore " If your enemy should hunger , feed him ; if he should thirst , give him drink ; for [ by ] doing this you will heap burning coals upon his head . "
45012021	Do not be overcome by evil , but overcome evil with good .
45013001	Let every soul submit to the governing authorities . For there is no authority except by God , and the authorities that exist are instituted by God .
45013002	Consequently the [ one ] resisting the authority has opposed the ordinance of God , and those opposing shall receive judgment to themselves .
45013003	For rulers are not a fear to good works , but to evil . And do you wish not to fear the authority ? [ ] Do what is good , and you shall have praise from the same .
45013004	For he is God's servant to you for good . But if you do evil , fear ; for he does not bear the sword in vain ; for he is God's servant , an avenger for wrath to the [ one ] practicing evil .
45013005	Therefore it is necessary to be subject , not only on account of wrath , but also for conscience' sake .
45013006	For on account of this you also pay taxes , for they are ministers of God , always giving attention to this very thing .
45013007	Render therefore to all their dues : taxes to whom taxes are due , customs to whom customs , fear to whom fear , honor to whom honor .
45013008	Owe nothing to no one , except to love one another , for he who loves one another has fulfilled the law .
45013009	For , " You shall not commit adultery , " " You shall not murder , " " You shall not steal , " " You shall not covet , " and [ if ] there is any other commandment , in this word it is summed up , namely , " You shall love your neighbor as yourself . "
45013010	Love does no harm to a neighbor ; therefore love is the fulfillment of the law .
45013011	And do this , knowing the time , that [ it is ] already [ the ] hour for us to be roused out of sleep ; for now our salvation is nearer than when we [ first ] believed .
45013012	The night is advanced , the day is at hand . Therefore let us put off the works of darkness , and let us put on the armor of light .
45013013	Let us walk properly , as in the day , not in revelries and drinking bouts , not in orgies and debaucheries , not in strife and jealousy .
45013014	But put on the Lord Jesus Christ , and make no provision for the flesh , for [ its ] lusts .
45014001	Receive one that is weak in the faith , not for disputes over opinions .
45014002	One indeed believes that he may eat all things , but another , [ ] being weak , eats [ only ] vegetables .
45014003	Let not him who eats despise him who does not eat , and let not him who does not eat judge him who eats ; for God [ has ] received him .
45014004	Who are you to judge another's servant ? To his own master he stands or he falls . And he shall be made to stand , for God is able to make him stand .
45014005	One indeed judges one day above another ; but another judges every day [ the same ] . Let each be fully assured in his own mind .
45014006	He that regards the day , regards it to the Lord ; and he that does not regard the day , to the Lord he does not regard it . And he that eats , eats to the Lord , for he gives thanks to God ; and he that does not eat , to the Lord he does not eat , and he gives thanks to God .
45014007	For none of us lives to himself , and no one dies to himself .
45014008	For whether we live , we live to the Lord ; and whether we die , we die to the Lord . Therefore , whether we live , or whether we die , we are the Lord's .
45014009	For to this end Christ died and rose and lived [ again ] , so that He might be Lord of both [ the ] dead and [ the ] living .
45014010	But why do you judge your brother ? Or why do you despise your brother ? For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ .
45014011	For it is written : " As I live , says the LORD , every knee shall bow to Me , and every tongue shall confess to God . "
45014012	So then each of us shall give account concerning himself to God .
45014013	Therefore let us no longer judge one another , but judge this rather , not to put a stumbling block or an offense before our brother .
45014014	I know and am convinced in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean of itself ; except to him considering anything to be unclean , to him it is unclean .
45014015	But if your brother is grieved on account of your food , you are no longer walking according to love . Do not destroy with your food the one on behalf of whom Christ died .
45014016	Therefore do not let your good be slandered .
45014017	For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking , but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	For he that serves Christ in these things is well pleasing to God and approved by men .
45014019	Therefore let us pursue the things [ which make ] for peace and the things by which one may edify another .
45014020	Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food . All things indeed are clean , but [ are ] evil for the man eating with offense .
45014021	It is good neither to eat meat nor drink wine nor [ to do anything ] by which your brother stumbles or is offended or becomes weak .
45014022	Do you have faith ? By yourself , have it before God . Blessed is he that does not condemn himself in what he approves .
45014023	But he who doubts , if he eats , has been condemned , because [ it is ] not of faith ; and everything which [ is ] not of faith is sin .
45015001	We then who are strong are obligated to bear with the infirmities of the weak , and not to please ourselves .
45015002	Let each of us please his neighbor for his good , leading to edification .
45015003	For even Christ did not please Himself ; but as it is written , " The reproaches of those reproaching You fell on Me . "
45015004	For as many things as were previously written , were written for our own instruction , that through the patience and through the encouragement of the Scriptures we may have hope .
45015005	Now may the God of patience and of encouragement grant you to be like-minded among one another , according to Christ Jesus ,
45015006	so that you may with one accord and one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	Therefore receive one another , just as also Christ received you , to [ the ] glory of God .
45015008	Now I say that Christ Jesus has become a servant to the circumcision for the truth of God , in order to confirm the promises to the fathers ,
45015009	and that the Gentiles might glorify God on behalf of His mercy , as it is written : " For this reason I will confess to You among the Gentiles , and I will sing praise to Your name . "
45015010	And again he says : " Rejoice , O Gentiles , with His people ! "
45015011	And again : " Praise the LORD , all you Gentiles ! Praise Him , all you peoples ! "
45015012	And again , Isaiah says : " There shall be the root of Jesse ; and He that shall rise to rule over the Gentiles , in Him the Gentiles shall hope . "
45015013	Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing , that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	Now I myself am confident concerning you , my brothers , that you yourselves are full of goodness , having been filled with all knowledge , able also to admonish others .
45015015	And I write more boldly to you brothers , in part , as reminding you , because of the grace having been given to me by God ,
45015016	that I should be a minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles , ministering the gospel of God as a priest , so that the offering of the Gentiles might be acceptable , sanctified by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	Therefore I have something to boast of in Christ Jesus in the things pertaining to God .
45015018	For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ did not work out through me , in word and deed , for the obedience of [ the ] Gentiles -
45015019	in mighty signs and wonders , by the power of the Spirit of God , so that from Jerusalem and as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ .
45015020	And so eagerly striving to evangelize not where Christ was named , lest I should build upon the foundation of another ,
45015021	but as it is written : " To whom He was not announced , they shall see ; and those who have not heard shall understand . "
45015022	For this reason I also have been hindered many times from coming to you .
45015023	But now no longer having a place in these regions , and having a longing to come to you for many years ,
45015024	whenever I travel to Spain , I shall come to you . For I hope [ while ] traveling through to see you , and to be sent forward there by you , if I may be filled in part [ from ] you first .
45015025	But now I am traveling to Jerusalem ministering to the saints .
45015026	For Macedonia and Achaia thought it good to make some contribution for the poor among the saints in Jerusalem .
45015027	For they thought it good , and they are their debtors . For if the Gentiles shared in spiritual things , they are obligated also to minister to them in material things .
45015028	Therefore , having finished and having sealed to them this fruit , I shall go by way of you to Spain .
45015029	But I know that coming to you , I shall come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ .
45015030	Now I beg you , brothers , through the Lord Jesus Christ , and through the love of the Spirit , to strive together with me in prayers to God on my behalf ,
45015031	that I may be delivered from those in Judea who do not believe , and that my service for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints ,
45015032	so that in joy I may come to you through the will of God , and may be refreshed together with you .
45015033	Now the God of peace be with you all . Amen .
45016001	I commend to you Phoebe our sister , who is a servant of the church in Cenchrea ,
45016002	so that you may receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of the saints , and you may stand by her in whatever thing she may need from you ; for indeed she has proved to be a helper of many and of myself also .
45016003	Greet Prisca and Aquila , my fellow workers in Christ Jesus ,
45016004	who risked their own necks for my life , to whom not only I give thanks , but also all the churches of the Gentiles .
45016005	And greet the church that is in their house . Greet my beloved Epaenetus , who is the firstfruits of Achaia to Christ .
45016006	Greet Mary , who labored much for us .
45016007	Greet Andronicus and Junia , my relatives and my fellow captives , who are notable among the apostles , who also were in Christ before me .
45016008	Greet Amplias , my beloved in the Lord .
45016009	Greet Urbanus , our fellow worker in Christ , and Stachys , my beloved .
45016010	Greet Apelles , approved in Christ . Greet those from the [ household ] of Aristobulus .
45016011	Greet Herodion , my relative . Greet those from the [ household ] of Narcissus who are in the Lord .
45016012	Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa , who have labored in the Lord . Greet the beloved Persis , who labored much in the Lord .
45016013	Greet Rufus , chosen in the Lord , and his mother and mine .
45016014	Greet Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermas , Patrobas , Hermes , and the brothers who are with them .
45016015	Greet Philologus and Julia , Nereus and his sister , and Olympas , and all the saints who are with them .
45016016	Greet one another with a holy kiss . The churches of Christ greet you .
45016017	Now I urge you , brothers , to look out for those who cause divisions and offenses , contrary to the doctrine which you learned , and turn away from them .
45016018	For such [ people ] do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ , but their own belly , and through smooth speech and flattering , they deceive the hearts of the innocent .
45016019	For your obedience has become known to all . Therefore I rejoice on your behalf ; but I want you to be wise in what is good , and innocent to what is evil .
45016020	And the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly . The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
45016021	Timothy , my fellow worker , and Lucius , Jason , and Sosipater , my relatives , greet you .
45016022	I , Tertius , the [ one ] writing this epistle , greet you in the Lord .
45016023	Gaius , my host and the host of the whole church , greets you . Erastus , the treasurer of the city , greets you , and Quartus , the brother .
45016024	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
45016025	Now to Him who is able to establish you according to my gospel and the proclamation of Jesus Christ , according to [ the ] revelation of [ the ] mystery kept secret since the world began ,
45016026	but now made manifest , and by the prophetic Scriptures made known to all nations , according to the commandment of the eternal God , for obedience to the faith -
45016027	To the only wise God , through Jesus Christ , to whom be the glory forever ! Amen
46001001	Paul , called [ to be ] an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God , and Sosthenes our brother ,
46001002	to the church of God which is at Corinth , to those who have been sanctified in Christ Jesus , called [ to be ] saints , with all those who in every place are calling on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord , both theirs and ours :
46001003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
46001004	I thank my God always on your behalf for the grace of God which was given to you in Christ Jesus ,
46001005	that in everything you were enriched by Him in all speech and all knowledge ,
46001006	just as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you ,
46001007	so that you are not lacking in any gift , eagerly awaiting the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
46001008	who will also confirm you until the end , [ that you may be ] unimpeachable in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001009	God is faithful , by whom you were called into the fellowship of His Son , Jesus Christ our Lord .
46001010	Now I beseech you , brothers , by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , that you all speak the same thing , and that there be no divisions among you , but you be made complete in the same mind and in the same opinion .
46001011	For it has been reported to me concerning you , my brothers , by those of Chloe's household , that there is quarreling among you .
46001012	Now I say this , that each of you says , " I am of Paul , " and " I [ ] of Apollos , " and " I [ ] of Cephas , " and " I of Christ . "
46001013	Has Christ been divided ? Was Paul crucified for you ? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul ?
46001014	I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius ,
46001015	lest anyone should say that I had baptized in my own name .
46001016	Yes , I also baptized the household of Stephanas . Besides , I do not know whether I baptized anyone else .
46001017	For Christ did not send me to baptize , but to preach the gospel , not in eloquent wisdom , lest the cross of Christ should be deprived of its power .
46001018	For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing , but to us who are being saved it is the power of God .
46001019	For it is written : " I will destroy the wisdom of the wise , and the understanding of the prudent I will annul . "
46001020	Where is the wise ? Where is the scribe ? Where is the philosopher of this age ? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world ?
46001021	For since , in the wisdom of God , the world through wisdom did not know God , God was well pleased , through the foolishness of our preaching , to save those that believe .
46001022	For Jews request a sign , and Greeks seek after wisdom ;
46001023	but we preach Christ crucified , to the Jews a stumbling block , and to the Greeks foolishness ,
46001024	but to those who are called , both Jews and Greeks , Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God .
46001025	Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men , and the weakness of God is stronger than men .
46001026	For you see your calling , brothers , that not many wise according to the flesh , not many powerful , not many noble , [ are called ] .
46001027	But God chose the foolish things of the world in order that He might humiliate the wise , and God chose the weak things of the world in order that He might humiliate the mighty [ . ]
46001028	And the lowly things of the world , and the despised things God has chosen , and the things which are not , in order that He might nullify the things which are ,
46001029	so that no man may boast before God .
46001030	But from Him you are in Christ Jesus , who became for us wisdom from God , and righteousness and sanctification and redemption ;
46001031	that , as it is written , " He that boasts , let him boast in the LORD . "
46002001	And I , brothers , when I came to you , did not come with excellence of speech or of wisdom , announcing to you the testimony of God .
46002002	For I determined to know nothing among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified .
46002003	And I was with you in weakness , in fear , and in much trembling .
46002004	And my message and my preaching [ were ] not with persuasive words of human wisdom , but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power ,
46002005	in order that your faith might not be in the wisdom of men , but in the power of God .
46002006	However , we speak wisdom among those that are mature , but not the wisdom of this age , nor of the rulers of this age , who are being destroyed .
46002007	But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery , the [ wisdom ] having been hidden , which God foreordained before the ages for our glory ,
46002008	which none of the rulers of this age understood ( for had they understood , they would not have crucified the Lord of glory ) .
46002009	But as it is written : " Eye has not seen , nor ear heard , nor have entered into the heart of man , the things which God has prepared for those who love Him . "
46002010	But God has revealed [ them ] to us through His Spirit . For the Spirit searches all things , even the depths of God .
46002011	For who among men knows the things of a man , except the spirit of the man which is in him ? Even so , no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God .
46002012	Now we did not receive the spirit of the world , but the Spirit which is from God , in order that we might know the things freely given to us by God ;
46002013	which things we also speak , not in words taught in human wisdom , but in words taught by the Holy Spirit , comparing spiritual things with spiritual .
46002014	But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God , for they are foolishness to him ; nor can he know them , because they are spiritually discerned .
46002015	But he that is spiritual discerns all things , yet he himself is discerned by no man .
46002016	For " Who has known the mind of the LORD , that he may instruct Him ? " But we have the mind of Christ .
46003001	And I , brothers , was not able to speak to you as to spiritual , but as to carnal , as to babes in Christ .
46003002	I gave you milk to drink , and not solid food ; for you were not yet able [ to receive it ] . Indeed , neither are you now yet able ;
46003003	for you are still carnal . For where there are envy , strife , and divisions among you , are you not carnal , and walking according to human principles ?
46003004	For when one says , " I am of Paul , " and another , " I [ am ] of Apollos , " are you not carnal ?
46003005	Who then is Paul , and who is Apollos , but ministers through whom you believed , as the Lord has given to each one ?
46003006	I planted , Apollos watered , but God gives the increase .
46003007	So then neither he who plants is anything , nor he who waters , but God who gives the increase .
46003008	Now he who plants and he who waters are one , and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor .
46003009	For we are coworkers with God ; you are God's field , you are God's building .
46003010	According to the grace of God which was given to me , as a wise architect I have laid the foundation , but another builds on it . But let each one take heed how he builds on it .
46003011	For no other foundation can anyone lay , other than that which is laid , which is Jesus Christ .
46003012	Now if anyone builds on this foundation [ with ] gold , silver , precious stones , wood , hay , straw ,
46003013	each one's work shall be made manifest ; for the Day shall reveal it , because it shall be revealed by fire ; and the fire shall test each one's work , as to what sort it is .
46003014	If anyone's work which he has built remains , he shall receive a reward .
46003015	If anyone's work is burned up , he shall suffer loss ; but he himself shall be saved , but so as through fire .
46003016	Do you not know that you are the temple of God , and that the Spirit of God dwells in you ?
46003017	If anyone destroys the temple of God , God shall destroy him . For the temple of God is holy , which [ temple ] you are .
46003018	Let no one deceive himself . If anyone among you seems to be wise in this age , let him become a fool , that he may become wise .
46003019	For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God . For it is written , " He catches the wise in their craftiness " ;
46003020	and again , " The LORD knows the thoughts of the wise , that they are useless . "
46003021	Therefore let no one boast in men . For all things are yours :
46003022	whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas , or the world or life or death , or things present or things to come - all things [ ] are yours .
46003023	And you are of Christ , and Christ is of God .
46004001	Let a man so consider us , as ministers of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God .
46004002	Now furthermore what is required among the stewards , is that one be found faithful .
46004003	But to me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you , or by a human court . Indeed , I do not even judge myself .
46004004	For I am conscious of nothing , but I have not been justified by this ; but He who judges me is the Lord .
46004005	So then judge nothing before the time , until the Lord comes , who also will bring to light the hidden things of darkness , and will make clear the purposes of the hearts . Then each one's praise shall come from God .
46004006	Now these things , brothers , I have figuratively applied to myself and Apollos for your sakes , in order that you may learn in us not to think beyond what is written , that none of you may be puffed up on behalf of one against the other .
46004007	For who makes you differ from another ? And what do you have that you did not receive ? And if you did indeed receive [ what you have ] , why do you boast as though you did not receive it ?
46004008	You are already full ! You are already rich ! You have reigned [ as kings ] without us ; and I wish [ that ] indeed you did reign , in order that we also might reign with you !
46004009	For I think that God has displayed us , the apostles , last , as men appointed to death ; for we became a spectacle to the world , both to angels and to men .
46004010	We are fools for Christ's sake , but you are wise in Christ ! We are weak , but you are strong ! You are distinguished , but we are despised !
46004011	Even unto this present hour we both hunger and thirst , and we are naked , and beaten , and homeless .
46004012	And we labor , working with our own hands . Being reviled , we bless ; being persecuted , we endure ;
46004013	being defamed , we encourage ; we have become as the sweepings of the world , the offscouring of all things until now .
46004014	I do not write these things to shame you , but as my beloved children I admonish [ you ] .
46004015	For though you might have ten thousand tutors in Christ , yet [ you do ] not have many fathers ; for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel .
46004016	Therefore I exhort you , be imitators of me .
46004017	Because of this I sent Timothy to you , who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord , who will remind you of my ways in Christ , as I teach everywhere in every church .
46004018	Now some have become arrogant , as though I were not coming to you .
46004019	But I will come to you quickly , if the Lord wills , and I will know , not the word of those who are arrogant , but the power .
46004020	For the kingdom of God is not in word , but in power .
46004021	What do you desire ? Shall I come to you with a rod , or in love , and a spirit of gentleness ?
46005001	It is actually heard that there is fornication among you , and such fornication as is not even named among the Gentiles - that a man has his father's wife !
46005002	And you have become arrogant , and have not rather grieved , so that he who did this deed would be removed from your midst .
46005003	For I indeed , as being absent in body but present in spirit , have already judged ( as though I were present ) him who has done this deed in this way ,
46005004	in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , when you are gathered together , along with my spirit , with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
46005005	hand this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh , in order that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus .
46005006	Your boasting is not good . Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole batch ?
46005007	Purge out the old leaven , in order that you may be a new batch of dough , since you are unleavened . For indeed Christ , our Passover , was sacrificed for us .
46005008	So then let us observe the feast , not with old leaven , nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness , but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
46005009	I wrote to you in my epistle not to associate with fornicators .
46005010	Yet I certainly did not mean with the fornicators of this world , or with the covetous , or swindlers , or idolaters , since then you would need to leave this world !
46005011	But now I have written to you not to associate with anyone named a brother , who is a fornicator , or covetous person , or an idolater , or abusive person , or a drunkard , or a swindler - not even to eat with such a person .
46005012	For what have I to do with judging those also who are outside ? Do you not judge those who are inside ?
46005013	But those who are outside God will judge . Therefore " put away the evil person from yourselves . "
46006001	Does any of you , having a matter against another , dare go to court before the unrighteous , and not before the saints ?
46006002	Do you not know that the saints will judge the world ? And if the world will be judged by you , are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters ?
46006003	Do you not know that we will judge angels ? Let alone ordinary [ matters ] !
46006004	If then you have ordinary lawsuits , do you appoint those who are disdained within the church [ to judge ? ]
46006005	I say [ this ] to your shame . So is there not among you a wise [ man ] , not even one , who will be able to judge between his brother [ and another ] ?
46006006	But brother goes to court against brother , and that before unbelievers !
46006007	Actually then , it is already a defeat for you that you have lawsuits against one another . Why not rather accept wrong ? Why not rather accept being defrauded ?
46006008	But you wrong and defraud , and these things [ to your ] [ own ] brothers !
46006009	Or do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God ? Do not be deceived . Neither fornicators , nor idolaters , nor adulterers , nor homosexuals , nor sodomites ,
46006010	nor covetous , nor thieves , nor drunkards , nor abusive people , nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God .
46006011	And such were some of you ! But you were washed , but you were sanctified , but you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus and by the Spirit of our God .
46006012	All things are lawful for me , but all things are not profitable . All things are lawful for me , but I will not be mastered by anything .
46006013	Foods for the stomach and the stomach for foods , but God will destroy both this [ stomach ] and these [ foods ] . Now the body is not for fornication , but for the Lord , and the Lord for the body .
46006014	Now God has both raised up the Lord , and will also raise us up through His power .
46006015	Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and make [ them ] members of a harlot ? By no means !
46006016	Do you not know that he who is joined to a harlot is one body [ with her ] ? For " the two , " He says , " shall become one flesh . "
46006017	But he that is joined with the Lord is one spirit [ with Him ] .
46006018	Flee fornication . Every sin that a man does is outside the body , but he who commits fornication sins against his own body .
46006019	Or do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit within you , whom you have from God , and you are not your own ?
46006020	For you were bought with a price ; therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit , which are God's .
46007001	Now concerning the [ ] things of which you wrote to me : It is good for a man not to touch a woman .
46007002	Nevertheless , to avoid fornication , let each [ man ] have his own wife , and let each [ woman ] have her own husband .
46007003	Let the husband render to his wife the affection due her , and likewise also the wife to her husband .
46007004	The wife does not have authority over her own body , but the husband [ does ] . And likewise the husband does not have authority over his own body , but the wife [ does ] .
46007005	Do not deprive one another , except by mutual agreement , [ and that ] for a season , so that you may devote yourselves to fasting and prayer ; and come together again , lest Satan tempt you because of your lack of self-control .
46007006	But I say this as a concession , not as a commandment .
46007007	For I wish that all men would be as I myself . But each one has his own gift from God , one in this way and another in that .
46007008	But I say to the unmarried and to the widows : It is good for them if they should remain as I also [ remain ] ;
46007009	but if they are not exercising self-control , let them marry . For it is better to marry than to burn [ with passion ] .
46007010	Now to those who have married I command , yet not I , but the Lord : A wife is not to be separated from her husband -
46007011	and even if she does separate , let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband - and a husband is not to divorce his wife .
46007012	But to the rest I , not the Lord , say : If any brother has an unbelieving wife , and she consents to live with him , let him not divorce her .
46007013	And a wife who has an unbelieving husband , if he consents to live with her , let her not divorce him .
46007014	For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified by the wife , and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified by the husband ; otherwise your children would be unclean , but now they are holy .
46007015	But if the unbelieving [ spouse ] separates , let [ him or her ] separate ; the brother or the sister has not been bound in such cases ; but God has called us to peace .
46007016	For how do you know , O wife , whether you will save your husband ? Or how do you know , O husband , whether you will save your wife ?
46007017	Otherwise as God has distributed to each one , as the Lord has called each one , so let him walk . And so I command in all the churches .
46007018	Was anyone called while circumcised ? Let him not become uncircumcised . Was anyone called while uncircumcised ? Let him not be circumcised .
46007019	Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing , but keeping the commandments of God .
46007020	Let each one remain in the same calling in which he was called .
46007021	Were you called as a slave ? Do not be concerned about it ; but if you can be made free , rather make use of [ it ] .
46007022	For he who is called in the Lord while a slave is the Lord's free [ man ] . Likewise he who is called as a free [ man ] is Christ's slave .
46007023	You were bought with a price ; do not become slaves of men .
46007024	Brothers , let each one remain with God in [ the state ] in which he was called .
46007025	Now concerning virgins , I have no command of the Lord ; but I give judgment , as having received mercy by the Lord to be faithful .
46007026	Therefore I consider this to be good because of the present distress , that [ it is ] good for a man to be as he is :
46007027	Have you been bound to a wife ? Do not seek to be released . Have you been released from a wife ? Do not seek a wife .
46007028	But even if you should marry , you have not sinned ; and if a virgin should marry , she has not sinned . But such will have trouble in the flesh , and I would spare you .
46007029	But this I say , brothers , the time has been shortened ; so that from now on even those having wives should be as though they had none ,
46007030	and those weeping as though not weeping , and those rejoicing as though not rejoicing , and those buying as though not possessing ,
46007031	and those using this world as not using it up . For the form of this world is passing away .
46007032	But I want you to be without anxiety . The unmarried man cares about the things of the Lord- [ about ] how he may please the Lord .
46007033	But the [ man ] having married cares about the things of the world- [ about ] how he may please his wife .
46007034	And the wife and the virgin are different . The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord , that she may be holy both in body and in spirit . But the woman having married cares about the things of the world - about how she may please her husband .
46007035	And this I say for your own profit , not that I may put a snare upon you , but for that which is proper , and that you may serve the Lord without distraction .
46007036	But if any man thinks he is behaving improperly toward his virgin , if she is past her youth , and thus it must be , let him do what he desires . He does not sin ; let them marry .
46007037	But [ he ] who stands in his heart , not having necessity , but has power over his own desire , and has decided this in his heart that he will keep his virgin , does well .
46007038	So then he who gives her in marriage does well , but he who does not give her in marriage does better .
46007039	A wife has been bound by law as long as her husband lives ; but if her husband also dies , she is free to be married to whom she desires , only in the Lord .
46007040	But she is more blessed if she remains as she is , in my opinion - and I think I also have the Spirit of God .
46008001	Now concerning the [ things ] offered to idols , we know that we all have knowledge . Knowledge puffs up , but love edifies .
46008002	And if anyone thinks that he knows anything , he has come to know nothing yet as he ought to know .
46008003	But if anyone loves God , this one has been known by Him .
46008004	Therefore concerning the eating of the things offered to idols , we know that an idol is nothing in the world , and that there is no other God but one .
46008005	For even if they are being called " gods " whether in heaven or on earth ( just as there are many gods and many lords ) ,
46008006	yet for us there is one God , the Father , of whom are all things , and we for Him ; and one Lord Jesus Christ , through whom [ are ] all things , and through whom we [ live ] .
46008007	However , this knowledge is not in all [ people ] ; rather some , with consciousness of the idol , until now eat it as [ something ] offered to idols ; and their conscience , being weak , is defiled .
46008008	But food does not commend us to God ; for neither if we eat do we have more , nor if we do not eat do we lack .
46008009	But beware lest somehow this liberty of yours become a stumbling block to those who are weak .
46008010	For if anyone should see you who has knowledge dining in an idol's temple , will not his conscience , being weak , be strengthened so that they eat foods offered to idols ?
46008011	And because of your knowledge shall the weak brother perish , for the sake of whom Christ died ?
46008012	But when you thus sin against the brothers , and wound their weak conscience , you sin against Christ .
46008013	Wherefore , if food causes my brother to stumble , I will by no means eat meat , lest I cause my brother to stumble .
46009001	Am I not an apostle ? Am I not free ? Have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord ? Are you not my work in the Lord ?
46009002	If I am not an apostle to others , yet indeed I am to you . For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord .
46009003	My defense to those who examine me is this :
46009004	Do we not have [ the ] right to eat and drink ?
46009005	Do we not have [ the ] right to take along a wife [ who is ] a sister , as do also the other apostles , the brothers of the Lord , and Cephas ?
46009006	Or is it only Barnabas and I who must work for a living ?
46009007	Who ever serves as a soldier at his own expense ? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit ? Or who tends a flock and does not drink from the milk of the flock ?
46009008	Do I say these things as a mere man ? Or does not the law say these things also ?
46009009	For it is written in the law of Moses , " You shall not muzzle an ox while it threshes . " Is it oxen God is concerned about ?
46009010	Or does He say [ this ] altogether for our sakes ? For our sakes , no doubt , for it is written , that he that plows should plow in hope , and he that threshes , in hope should partake of his hope .
46009011	If we have sown spiritual things for you , [ is it ] a great thing if we reap your material things ?
46009012	If others partake of this right over you , do not we even more ? Nevertheless we did not use this right , but bear all things lest we hinder the gospel of Christ .
46009013	Do you not know that those who minister the holy things eat from the temple , and those who serve at the altar have a share in the altar ?
46009014	Thus also the Lord commanded those who proclaim the gospel to live from the gospel .
46009015	But I used none of these things , nor have I written these things that it should become thus for me ; for it is better for me rather to die than that anyone should make my boasting void .
46009016	For if I preach the gospel , there is nothing for me to boast about , for necessity is pressed upon me ; yes , woe is me if I do not preach the gospel !
46009017	For if I do this willingly , I have a reward ; but if unwillingly , I have been entrusted with a commission .
46009018	What then is my reward ? That when I preach the gospel , I may present the gospel of Christ free of charge , so as not to exploit my rights in the gospel .
46009019	For being free from all [ men ] , I have made myself a servant to all , in order that I might win the more ;
46009020	and to the Jews I became as a Jew , in order that I might win Jews ; to those who are under law , as under law , in order that I might win those who are under law ;
46009021	to those outside the law , as [ one ] outside the law ( not being outside the law toward God , but subject to [ the ] law toward Christ ) , in order that I might win those outside the law ;
46009022	to the weak I became as weak , in order that I might win the weak . I have become all things to all [ men ] , that I might by all means save some .
46009023	Now this I do for the sake of the gospel , in order that I may become a partaker of it [ with you ] .
46009024	Do you not know that those running in a stadium all run , but one receives the prize ? So run , in order that you may win .
46009025	And everyone who competes exercises self-control [ in ] all things . Now they [ compete ] in order that they may receive a perishable crown , but we [ compete ] [ for ] an imperishable crown .
46009026	Therefore I run thus : not as without a goal , thus I box : not as one beating the air .
46009027	But I treat my body roughly , and I bring it into subjection , lest , having preached to others , I myself should become disqualified .
46010001	Now I do not want you to be ignorant , brothers , that all our fathers were under the cloud , and all passed through the sea ,
46010002	and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea ,
46010003	and all ate the same spiritual food ,
46010004	and all drank the same spiritual drink . For they were drinking from that spiritual Rock that followed them , and that Rock was Christ .
46010005	Nevertheless , with the majority of them God was not pleased , for their bodies were scattered in the wilderness .
46010006	Now these things took place as examples for us , in order that we should not lust after evil things , as they also lusted .
46010007	Nor be idolaters , just as some of them ; as it is written , " The people sat down to eat and drink , and rose up to play . "
46010008	Nor let us commit fornication , just as some of them fornicated , and in one day twenty-three thousand fell ;
46010009	nor let us tempt Christ , just as also some of them tempted [ Him ] , and were destroyed by serpents ;
46010010	nor murmur , just as also some of them murmured , and were destroyed by the destroyer .
46010011	Now all these things happened to those [ people ] as examples , and they were written for our instruction , to whom the ends of the ages have come .
46010012	So then , let him who thinks he stands take heed , lest he should fall !
46010013	No temptation has overtaken you except such as is common to man ; but God is faithful , who will not permit you to be tempted beyond what you are able , but with the temptation , He will also make the way out , [ so as for ] you to be able to bear it .
46010014	Therefore , my beloved , flee from idolatry .
46010015	I speak as to wise men ; judge for yourselves what I say .
46010016	The cup of blessing which we bless , is it not the communion of the blood of Christ ? The bread which we break , is it not the communion of the body of Christ ?
46010017	Because we , though many , are one bread and one body ; for we all partake from the one bread .
46010018	Look at Israel according to the flesh : are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar ?
46010019	What am I saying then ? That an idol is anything , or what is offered to idols is anything ?
46010020	[ No ] , but that the [ ] things which the Gentiles sacrifice , they sacrifice to demons and not to God , and I do not desire that you should have fellowship with demons .
46010021	You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons ; you cannot partake of the Lord's table and of the table of demons .
46010022	Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy ? Are we stronger than He ?
46010023	All things are lawful for me , but not all things are profitable ; all things are lawful for me , but not all things edify .
46010024	Let no one seek his own concerns , but let each [ one ] seek another's concern .
46010025	Eat everything being sold in the meat market , questioning nothing , for conscience' sake ;
46010026	for " The earth is the LORD's , and all its fullness . "
46010027	And if any of the unbelievers invites you to dinner , and you desire to go , eat whatever is set before you , questioning nothing , for conscience' sake .
46010028	But if anyone says to you , " This was offered to idols , " do not eat it for the sake of the one who told you , and for his conscience' sake ; for " The earth is the LORD's , and all its fullness . "
46010029	" Conscience , " I say , not your own , but that of the other . For why is my freedom judged by another man's conscience ?
46010030	But if I partake with thanks , why am I defamed for [ that ] of which I give thanks ?
46010031	Therefore , whether you eat or drink , or whatever you do , do all things for the glory of God .
46010032	Be without offense , both toward Jews and toward Greeks , and toward the church of God ,
46010033	just as I also please all men in all things , not seeking my own profit , but the [ profit ] of many , that they may be saved .
46011001	Be imitators of me , just as I also [ am ] of Christ .
46011002	Now I praise you , brothers , because you remember me in all things , and you hold fast the traditions just as I handed down to you .
46011003	But I want you to know that the head of every man is Christ , the head of woman is man , and the head of Christ is God .
46011004	Every man who prays or who prophesies with his head covered , dishonors his head .
46011005	But every woman who prays or who prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her own head , for that is one and the same as if her [ head ] were shaved .
46011006	For if a woman is not covered , let her also have her hair cut . But if it is a shameful [ thing ] for a woman to have her hair cut , or to be shaved , let her be covered .
46011007	For a man indeed ought not to cover his head , since he is the image and glory of God ; but woman is the glory of man .
46011008	For man did not come from woman , but woman from man .
46011009	Nor was man created for woman , but woman for the man .
46011010	Because of this , the woman ought to have a [ symbol ] [ of ] authority on her head , because of the angels .
46011011	Nevertheless , neither is the man apart from the woman , nor the woman apart from the man , in the Lord .
46011012	For as the woman is from the man , even so the man is by the woman ; but all things are of God .
46011013	Judge among yourselves . Is it proper for a woman to pray to God uncovered ?
46011014	Does not nature itself teach you , that if a man has long hair , it is a dishonor to him ?
46011015	But if a woman has long hair , it is a glory for her ; because her long hair has been given [ to her ] in place of a covering .
46011016	But if anyone seems to be contentious , we have no such custom , nor do the churches of God .
46011017	Now in giving these instructions I do not praise you , because you are not coming together for the better , but for the worse .
46011018	For first of all , when you come together in church , I hear that there are divisions among you , and in part I believe it .
46011019	For there must also be sects among you , in order that those who are approved may become recognized among you .
46011020	Therefore when you assemble in the same [ place ] , it is not to eat the Lord's Supper .
46011021	For when you eat , each one takes first his own supper , and one goes hungry and another is drunk !
46011022	What ? Do you not have houses to eat and drink in ? Or do you despise the church of God , and disgrace those who do not have ? What shall I say to you ? Shall I praise you in this ? I do not praise you !
46011023	For I received from the Lord that which I also delivered unto you : that the Lord Jesus , during the night in which He was betrayed , took bread ;
46011024	and having given thanks , He broke it and said , " Take , eat ; this is My body which has been broken for you ; do this in remembrance of Me . "
46011025	Likewise He also took the cup after supper , saying , " This cup is the new covenant in My blood . This do , as often as you drink it , in remembrance of Me . "
46011026	For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup , you proclaim the Lord's death until He comes .
46011027	Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord irreverently will be guilty of the body of the Lord and of the blood of the Lord .
46011028	But let a man examine himself , and in this way let him eat from the bread and drink from the cup .
46011029	For he that eats and drinks irreverently eats and drinks judgment to himself , not judging correctly the body of the Lord .
46011030	Because of this many among you are weak and sick , and many have died .
46011031	For if we judge ourselves correctly , we would not be judged .
46011032	But when we are judged , we are disciplined by the Lord , in order that we may not be condemned along with the world .
46011033	Therefore , my brothers , when you come together to eat , wait for one another .
46011034	But if anyone is hungry , let him eat at home , lest you come together for judgment . And the rest I will put in order when I come .
46012001	Now concerning spiritual [ gifts ] , brothers , I do not want you to be ignorant .
46012002	You know that when you were pagans , how you were led , being carried away to these speechless idols .
46012003	Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God says " Jesus be cursed , " and no one can say that Jesus [ is ] Lord except by the Holy Spirit .
46012004	Now there are varieties of spiritual gifts , but the same Spirit .
46012005	And there are varieties of ministries , but the same Lord .
46012006	And there are varieties of activities , but the same God works all in all .
46012007	But to each [ one ] the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the profit [ of all . ]
46012008	For to one is given a word of wisdom through the Spirit , to another a word of knowledge according to the same Spirit ,
46012009	and to another faith by the same Spirit , to another gifts of healings by the same Spirit ,
46012010	to another the working of miracles , and to another prophecy , and to another discerning of spirits , and to another [ different ] kinds of tongues , and to another interpretation of tongues .
46012011	But one and the same Spirit works all these things , distributing to each one individually just as He wills .
46012012	For just as the body is one and has many parts , but all the parts of that one body , being many , are one body , so also is Christ .
46012013	For by one Spirit we were all baptized into one body - whether Jews or Greeks , whether slaves or free - and we were all given to drink into one Spirit .
46012014	For in fact the body is not one part but many .
46012015	If the foot should say , " Because I am not a hand , I am not of the body , " is it therefore not of the body ?
46012016	And if the ear should say , " Because I am not an eye , I am not of the body , " is it therefore not of the body ?
46012017	If the whole body [ were ] an eye , where [ would be ] the hearing ? If the whole [ were ] hearing , where [ would be ] the smelling ?
46012018	But now God has set the parts , each one of them , in the body just as He desired .
46012019	And if all [ parts ] were one part , where [ would be ] the body ?
46012020	But now indeed there [ are ] many parts , but one body .
46012021	And the eye cannot say to the hand , " I have no need of you " ; nor again the head to the feet , " I have no need of you . "
46012022	But to a greater degree the parts of the body which seem weaker are necessary .
46012023	And [ the parts ] of the body which we consider to be less honorable , on these we bestow greater honor ; and our unpresentable parts have greater propriety .
46012024	But our presentable [ parts ] have no need . But God united the body , giving greater honor to the [ part ] being inferior ,
46012025	lest there be divisions in the body , but the parts care the same for one another .
46012026	And if one part suffers , all the parts suffer together ; or if one part is honored , all the parts rejoice together .
46012027	Now you are the body of Christ , and members individually .
46012028	And [ those ] whom God has appointed in the church [ are ] : first apostles , second prophets , third teachers , then miracles , then gifts of healings , helps , administrations , kinds of tongues .
46012029	All [ are ] not apostles , [ are they ] ? All [ are ] not prophets , [ are they ] ? Are all teachers ? [ Are ] all [ workers of ] miracles ?
46012030	Do all have gifts of healings ? Do all speak with tongues ? Do all interpret ?
46012031	But strive for the better gifts . And yet I make known a more excellent way .
46013001	Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels , but have not love , I have become [ as ] sounding brass or a clashing cymbal .
46013002	And though I have [ the gift of ] prophecy , and know all mysteries and all knowledge , and though I have all faith , so as to remove mountains , but have not love , I am nothing .
46013003	And though I give away all my possessions to feed [ the poor ] , and though I deliver up my body to be burned , but have not love , it profits me nothing .
46013004	Love is patient , love is kind ; love does not envy ; love does not boast , is not arrogant ;
46013005	does not behave disgracefully , does not seek its own , is not provoked to anger , thinks no evil ;
46013006	does not rejoice over unrighteousness , but rejoices with the truth ;
46013007	bears all things , believes all things , hopes all things , endures all things .
46013008	Love never fails . But whether there [ are ] prophecies , they shall pass away ; whether there [ are ] tongues , they shall cease ; whether there [ is ] knowledge , it shall pass away .
46013009	Now we know in part , and we prophesy in part .
46013010	But when that which is perfect has come , then that which is partial shall pass away .
46013011	When I was a child , I spoke as a child , I thought as a child , I reasoned as a child ; but when I became a man , I put away the things of the child .
46013012	For now we see through a mirror by reflection , but then face to face . Now I know in part , but then I shall know just as I also am known .
46013013	And now abide faith , hope , love , these three ; but the greatest of these is love .
46014001	Pursue love , and desire the spiritual [ gifts ] , but especially that you may prophesy .
46014002	For he who speaks in an [ unknown ] tongue speaks not to men , but to God , for no one understands him ; however , in the spirit he speaks mysteries .
46014003	But he who prophesies speaks edification and exhortation and comfort .
46014004	He who speaks in an [ unknown ] tongue edifies himself , but he who prophesies edifies the church .
46014005	Now I wish you all spoke in tongues , but even more that you should prophesy ; for he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks in tongues , unless he interprets , so that the church may be edified .
46014006	But now , brothers , if I come to you speaking in tongues , what shall I profit you unless I speak to you either in a revelation , or in knowledge , or in a prophesy , or in doctrine ?
46014007	Likewise the lifeless things , when they make a sound , whether flute or harp , unless they make a distinction in the tones , how will it be known what is being played on the flute , or what is being played on the harp ?
46014008	For if the trumpet gives an indistinct sound , who will prepare for battle ?
46014009	So also you , [ if you ] do not give a clear word by the tongue , how will it be known what is being spoken ? For you will be speaking into the air .
46014010	There are , perhaps , so many kinds of sounds in the world , and none of them without meaning .
46014011	Therefore , if I do not know the meaning of the sound , I shall be as a foreigner to the [ one ] speaking , and the [ one ] speaking [ shall be ] as a foreigner to me .
46014012	So also you , since you are zealous of spiritual [ gifts ] , seek that you may abound to the edification of the church .
46014013	Therefore let he that speaks in an [ unknown ] tongue pray that he may interpret .
46014014	For if I pray in a tongue , my spirit prays , but my understanding is unfruitful .
46014015	What is the conclusion then ? I will pray with the spirit , and I will also pray with the mind . I will sing with the spirit , and I will also sing with the mind .
46014016	Otherwise , if you bless with the spirit , how will he who occupies the place of the uninformed say " Amen " when you give thanks , since he does not know what you are saying ?
46014017	For you indeed give thanks well , but the other is not edified .
46014018	I thank my God I speak with tongues more than you all ;
46014019	but in the church I would rather speak five words with my understanding , in order that I may instruct others , rather than ten thousand words in an [ unknown ] tongue .
46014020	Brothers , do not be children in your understanding ; rather , in malice be children , but in understanding be men .
46014021	In the law it is written : " With men of other tongues and by strange lips I will speak to this people ; and yet not even in this way will they hear Me , " says the Lord .
46014022	So then tongues are for a sign , not to those who believe but to unbelievers ; but prophesying is not for unbelievers but for those who believe .
46014023	If then the whole church comes together at the same place , and all speak in tongues , and there come in [ those that are ] unlearned or unbelievers , will they not say that you are mad ?
46014024	But if all prophesy , and an unbeliever or an unlearned person comes in , he is reproved by all , he is discerned by all .
46014025	And so the secrets of his heart become clear ; and so , falling down on his face , he will worship God , reporting that God is truly among you !
46014026	What is it then , brothers ? Whenever you come together , each of you has a song , has a teaching , has a tongue , has a revelation , has an interpretation . Let all things be done for edification .
46014027	If anyone speaks in an [ unknown ] tongue , [ let it be ] by two or at the most three , each in turn , and let one interpret .
46014028	But if there is no interpreter , let him be silent in church , and let him speak to himself and to God .
46014029	Let two or three prophets speak , and let others discriminate .
46014030	But if [ something ] is revealed to another who sits by , let the first be silent .
46014031	For you can all prophesy [ one ] by one , that all may learn and all may be encouraged .
46014032	And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets .
46014033	For God is not [ the author ] of confusion but of peace . As in all the churches of the saints ,
46014034	let your women be silent in the churches , for it is not permitted for them to speak , but to be in subjection , just as the law also says .
46014035	And if they desire to learn anything , let them ask their own husbands at home ; for it is shameful for women to speak in church .
46014036	Or did the word of God go forth from you ? Or did it come to you only ?
46014037	If anyone thinks that he is a prophet , or [ is ] spiritual [ , ] let him recognize that the things which I am writing to you are the commandments of the Lord .
46014038	But if anyone is ignorant , let him be ignorant .
46014039	Therefore , brothers , seek to prophesy , and do not forbid to speak in tongues .
46014040	Let all things be done properly and according to order .
46015001	Now I made known to you , brothers , the gospel which I preached to you , which also you received , in which you also stand ,
46015002	through which also you are saved , if you hold fast that word which I preached to you - unless you believed in vain .
46015003	For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received : that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures ,
46015004	and that He was buried , and that He was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures ,
46015005	and that He appeared to Cephas , then to the Twelve .
46015006	Thereafter He appeared to more than five hundred brothers at one time , of whom the majority remain until now , but some have fallen asleep .
46015007	Thereafter He appeared to James , then to all the apostles .
46015008	And last of all , as of [ one ] born out of due time , He appeared to me also .
46015009	For I am the least of the apostles , who am not worthy to be called an apostle , because I persecuted the church of God .
46015010	But by the grace of God I am what I am , and His grace toward me was not in vain ; but I labored more abundantly than them all , yet not I , but the grace of God which was with me .
46015011	Therefore , whether it was I or they , so we preach and so you believed .
46015012	Now if Christ is preached that He has been raised from the dead , how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead ?
46015013	But if there is no resurrection of the dead , then Christ has not been raised .
46015014	And if Christ has not been raised , then our preaching is vain and your faith also is vain !
46015015	And we are found [ to be ] false witnesses of God , because we bore witness concerning God , that He raised Christ , whom He did not raise - if in fact the dead are not raised .
46015016	For if the dead are not raised , [ then ] neither has Christ been raised .
46015017	And if Christ has not been raised , your faith is worthless ; you are still in your sins !
46015018	Then also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished .
46015019	If in this life only we have hoped in Christ , we are to be pitied above all men .
46015020	But now Christ has been raised from the dead , [ and ] has become the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep .
46015021	For since by a man [ came ] death , also by a Man came the resurrection of the dead .
46015022	For as in Adam all die , even so in Christ all will be made alive .
46015023	But each one in his own order : Christ the firstfruits , then those who belong to Christ at His coming .
46015024	Then [ will be ] the end , when He hands over the kingdom to God , even the Father , when He abolishes every ruler and every authority and power .
46015025	For He must reign until He puts all His enemies under His feet .
46015026	The last enemy that will be abolished is death .
46015027	For " He has subjected all things under His feet . " But when He says that " all things have been subjected , " it is evident that [ this is ] except for Him who subjected all things to Him .
46015028	Now when all things are made subject to Him , then also the Son Himself will be subjected to Him who subjected all things to Him , in order that God may be all in all .
46015029	Otherwise , what will they do who are being baptized for the dead , if the dead are not raised at all ? Why are they also baptized for the dead ?
46015030	And why are we also in danger every hour ?
46015031	I [ affirm ] , by my boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord , I die daily .
46015032	If , in the manner of men , I fought with beasts at Ephesus , what is the benefit to me ? If the dead are not raised , " Let us eat and drink , for tomorrow we die ! "
46015033	Do not be deceived : " Evil associations corrupt good habits . "
46015034	Awake to righteousness , and do not sin ! For some have no knowledge of God . I speak this to your shame .
46015035	But someone will say , " How are the dead raised ? And with what sort of body do they come ? "
46015036	Fool , what you sow is not made alive unless it dies .
46015037	And what you sow , you do not sow that body that will be , but a bare grain - perhaps wheat or some other [ grains ] .
46015038	But God gives to it a body just as He desired , and to each of the seeds its own body .
46015039	All flesh is not the same flesh , but there is a different [ kind ] [ of flesh ] for men , and another flesh for beasts , another for fish , and another for birds .
46015040	And there [ are ] heavenly bodies , and earthly bodies ; but the glory of the heavenly is one , and the glory of the earthly is another .
46015041	There is one glory of the sun , and another glory of the moon , and another glory of the stars ; for one star differs from [ another ] star in glory .
46015042	So also is the resurrection of the dead . The body is sown in corruption , it is raised in incorruption .
46015043	It is sown in dishonor , it is raised in glory . It is sown in weakness , it is raised in power .
46015044	It is sown a natural body , it is raised a spiritual body . There is a natural body , and there is a spiritual body .
46015045	Thus also it is written , " The first man Adam [ became ] a living being ; " the last Adam [ became ] a life-giving spirit .
46015046	However , that which is spiritual is not first , but that which is natural , then that which is spiritual .
46015047	The first man [ was ] from earth , made of dust ; the second Man is the Lord from heaven .
46015048	Like the [ man ] made of dust , so also [ are ] those who are made of dust ; and as is the heavenly [ Man ] , so also [ are ] those [ who are ] heavenly .
46015049	And just as we have borne the image of the [ man ] made of dust , let us also bear the image of the heavenly [ Man ] .
46015050	Now this I say , brothers , that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God ; nor can corruption inherit incorruption .
46015051	Behold , I tell you a mystery : We shall not all sleep , but we shall all be changed -
46015052	in a moment , in the twinkling of an eye , at the last trumpet . For the trumpet shall sound , and the dead shall be raised incorruptible , and we shall be changed .
46015053	For this corruptible must put on incorruption , and this mortal must put on immortality .
46015054	So when this corruptible should put on incorruption , and this mortal should put on immortality , then will come to pass the word which was written : " Death was swallowed up in victory . "
46015055	" O Death , where is your sting ? O Hades , where is your victory ? "
46015056	Now the sting of death is sin , and the power of sin is the law .
46015057	But thanks be to God , who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ .
46015058	So then , my beloved brothers , be steadfast , immovable , always abounding in the work of the Lord , knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord .
46016001	Now concerning the collection which is for the saints , as I directed to the churches of Galatia , so you must do also :
46016002	On the first day of the week let each one of you put [ something ] aside , storing up whatever he may prosper , in order that there be no collections when I come .
46016003	But when I arrive , [ those ] whom ever you approve by letters , these I will send to carry your gracious gift to Jerusalem .
46016004	But if it is fitting that I go also , they will go with me .
46016005	Now I will come to you when I go through Macedonia ( for I am coming through Macedonia ) .
46016006	And perhaps I will remain , or even spend the winter with you , that you may send me on my journey , wherever I may go .
46016007	For I do not wish to see you now in passing ; but I hope to spend some time with you , if the Lord permits .
46016008	But I will remain in Ephesus until Pentecost .
46016009	For a great and effective door has been opened to me , and there [ are ] many adversaries .
46016010	Now if Timothy comes , see to it that he may be with you without fear ; for he does the work of the Lord , as I also [ do ] .
46016011	Therefore let no one despise him . But send him away in peace , that he may come to me ; for I am waiting for him with the brothers .
46016012	Now concerning our brother Apollos , I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers , but it was not his will to come at this time ; however , he will come whenever he has an opportunity .
46016013	Watch , stand fast in the faith , be courageous , be strong .
46016014	Let all that you do be done in love .
46016015	I urge you , brothers ( you know the household of Stephanas , that it is the firstfruits of Achaia , and that they have devoted themselves to the ministry of the saints )
46016016	that you also subject yourselves to such [ people ] and to everyone who works and labors with us .
46016017	I rejoice over the coming of Stephanas , Fortunatus , and Achaicus , for what was lacking on your part they have supplied .
46016018	For they refreshed my spirit and yours . Therefore give recognition to such [ men ] .
46016019	The churches of Asia greet you . Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord , together with the church that is in their house .
46016020	All the brothers greet you . Greet one another with a holy kiss .
46016021	The salutation with my own hand - Paul's .
46016022	If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ , let him be Anathema . Marana tha !
46016023	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
46016024	My love be with you all in Christ Jesus . Amen .
47001001	Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , and Timothy our brother , to the church of God which is at Corinth , together with all the saints who are in all Achaia :
47001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
47001003	Blessed [ be ] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of mercies and God of all comfort ,
47001004	who comforts us in all our tribulation , so that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction , by means of the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God .
47001005	Because just as the sufferings of Christ abound in us , so our consolation also abounds through Christ .
47001006	Now if we are afflicted , it is for your consolation and salvation , which is effective for enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer .
47001007	( And our hope concerning you is steadfast ) ; if we are comforted , it is for your consolation and salvation , knowing that as you are partakers of the sufferings , thus also [ you will partake ] of the consolation .
47001008	For we do not desire you to be ignorant , brothers , concerning our affliction which happened to us in Asia : that we were burdened beyond measure , beyond our strength , so that we despaired even of life .
47001009	Yes , we have had the sentence of death in ourselves , that we should not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead ,
47001010	who delivered us from so great a death , and is delivering [ us ] ; in whom we trust that He will still deliver [ us ] ,
47001011	you also laboring together for us in prayer , that thanks may be given by many persons on your behalf for the gift [ given ] to us through many .
47001012	For our boasting is this : the testimony of our conscience , that we have conducted ourselves in the world in simplicity and godly sincerity , not with fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God , and especially toward you .
47001013	For we do not write other things to you except what you read or also understand . And I hope that you will understand , even until the end
47001014	just as also you have understood us in part , that we are your boasting , as indeed you also are ours , in the day of the Lord Jesus .
47001015	And in this confidence I intended to come to you earlier , that you might have a second benefit ,
47001016	and through you to pass into Macedonia , and again from Macedonia to come to you , and by you to be sent on to Judea .
47001017	Therefore , when I decided this , did I do it lightly ? Or the things I decide , do I decide according to the flesh , that there may be with me " Yes , Yes , " and " No , No ? "
47001018	But [ as ] God [ is ] faithful , our word unto you was not " Yes and no . "
47001019	For the Son of God , Jesus Christ , who was preached among you by us - by me , Silvanus , and Timothy - was not " Yes and no , " but in Him was " Yes . "
47001020	For all the promises of God in Him [ are ] " Yes , " and in Him " Amen , " to the glory of God through us .
47001021	Now He who establishes us together with you in Christ and who has anointed us is God ,
47001022	who also has sealed us , and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a pledge .
47001023	Moreover I call upon God as a witness against my soul , that in order to spare you , I came no more to Corinth .
47001024	Not that we lord it over your faith , but are fellow workers for your joy ; for by faith you stand .
47002001	But I determined this within myself , that I would not come again to you in sorrow .
47002002	For if I make you sorrowful , then who is he who makes me glad if not the [ one ] which is made sorrowful by me ?
47002003	And I wrote this very thing to you , lest when I came , I should have sorrow from those from whom I ought to have joy , having confidence in you all that my joy is [ the joy ] of you all .
47002004	For out of much affliction and distress of heart I wrote to you , through many tears , not that you might be made sorrowful , but that you might know the love which I have more abundantly towards you .
47002005	Now if anyone has caused grief , he has not grieved me , but in part - lest I burden you all .
47002006	Sufficient to such a person is this punishment which was [ inflicted ] by the majority ,
47002007	so that , on the contrary , you ought rather to forgive and comfort him , lest somehow such a person be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow .
47002008	Therefore I appeal to you to reaffirm [ your ] love towards him .
47002009	For to this end I also wrote , so that I might put you to the test , [ to see ] if you are obedient in all things .
47002010	And to whom you forgive anything , I also [ forgive ; ] for if indeed I have forgiven anything , [ the ] one whom I have forgiven , [ I have done so ] for your sakes in the presence of Christ ,
47002011	lest we be taken advantage of by Satan ; for we are not ignorant of his devices .
47002012	Now when I came to Troas for the gospel of Christ , and a door was opened to me by the Lord ,
47002013	I had no rest in my spirit , because I did not find Titus my brother ; but saying farewell to them , I departed for Macedonia .
47002014	Now thanks be to God , who always leads us in triumph in Christ , and making known through us the fragrance of His knowledge in every place .
47002015	For we are the fragrance of Christ to God among those being saved , and among those perishing .
47002016	To some we are the fragrance of death [ leading ] to death , but to others the fragrance of life [ leading ] to life . And who is sufficient for these things ?
47002017	For we are not as the rest , corrupting the word of God ; but as of sincerity , but as from God , we speak in the sight of God in Christ .
47003001	Do we begin again to commend ourselves ? Or do we need , as some do , letters of recommendation to you , or [ letters ] of recommendation from you ?
47003002	You are our letter , having been written in our hearts , being known and being read by all men ;
47003003	being made known that you are [ the ] letter of Christ , which was ministered by us , having been written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God , not in tablets of stone but in tablets of flesh , [ namely ] in hearts .
47003004	And we have such trust through Christ toward God .
47003005	Not that we are sufficient in ourselves to consider anything as from ourselves , but our sufficiency is from God ,
47003006	who also has made us efficient as ministers of the new covenant , not of [ the ] letter but of [ the ] Spirit ; for the letter kills , but the Spirit makes alive .
47003007	Now if the ministry of death , having been engraved in letters on stones , came to be with glory , so that the sons of Israel could not look intently into the face of Moses because of the glory of his countenance , the [ glory which ] [ was ] passing away ,
47003008	how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious ?
