47003009	For if the ministry of condemnation [ had ] glory , the ministry of righteousness exceeds much more in glory .
47003010	For even that which has been glorified has not been glorified in this respect , because of the surpassing glory .
47003011	For if that which passes away [ was ] glorious , then that which remains is much more glorious .
47003012	Therefore , having such hope , we use great boldness of speech -
47003013	and not as Moses , who put a veil over his face so that the sons of Israel could not look intently at the end of what was passing away .
47003014	But their minds were blinded . For until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the Old Testament , because the veil is removed in Christ .
47003015	But even to this day , when Moses is read , a veil lies on their heart .
47003016	But whenever one turns to the Lord , the veil is taken away .
47003017	Now the Lord is the Spirit ; and where the Spirit of the Lord [ is ] , there is freedom .
47003018	But we all , with unveiled face , beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord , are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory , just as by the Spirit of the Lord .
47004001	Therefore , since we have this ministry , as we received mercy , we do not despair ,
47004002	but we have renounced the hidden things of shame , not walking in craftiness nor falsifying the word of God , but by the disclosure of the truth , commending ourselves to every man's conscience before God .
47004003	But even if our gospel is hidden , it is hidden among those who are perishing ,
47004004	among whom the god of this age has blinded the minds of the unbelievers , so that the illumination of the gospel of the glory of Christ , who is the image of God , should not shine on them .
47004005	For we do not preach ourselves , but Christ Jesus the Lord , and ourselves your bondservants for Jesus' sake .
47004006	Because it is God who commanded light to shine out of darkness , who shined in our hearts to give [ the ] light of the knowledge of the glory of God in [ the ] face of Jesus Christ .
47004007	But we have this treasure in clay vessels , so that the extraordinary character of the power may be of God and not of us ;
47004008	in everything being oppressed , yet not crushed ; perplexed , but not in despair ;
47004009	persecuted , but not abandoned ; cast down , but not destroyed ;
47004010	always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus , so that also the life of Jesus may be revealed in our body .
47004011	For we who are living are always handed over to death for Jesus' sake , so that the life of Jesus also may be manifest in our body .
47004012	So then death is working in us , but life in you .
47004013	And since we have the same spirit of faith , according to that which is written , " I believed , and therefore I spoke , " we also believe , therefore we also speak ,
47004014	knowing that He who raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us through Jesus , and will present us together with you .
47004015	For all things [ are ] for your sakes , that grace , having spread through the many , may cause thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God .
47004016	Therefore we do not despair , but even if our outward man is being destroyed , yet the inward man is being renewed day by day .
47004017	For our momentary light affliction is working out for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory ,
47004018	while we do not look at the things which are seen , but at the things which are not seen . For the things which are seen are for a season , but the things which are not seen last forever .
47005001	For we know that if our earthly house , this tent , is destroyed , we have a building from God , a house not made by hand , eternal in the heavens .
47005002	For also in this we groan , earnestly desiring to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven ,
47005003	if indeed , having been clothed , we shall not be found naked .
47005004	For we who are in this tent groan , being burdened , inasmuch as we do not desire to be stripped , but to put on [ clothing ] , that that which is mortal may be swallowed up by life .
47005005	Now He who has prepared us for this same thing is God , who also gave to us the down payment of the Spirit .
47005006	Therefore always being confident , and knowing that while we are in the body , we are away from home from the Lord
47005007	( for we walk by faith , not by sight ) ,
47005008	but we are confident and prefer rather to be away from home from the body , and to be at home with the Lord .
47005009	Therefore also we have as our ambition , whether being at home , or being away from home , to be well pleasing to Him .
47005010	For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ , that each one may receive the things done in the body , in accordance with the things which he did , whether good or bad .
47005011	Knowing , therefore , the fear of the Lord , we persuade men ; but we have been made known to God . And I also hope to have been made known in your consciences .
47005012	For we do not commend ourselves again to you , but give to you an opportunity of boasting on our behalf , so that you may have [ an answer ] for those who boast in appearance and not in heart .
47005013	For if we were beside ourselves , it [ was ] for God ; or if we are of sound mind , [ it is ] for you .
47005014	For the love of Christ compels us , having concluded this : that if One died for all , then all died ;
47005015	and He died for all , so that they who live should live no longer for themselves , but for the [ One ] who died for them and rose again .
47005016	Therefore , from now on , we regard no one according to the flesh . Even though we have known Christ according to the flesh , yet now we know [ Him thus ] no longer .
47005017	Therefore , if anyone is in Christ , he is a new creation ; the old things passed away ; behold , all things have become new .
47005018	And all things are of God , who reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ , and who gave to us the ministry of this reconciliation ,
47005019	that is , that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself , not reckoning their transgressions to them , and committing to us the word of this reconciliation .
47005020	Now then , we serve as ambassadors for Christ , as though God were appealing through us : we implore [ you ] on Christ's behalf , be reconciled to God .
47005021	For He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us , so that we might become the righteousness of God in Him .
47006001	And working together [ with Him , ] we also urge that you not receive the grace of God in vain .
47006002	For He says : " In an acceptable time I have heard you , and in the day of salvation I have helped you . " Behold , now is the accepted time ; behold , now is the day of salvation .
47006003	We give no occasion for offense in anything , lest the ministry be blamed ,
47006004	but in everything commending ourselves as ministers of God : in much endurance , in tribulations , in hardships , in distresses ,
47006005	in stripes , in imprisonments , in disturbances , in labors , in sleepless nights , in fastings ;
47006006	in purity , in knowledge , in longsuffering , in kindness , in the Holy Spirit , in sincere love ,
47006007	through the word of truth , through the power of God , through the weapons of righteousness on the right hand and on the left hand ,
47006008	by honor and dishonor , by ill repute and good repute ; as deceivers , and yet true ;
47006009	as being unknown , and yet well known ; as dying , and behold , we live ; as being disciplined , and not being put to death ;
47006010	as sorrowful , yet always rejoicing ; as poor , yet making many rich ; as having nothing , and yet possessing all things .
47006011	O Corinthians ! We have spoken openly to you , our heart has been opened wide .
47006012	You are not restricted by us , but you are restricted by your own affections .
47006013	Now in return for the same - I speak as to children - you also be opened wide .
47006014	Do not become unequally yoked with unbelievers ; for what participation is there for righteousness with lawlessness ? And what communion is there for light with darkness ?
47006015	And what agreement is there for Christ with Belial ? Or what part is there for a believer with an infidel ?
47006016	And what union is there for the temple of God with idols ? For you are the temple of the living God , just as God has said : " I will dwell in them and walk among them , and I will be their God , and they shall be My people . "
47006017	Therefore " Come out from the midst of them and be separated , " says the Lord . " Do not touch what is unclean , and I will receive you . "
47006018	" I will be a Father to you , and you will be My sons and daughters , says the LORD Almighty . "
47007001	Therefore , having these promises , beloved , let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit , perfecting holiness in the fear of God .
47007002	Receive us [ in your hearts ] . We have wronged no one , we have corrupted no one , we have defrauded no one .
47007003	I do not speak to condemn you ; for I have said before that you are in our hearts , so that we die together and we live together .
47007004	Great is my confidence toward you , great is my boasting concerning you . I have been filled with comfort . I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation .
47007005	For indeed , when we came to Macedonia , our flesh had no rest , but we were afflicted on every side ; outside [ were ] fightings , inside [ were ] fears .
47007006	Nevertheless God , who comforts the downcast , comforted us by the coming of Titus ,
47007007	and not only by his coming , but also by the consolation with which he was comforted over you , as he reported to us your earnest longing , your mourning , your zeal for me , so that I rejoiced even more .
47007008	Because even if I made you sorry in the letter , I do not regret it , even if I did regret it . For I perceive that the same letter made you sorry , though only for a season .
47007009	Now I rejoice , not because you were made sorry , but because your sorrow led to repentance ; for you were made sorry in a godly manner , that you might suffer loss from us in nothing .
47007010	For godly sorrow produces repentance leading to salvation , without regret ; but worldly sorrow produces death .
47007011	For behold this very thing , that you sorrowed in a godly manner , how much diligence it produced in you , even an eagerness to defend , even indignation , even fear , even longing , even zeal , even vengeance ! In all things you demonstrated yourselves to be pure in this matter .
47007012	Therefore , although I wrote to you , it was not for the sake of him who did the wrong , nor for the sake of him who was wronged , but so that your diligence on our behalf might be made known to you before God .
47007013	Because of this we have been comforted . And in your comfort we rejoiced exceedingly more over the joy of Titus , because his spirit has been refreshed by you all .
47007014	Because if in anything I have boasted to him concerning you , I was not put to shame , but as we spoke all things to you in truth , thus also our boasting to Titus became truth .
47007015	And his affections are far greater toward you as he remembers the obedience of you all , how with fear and trembling you received him .
47007016	[ Therefore ] I rejoice that in everything I am confident in you .
47008001	Now we make known to you brothers , the grace of God which has been given to the churches of Macedonia ,
47008002	how that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded in the riches of their generosity .
47008003	For I bear witness that according to their ability , and beyond their ability , they were freely willing ,
47008004	with much appeal , begging us [ for ] the grace and the fellowship of the ministry to the saints -
47008005	and not as we hoped , but they first gave their own selves to the Lord , and then to us by the will of God ,
47008006	so that we urged Titus , that just as he had begun before , thus he would also finish this grace also in you .
47008007	But as you abound in everything - in faith , in word , in knowledge , in all diligence , and in your love for us - see that you abound in this grace also .
47008008	I speak not by a command , but I am testing the genuineness of your love by means of the diligence of others .
47008009	For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , that though He was rich , yet on account of you He became poor , that you through His poverty might become rich .
47008010	And I give [ my ] opinion in this : For this is profitable for you , who not only previously began doing [ this ] , but also desired to , since last year .
47008011	And now also complete doing [ it ] ; that as indeed there [ was ] the readiness to desire [ it ] , thus also there [ may be ] the completion from what you have .
47008012	For if there is first a readiness , it is acceptable according to what one has , and not according to what he does not have .
47008013	For I do not [ mean ] that others should be relieved and you burdened ;
47008014	but by way of equality , that now at the present time your abundance [ may supply ] their need , that their abundance also may supply your need , in order that there may be equality .
47008015	As it is written , " He [ who ] gathered much did not have too much , and he [ who gathered ] little had no lack . "
47008016	But thanks be to God who puts the same earnest care for you in the heart of Titus .
47008017	Because he accepted my appeal , but being more diligent , he came to you of his own accord .
47008018	And we sent together with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches ,
47008019	and not only that , but who was also chosen by the churches as our traveling companion with this gift , which is ministered by us to the glory of the Lord Himself and [ to show ] our readiness -
47008020	avoiding this , lest anyone should blame us in this abundance which is ministered by us ;
47008021	having regard for honorable things , not only before the Lord , but also before men .
47008022	And we sent together with them our brother whom we often approved in many things , being diligent , but now [ being ] much more diligent , by [ his ] great confidence in you .
47008023	If [ anyone inquires ] about Titus , [ he is ] my partner and fellow worker concerning you ; or if our brothers [ are inquired about ] , [ they are ] messengers of the churches , the glory of Christ .
47008024	Therefore show to them the proof of your love , and of our boasting concerning you , before the churches .
47009001	Now concerning the ministering to the saints , it is unnecessary for me to write to you ;
47009002	for I know your readiness , about which I boast concerning you to the Macedonians , that Achaia has been prepared since last year , and your zeal has provoked the majority .
47009003	And I have sent the brothers , lest our boasting about you lose its justification in this matter , that just as I said , you may be prepared ,
47009004	lest perhaps if [ some ] Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared , we ( not to mention you ! ) should be ashamed of this confident boasting .
47009005	Therefore I thought it necessary to urge the brothers , that they should go before [ me ] to you , and should arrange in advance your generous gift , which you had previously promised , [ that ] this would be ready , thus as a blessing and not as grudgingly given .
47009006	But this I say : he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly , and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully .
47009007	Let each [ one give ] just as he decides in his heart , not grudgingly or of necessity ; for God loves a cheerful giver .
47009008	And God is able to make all grace abound toward you , that in everything always having all sufficiency , you may abound for every good work ,
47009009	just as it is written : " He has dispersed , He has given to the poor ; His righteousness endures forever . "
47009010	Now may He who supplies seed to the sower , and bread for food , supply and multiply the seed you have sown and increase the fruits of your righteousness ;
47009011	in everything being made rich to all generosity , which produces thanksgiving through us to God .
47009012	Because the ministry of this service not only is supplying the needs of the saints , but also is abounding through many thanksgivings to God ,
47009013	while through the approved character of this ministry , they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the gospel of Christ , and [ for the ] generosity of your sharing toward them and toward all ,
47009014	and by their prayer for you , who long for you because of the surpassing grace of God in you .
47009015	Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift !
47010001	Now I , Paul , myself appeal to you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ , I who face to face [ am ] lowly among you , but when I am away am bold toward you .
47010002	But I beseech [ you ] that when I am present I may not be bold with the confidence with which I plan to be bold toward some , who consider us as walking according to the flesh .
47010003	For though we walk in the flesh , we do not war according to the flesh .
47010004	For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal , but mighty by God to the pulling down of strongholds ,
47010005	casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God , and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ ,
47010006	and being ready to avenge every act of disobedience , whenever your obedience is fulfilled .
47010007	Do you look at things as they appear ? If anyone has persuaded himself that he is Christ's , let him again consider this in himself , that just as he is Christ's , even so we are Christ's .
47010008	For even if I should boast somewhat more concerning our authority , which the Lord gave us for edification and not for your destruction , I will not be ashamed ,
47010009	lest I seem to terrify you by my letters .
47010010	" For his letters , " they say , " are severe and boisterous , but his bodily presence [ is ] feeble , and his speech amounts to nothing . "
47010011	Let such a person consider this , that of what sort we are in word by letters when we are absent , of such a kind [ we will ] also [ be ] in deed when we are present .
47010012	For we dare not to class ourselves or to compare ourselves with those who commend themselves , but they , measuring themselves by themselves , and comparing themselves among themselves , do not understand .
47010013	But we will not boast beyond limits , but according to the measure of the sphere [ of influence ] which God assigned us as a measure , to reach even as far as you .
47010014	For we are not overextending ourselves , as though our authority did not reach to you , for it was to you that we came with the gospel of Christ ;
47010015	not boasting beyond the limits in the labors of others , but having hope , that as your faith is increased , we shall be greatly enlarged by you according to our sphere [ of influence ] ,
47010016	to preach the gospel to the [ regions ] beyond you , [ and ] not to boast in the things done in the sphere [ of influence ] of others .
47010017	But " he who boasts , let him boast in the LORD . "
47010018	For not he who commends himself is approved , but he [ ] whom the Lord commends .
47011001	Oh , that you would bear with me a little in my foolishness ; but indeed you do bear with me .
47011002	For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy , for I have betrothed you to one husband , to present you as a pure virgin to Christ .
47011003	But I fear , lest perhaps as the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness , so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ .
47011004	For if he who comes [ to you ] preaches another Jesus whom we did not preach , or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received , or a different gospel which you did not accept , you may well put up with him !
47011005	For I consider [ myself ] [ in ] nothing to have been inferior to the most super apostles .
47011006	But even if I [ am ] unskilled in speech , yet [ I am ] not [ inferior ] in knowledge , but in every [ way ] I was made known to you in all things .
47011007	Or did I commit sin in humbling myself in order that you might be exalted , because I preached the gospel of God to you free of charge ?
47011008	I robbed other churches , taking wages [ from them ] to minister to you ,
47011009	and when I was present with you , and in need , I did not burden anyone ; for the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied my need . And in everything I kept myself from being a burden to you , and so I will keep myself .
47011010	As the truth of Christ is in me , that this boasting will not be silenced in me in the regions of Achaia .
47011011	Why ? Because I do not love you ? God knows !
47011012	But what I am doing , I will also continue to do , that I may cut off the opportunity of those who desire an opportunity , that in what they boast they may be found just as we [ are ] .
47011013	For such are false apostles , deceitful workers , transforming themselves into apostles of Christ .
47011014	And no wonder ! For Satan himself transforms himself into an angel of light .
47011015	Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also transform themselves into ministers of righteousness , whose end will be according to their works .
47011016	Again I say , let no one think me a fool . Otherwise , at least receive me as a fool , that I also may boast a little .
47011017	What I speak , I speak not according to the Lord , but as it were , foolishly , in this confidence of boasting .
47011018	Since many are boasting according to the flesh , I also will boast .
47011019	For you bear with fools gladly , being wise [ yourselves ] !
47011020	For you put up with it if someone enslaves you , if someone devours you , if someone takes from you , if someone exalts himself , if someone strikes you in the face .
47011021	To our shame , I say that we were too weak [ for that ] ! But in whatever anyone is bold ( I speak foolishly ) I am bold also .
47011022	Are they Hebrews ? So am I . Are they Israelites ? So am I . Are they the seed of Abraham ? So am I .
47011023	Are they ministers of Christ ? ( I speak as a fool ) I [ am ] even more : in labors far more , in beatings immeasurably , in imprisonments far more , in deaths often .
47011024	By [ the ] Jews five times I received forty stripes minus one .
47011025	Three times I was beaten with rods ; once I was stoned ; three times I was shipwrecked ; a night and a day I have spent in the depth [ of the sea ] .
47011026	In journeys often , in dangers of rivers , in dangers of robbers , in dangers from my own race , in dangers from the Gentiles , in dangers in the city , in dangers in the wilderness , in dangers in the sea , in dangers among false brothers ;
47011027	in labor and hardship , in sleepless nights often , in hunger and thirst , in fastings often , in cold and nakedness -
47011028	apart from what I leave unmentioned , what comes against me daily : the anxiety for all the churches .
47011029	Who is weak , and I am not weak ? Who is caused to stumble , and I do not burn [ with indignation ] ?
47011030	If I must boast , I will boast about the things concerning my weakness .
47011031	The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ , who is blessed forever , knows that I am not lying .
47011032	In Damascus the governor , under Aretas the king , was guarding the city of the Damascenes with a garrison , desiring to arrest me ;
47011033	but I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall , and escaped from his hands .
47012001	It is indeed not profitable for me to boast . I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord :
47012002	I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago - whether in the body I do not know , or whether out of the body I do not know , God knows - such a one was caught up to the third heaven .
47012003	And I know such a man - whether in the body or out of the body I do not know , God knows -
47012004	that he was caught up into Paradise and heard unspeakable words , which it is not permitted for a man to utter .
47012005	Concerning such a one I will boast , but concerning myself I will not boast , except in my weaknesses .
47012006	For if I should desire to boast , I will not be foolish ; for I will speak [ the ] truth . But I spare [ you ] , lest anyone consider me to be beyond what he sees me [ to be ] or hears something from me .
47012007	And lest I exalt myself above measure by the excellence of the revelations , a thorn in the flesh was given to me , an angel of Satan , that it might beat me , lest I exalt myself above measure .
47012008	Concerning this I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might depart from me .
47012009	And He said to me , " My grace is sufficient for you , for My power is perfected in weakness . " Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my weaknesses , in order that the power of Christ may rest upon me .
47012010	Therefore I delight in weaknesses , in insults , in calamities , in persecutions , in distresses , for Christ's sake . For whenever I am weak , then I am strong .
47012011	I have become a fool in boasting ; you have compelled me ! For I ought to have been commended by you ; for in nothing have I been inferior to the super apostles , though I am nothing .
47012012	Truly the signs of an apostle were worked among you with all perseverance , in signs and wonders and miracles .
47012013	For what is it in which you were inferior to other churches , except that I myself did not burden you ? Forgive me this wrong !
47012014	Now for the third time I am ready to come to you , and I will not burden you . For I do not seek what is yours , but you . For the children ought not to store up for the parents , but the parents for the children .
47012015	And I gladly will spend and be expended for your souls ; although the more abundantly I love you , the less I am loved .
47012016	But be that as it may , I did not burden you . Nevertheless , being crafty , I took you with guile !
47012017	Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you ?
47012018	I urged Titus , and I sent with him the brother . Did Titus take advantage of you ? Did [ we ] not [ walk ] in the same Spirit ? Did we not walk in the same steps ?
47012019	Again , do you think that we are defending ourselves to you ? We speak before God in Christ . But we do all things , beloved , for your edification .
47012020	For I am afraid , lest perhaps when I come , I will not find you as I desire , and that I will be found by you as you do not desire ; lest perhaps there [ be ] contentions , jealousies , outbursts of wrath , disputes , slanders , gossipings , pride , disorders ;
47012021	lest , when I come again , my God will humble me before you , and I will mourn for many who have previously sinned and have not repented for the impurity and fornication and lewdness which they practiced .
47013001	This [ will be ] the third time I am coming to you . " By the mouth of two or three witnesses every word shall be established . "
47013002	I have previously said , and I say beforehand , as being present the second [ time ] , and now being absent I write to those who have sinned before , and to all the rest , that if I come again I will not spare [ you , ]
47013003	since you are seeking proof of Christ speaking in me , who is not weak toward you , but strong in you .
47013004	For although He was crucified in weakness , yet He lives by the power of God . For we are weak in Him , yet we shall live with Him by the power of God toward you .
47013005	Scrutinize yourselves as to whether you are in the faith ; prove your own selves . Or do you not know yourselves , that Jesus Christ is in you , unless indeed you are reprobates ?
47013006	But I trust that you will know that we are not reprobates .
47013007	Now I pray to God that you do no evil , not that we may appear approved , but that you may do what is honorable , though we may be as reprobates .
47013008	For we can do nothing against the truth , but on behalf of the truth .
47013009	For we rejoice whenever we are weak , but you are strong . And this also we pray , that you may be made complete .
47013010	Because of this I write these things being absent , in order that when I am present I may not deal sharply with you , according to the authority which the Lord gave me for edification and not for destruction .
47013011	Finally brothers , farewell . Restore [ yourselves , ] comfort [ yourselves ] , be in agreement , be at peace ; and the God of love and peace will be with you .
47013012	Greet one another with a holy kiss .
47013013	All the saints greet you .
47013014	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ , and the love of God , and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all . Amen .
48001001	Paul , an apostle ( not from men nor through man , but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead ) ,
48001002	and all the brothers with me , to the churches of Galatia :
48001003	Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ ,
48001004	who gave Himself for our sins , so that He might deliver us from this present evil age , according to the will of our God and Father ,
48001005	to whom [ be ] glory forever and ever . Amen .
48001006	I marvel that you are turning so quickly from Him who called you in the grace of Christ , to a different gospel ,
48001007	which is not another ; except there are certain people who trouble you and wish to pervert the gospel of Christ .
48001008	But even if we , or an angel from heaven , should preach a gospel to you other than what we preached to you , let him be accursed .
48001009	As we have said before , and I say again just now , if anyone preaches a gospel to you other than what you received , let him be accursed .
48001010	For do I now persuade men , or God ? Or do I seek to please men ? For if I still pleased men , I would not be a bondservant of Christ .
48001011	But I make known to you , brothers , the gospel preached by me is not according to man .
48001012	For I neither received it from man , nor was I taught it , but through the revelation of Jesus Christ .
48001013	For you have heard of my former conduct at one time in Judaism , that beyond measure I used to persecute the church of God , and I was devastating it .
48001014	And I was advancing in Judaism above many my own age , being far more zealous for the traditions of my forefathers .
48001015	But when it pleased God , who separated me from my mother's womb and called me through His grace ,
48001016	to reveal His Son in me , so that I might preach Him among the Gentiles , I did not immediately consult with flesh and blood ,
48001017	neither did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me ; but I went to Arabia , and returned once more to Damascus .
48001018	Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter , and I stayed with him fifteen days .
48001019	But I saw none of the other apostles except James , the Lord's brother .
48001020	Now what I write to you , behold , before God , I do not lie .
48001021	Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia .
48001022	And I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea which are in Christ .
48001023	But they heard only , " He who persecuted us in times past now preaches the faith which at one time he was devastating . "
48001024	And they glorified God in me .
48002001	Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas , also taking Titus along .
48002002	And I went up by revelation , and I set before them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles , but privately to those with influence , lest somehow I might run , or had run , in vain .
48002003	But not even Titus who was with me , although he was a Greek , was compelled to be circumcised ;
48002004	and that was because of false brothers secretly brought in ( who slipped in to spy out our freedom which we have in Christ Jesus , so that they might reduce us to slavery ) ,
48002005	to whom not even for an hour did we yield in subjection , that the truth of the gospel might remain with you .
48002006	But from those who seemed to be something - whatever they were , it makes no difference to me ; God shows partiality to no man - so to me , those with influence contributed nothing ,
48002007	but on the contrary , when they saw that I had been entrusted [ with ] the gospel for the uncircumcised , just as Peter [ was with the gospel ] for the circumcised ,
48002008	( for He who worked with Peter in [ the ] apostleship to the circumcised , worked also with me in [ that for ] the Gentiles ) ,
48002009	and when James , Cephas , and John , who seemed to be pillars , perceived the grace which was given to me , they gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship , that we [ should go ] to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised ;
48002010	only they desired that we should remember the poor , which indeed I made every effort to do this very thing .
48002011	But when Peter came to Antioch , I opposed him to his face , because he was to be blamed .
48002012	For before certain [ men ] came from James , he would eat together with the Gentiles ; but when they came , he began to draw back and began to separate himself , fearing those of the circumcision party .
48002013	And the rest of the Jews joined him in hypocrisy , so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy .
48002014	But when I saw that they did not act rightly with respect to the truth of the gospel , I said to Peter before them all , " If you , being a Jew , live in Gentile fashion and not in Jewish fashion , why do you compel the Gentiles to live as Jews ?
48002015	We [ who are ] Jews by nature , and not sinners of the Gentiles ,
48002016	knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by [ the ] faith of Jesus Christ , even we have believed in Christ Jesus , so that we might be justified by [ the ] faith of Christ , and not by [ the ] works of the law ; because no flesh shall be justified by [ the ] works of the law .
48002017	But if by seeking to be justified in Christ , we ourselves also were found sinners , then is Christ a minister of sin ? By no means !
48002018	For if I build again the [ ] things which I destroyed , I make myself a transgressor .
48002019	For I through the law died to the law , that I might live to God .
48002020	I have been crucified with Christ ; it is no longer I who live , but Christ lives in me ; and the [ life ] which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God , who loved me , and gave Himself for me .
48002021	I do not annul the grace of God ; for if righteousness comes through the law , then Christ died for nothing . "
48003001	O foolish Galatians ! Who has bewitched you , that you should not obey the truth , before whose eyes Jesus Christ was portrayed publicly among you as crucified ?
48003002	This only do I wish to learn from you : Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ?
48003003	Are you so foolish ? Having begun in the Spirit , will you now be made perfect in the flesh ?
48003004	Have you suffered so many things in vain - If indeed [ they ] really [ were ] in vain ?
48003005	Therefore He who supplies the Spirit to you and works miracles among you , does He do it by the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ? -
48003006	Just as Abraham " believed God , and it was credited to him as righteousness . "
48003007	Know therefore that those who are of faith , these are sons of Abraham .
48003008	And the Scripture , foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith , preached the gospel beforehand to Abraham , [ saying ] that , " In you all the nations shall be blessed . "
48003009	Therefore those who are of faith are blessed with believing Abraham .
48003010	For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse ; for it is written , " Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all the things which are written in the book of the law , to do them . "
48003011	But that no one is justified by the law before God is evident , for " The just shall live by faith . "
48003012	But the law is not of faith , but " the man who does them shall live by them . "
48003013	Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law , having become a curse for us , for it is written , " Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree , "
48003014	so that the blessing of Abraham might come to the Gentiles in Christ Jesus , that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith .
48003015	Brothers , I speak in human fashion : A covenant is of a man , yet having been confirmed , no one annuls or adds to it .
48003016	Now to Abraham and his Seed were the promises spoken . He does not say , " And to seeds , " as of many , but as of one , " And to your Seed , " who is Christ .
48003017	And this I say , that the law , which was four hundred and thirty years later , does not annul the covenant previously confirmed to Christ by God , so that it make the promise of no effect .
48003018	For if the inheritance [ comes ] by the law , it is no longer of promise ; but God has given it to Abraham by promise .
48003019	Why then the law ? It was added on account of transgressions , until the Seed should come to whom it had been promised ; and it was commanded through angels by the hand of a mediator .
48003020	Now the mediator is not for one person , but God is one .
48003021	Therefore , [ is ] the law against the promises of God ? By no means ! For if a law had been given which was able to give life , truly righteousness would have been by the law .
48003022	But the Scripture has confined all under sin , so that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe .
48003023	But before faith came , we were kept in custody under the law , having been hemmed in for the faith which was to be revealed .
48003024	Therefore the law has become our custodian , [ leading us ] to Christ , so that we might be justified by faith .
48003025	But after faith has come , we are no longer under a custodian .
48003026	For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus .
48003027	For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ .
48003028	There is neither Jew nor Greek , neither slave nor free , there is neither male nor female ; for you are all one in Christ Jesus .
48003029	And if you are Christ's , then you are Abraham's seed , and heirs according to the promise .
48004001	Now I say , for as much time as the heir is a minor , he does not differ at all from a slave , though he is master of all ,
48004002	but is under guardians and stewards until the time appointed by the father .
48004003	Even so we , when we were minors , were enslaved by the elements of the world .
48004004	But when the fullness of the time had come , God sent forth His Son , born of a woman , born under the law ,
48004005	so that He might redeem those under the law , so that we might receive the adoption .
48004006	And because you are sons , God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts , crying out , " Abba , Father ! "
48004007	Therefore you are no longer a slave but a son , and if a son , also an heir of God through Christ .
48004008	But at one time indeed , when you did not know God , you were slaves to those which by nature were not gods .
48004009	But now , having known God , or rather , having been known by God , how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements , to which once again you wish to be slaves ?
48004010	You observe days and months and seasons and years .
48004011	I am afraid for you , lest somehow I have worked hard for you in vain .
48004012	Brothers , I beseech you , become as I am , because I also [ am ] as you [ are ] . You have not wronged me at all .
48004013	You know that because of weakness in the flesh I preached the gospel to you the former [ time . ]
48004014	And my trial which was in my flesh you did not despise nor disdain , but as an angel of God you received me , even as Christ Jesus .
48004015	What then was your blessing ? For I bear you witness that , if possible , you would have torn out your own eyes and given them to me !
48004016	Have I therefore become your enemy by speaking the truth to you ?
48004017	They are zealous about you in the wrong way ; but they wish to shut you out , so that you will be zealous about them .
48004018	But it is good to be zealous in a good thing always , and not only when I am present with you .
48004019	My little children , for whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you !
48004020	And I wanted to be present with you just now and to change my tone ; because I am uncertain about you .
48004021	Tell me , you who wish to be under the law , do you not hear the law ?
48004022	For it is written that Abraham had two sons : the one by the servant girl , the other by a freewoman .
48004023	But he who was of the servant girl was born according to the flesh , and he of the freewoman through the promise ,
48004024	which things are symbolic . For these are two covenants : one in fact from Mount Sinai , bearing children into slavery , which is Hagar -
48004025	for Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia , and corresponds to the present Jerusalem , and is in slavery with her children -
48004026	but the Jerusalem above is free , which is the mother of us all .
48004027	For it is written : " Rejoice , O barren , who does not give birth ; break forth and shout , who does not have birth pangs ; because the children of the desolate are many more than those of her who has a husband . "
48004028	But we , brothers , like Isaac , are children of promise .
48004029	But just as then the [ one ] who was born according to the flesh persecuted the [ one born ] according to the Spirit , so also it is now .
48004030	But what does the Scripture say ? " Cast out the servant girl and her son , for the son of the servant girl shall by no means inherit with the son of the freewoman . "
48004031	So then , brothers , we are not children of the servant girl , but of the free [ woman ] .
48005001	Stand fast therefore in the freedom in which Christ has made us free , and do not be loaded down again with a yoke of bondage .
48005002	Indeed I , Paul , say to you that if you become circumcised , Christ will profit you nothing .
48005003	And I testify again to every man who becomes circumcised that he is a obligated to keep the whole law .
48005004	You have become estranged from Christ , you who are justified by law ; you have fallen from grace .
48005005	For we by the Spirit eagerly await [ for ] the hope of righteousness by faith .
48005006	For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything , but faith working through love .
48005007	You were running well ; who hindered you from obeying the truth ?
48005008	This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you .
48005009	A little leaven leavens the whole lump .
48005010	I have confidence in you , in the Lord , that you will be intent on nothing else ; but he who troubles you will bear his judgment , whoever he may be .
48005011	And I , brothers , if I still preach circumcision , why am I still persecuted ? In that case the offense of the cross has been done away with .
48005012	Oh that those who disturb you would even castrate themselves !
48005013	For you , brothers were called to freedom ; only do not use freedom for an opportunity for the flesh , but through love serve one another .
48005014	For all the law is fulfilled in one word , in [ this ] : " You shall love your neighbor as yourself . "
48005015	But if you bite and devour one another , watch out that you are not consumed by one another !
48005016	I say then : Walk in the Spirit , and you shall by no means fulfill the lust of the flesh .
48005017	For the flesh lusts against the Spirit , and the Spirit against the flesh ; and these things oppose each other , so that you do not do the things that you wish .
48005018	But if you are led by the Spirit , you are not under the law .
48005019	Now the works of the flesh are manifest , which are : adultery , fornication , immorality , lewdness ,
48005020	idolatry , sorcery , hatred , contentions , jealousies , outbursts of wrath , selfish ambitions , dissensions , factions ,
48005021	envies , murders , drinking bouts , revelries , and the like ; which I tell you beforehand , just as I also told you in time past , that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God .
48005022	But the fruit of the Spirit is love , joy , peace , longsuffering , kindness , goodness , faithfulness ,
48005023	gentleness , self-control - against such things there is no law .
48005024	And those who are Christ's have crucified the flesh with its passions and lusts .
48005025	If we live by the Spirit , let us also walk by the Spirit .
48005026	Let us not become conceited , provoking one another , envying one another .
48006001	Brothers , if a man is overtaken in any trespass , you who are spiritual restore such a person in a spirit of gentleness , looking out for yourself lest you also be tempted .
48006002	Bear one another's burdens , and thus fulfill the law of Christ .
48006003	For if anyone thinks that he is something , when he is nothing , he deceives himself .
48006004	But let each [ person ] examine his own work , and then he will have boasting in himself alone , and not in the other .
48006005	For each one shall bear his own load .
48006006	Let him who is taught the word share in all good things with him who teaches .
48006007	Do not be deceived , God is not mocked ; for what a man sows , this also he will reap .
48006008	For he who sows to his flesh , from his own flesh will reap corruption , but he who sows to the Spirit , from the Spirit will reap everlasting life .
48006009	And while we do good , let us not lose heart , for in due season we shall reap if we do not become weary .
48006010	So then , as we have opportunity , let us work what is good toward all , but especially toward those who are of the household of faith .
48006011	See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand !
48006012	As many as wish to make a good showing in the flesh , these compel you to get circumcised , only so that they should not be persecuted for the cross of Christ .
48006013	For not even those who are circumcised keep the law themselves , but they wish you to be circumcised that they may boast in your flesh .
48006014	But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ , by whom the world has been crucified to me , and I to the world .
48006015	For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything , but a new creation .
48006016	And as many as walk according to this rule , peace and mercy be upon them , and upon the Israel of God .
48006017	Finally , let no one cause me trouble , for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus .
48006018	Brothers , the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
49001001	Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , to the saints who are at Ephesus , and faithful in Christ Jesus :
49001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49001003	Blessed [ be ] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenlies in Christ ,
49001004	just as He chose us in Him before the foundation of the world , that we should be holy and blameless before Him in love ,
49001005	having predestined us to adoption as sons by Jesus Christ to Himself , according to the good pleasure of His will ,
49001006	to the praise of the glory of His grace , by which He bestowed favor upon us in the Beloved .
49001007	In Him we have redemption through His blood , the forgiveness of sins , according to the riches of His grace
49001008	which He made to abound toward us in all wisdom and insight ,
49001009	having made known to us the mystery of His will , according to His good pleasure which He purposed in Himself ,
49001010	for an administration of the fullness of the times , [ He might ] bring together all things in Christ , those in heaven and those on the earth - in Him .
49001011	In whom also we have obtained an inheritance , being predestined according to the purpose of Him who works all things according to the counsel of His will ,
49001012	so that we should be to the praise of His glory , we who first trusted in Christ ;
49001013	in whom also you , when you heard the word of truth , the gospel of your salvation ; in whom also , having believed , you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise ,
49001014	who is the guarantee of our inheritance until the redemption of the possession , to the praise of His glory .
49001015	Because of this I also , after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints ,
49001016	do not cease to give thanks concerning you , making mention of you in my prayers :
49001017	that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of glory , may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him ,
49001018	the eyes of your heart having been enlightened ; that you may know what is the hope of His calling , what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints ,
49001019	and what is the surpassing greatness of His power toward us who believe , according to the working of His mighty power
49001020	which He worked in Christ , having raised Him from the dead , and seated [ Him ] at His right hand in the heavenlies ,
49001021	above every ruler and authority and power and dominion , and every name that is named , not only in this age but also in the coming [ age ] .
49001022	And He subjected all things under His feet , and gave Him to be head over all things to the church ,
49001023	which is His body , the fullness of Him filling all things in all .
49002001	And you [ He made alive , ] being dead in transgressions and sins ,
49002002	in which you once walked according to the age of this world , according to the prince of the power of the air , the spirit which is now working in the sons of disobedience ,
49002003	among whom also we all once conducted ourselves in the lusts of our flesh , fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the senses , and were by nature children of wrath , as also the rest .
49002004	But God , being rich in mercy , because of His great love with which He loved us ,
49002005	even when we were dead in transgressions , made us alive together with Christ ( by grace you have been saved ) ,
49002006	and raised us up together , and seated us together in the heavenlies in Christ Jesus ,
49002007	that in the coming ages He might show the surpassing riches of His grace in His kindness toward us in Christ Jesus .
49002008	For by grace you are saved through faith , and that not of yourselves ; [ it is ] the gift of God ,
49002009	not of works , lest anyone should boast .
49002010	For we are His handiwork , created in Christ Jesus for good works , which God prepared beforehand that we should walk in them .
49002011	Therefore remember that you , once Gentiles in the flesh - who are called Uncircumcision by what is called the Circumcision made by hands in the flesh -
49002012	that at that time you were apart from Christ , being estranged from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers to the covenants of promise , not having hope and atheists in the world .
49002013	But now in Christ Jesus , you who once were far away have come to be near by the blood of Christ .
49002014	For He Himself is our peace , who has made both one , and who destroyed the dividing wall of separation ,
49002015	having abolished in His flesh the enmity , that is , the law of commandments contained in ordinances , that He might create in Himself one new man [ from ] the two , [ thus ] making peace ,
49002016	and that He might reconcile them both to God in one body through the cross , putting to death the enmity in Himself .
49002017	And having come , He preached peace to you who were far away and to those near .
49002018	Because through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father .
49002019	So then , you are no longer strangers and aliens , but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God ,
49002020	being built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets , Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone ,
49002021	in whom the whole building , being joined together , grows into a holy temple in the Lord ,
49002022	in whom you also are being built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit .
49003001	For this reason I , Paul , the prisoner of Christ Jesus in behalf of you Gentiles -
49003002	if indeed you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which was given to me for you ,
49003003	how that by revelation He made known to me the mystery , just as I wrote before briefly ,
49003004	with reference to which , when you read , you can understand my insight in the mystery of Christ ,
49003005	which in other generations was not made known to the sons of men , as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets :
49003006	that the Gentiles should be joint - heirs , and of the same body , and joint-partakers in His promise in Christ by the gospel ,
49003007	of which I became a minister according to the free gift of the grace of God which was given to me according to the working of His power .
49003008	To me , the very least of all the saints , this grace was given , to preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ ,
49003009	and to enlighten all [ as to ] what is the administration of the mystery , which had been hidden from the ages in God , who created all things through Jesus Christ ;
49003010	that the manifold wisdom of God might be made known by the church to the rulers and authorities in the heavenlies ,
49003011	according to the eternal purpose which He made in Christ Jesus our Lord ,
49003012	in whom we have the boldness and the access with confidence through faith in Him .
49003013	Therefore I beseech [ you ] not to lose heart at my tribulations on your behalf , which is your glory .
49003014	For this reason I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
49003015	from whom every family in heaven and upon earth takes its name ,
49003016	that He would grant you , according to the riches of His glory , to be strengthened with power by His Spirit in the inner man ,
49003017	that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith ; being rooted and founded in love ,
49003018	that you may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and depth and height -
49003019	and to know the love of Christ which surpasses knowledge ; that you may be filled with all the fullness of God .
49003020	Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think , according to the power that works in us ,
49003021	to Him [ be ] glory in the church by Christ Jesus to all generations , forever and ever . Amen .
49004001	Therefore I , the prisoner of the Lord , urge you to walk worthy of the calling with which you were called ,
49004002	with all humility and meekness , with longsuffering , bearing with one another in love ,
49004003	being diligent to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace .
49004004	There is one body and one Spirit , just as also you were called in one hope of your calling ;
49004005	one Lord , one faith , one baptism ;
49004006	one God and Father of all , who is over all , and through all , and in us all .
49004007	But to each one of us grace was given according to the measure of the free gift of Christ .
49004008	Therefore He says : " When He ascended on high , He led captivity captive , and gave gifts to men . "
49004009	But that " He ascended " - what is it but that He also first descended into the lower parts of the earth ?
49004010	He that descended , He is also the [ One ] who ascended far above all the heavens , that He might fill all things .
49004011	And He gave some as apostles , and some as prophets , and some as evangelists , and some as pastors and teachers ,
49004012	for the perfecting of the saints for the work of ministry , for the building up of the body of Christ ,
49004013	until we all arrive to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God , to a mature man , to [ the ] measure of [ the ] stature of the fullness of Christ ;
49004014	that we may no longer be infants , being tossed as by waves , and being carried about by every wind of doctrine , by the trickery of men , by craftiness in regard to deceitful scheming ,
49004015	but speaking the truth in love , we may grow up in all things into Him who is the head - Christ ;
49004016	from whom the whole body , being fitted and held together by what every joint supplies , according to the working of the measure of each individual part , causes the growth of the body for the edification of itself in love .
49004017	This I say , therefore , and testify in the Lord , that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk , in the vanity of their mind ,
49004018	having been darkened in understanding , being estranged from the life of God , because of the ignorance which is in them , because of the hardness of their heart ;
49004019	who , having become callous , gave themselves over to debauchery , for the working of uncleanness with utmost greediness .
49004020	But you did not thus learn Christ ,
49004021	if indeed you have heard Him and were instructed by Him , just as the truth is in Jesus :
49004022	that you put off , concerning your former way of life , the old man which is being corrupted according to the deceitful lusts ,
49004023	and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind ,
49004024	and that you put on the new man which was created in the likeness of God , in true righteousness and holiness .
49004025	Therefore , having put off falsehood , " Let each one speak truth with his neighbor , " for we are members of one another .
49004026	" Be angry , and do not sin " : do not let the sun set on your anger ,
49004027	nor give opportunity to the devil .
49004028	Let him who stole steal no longer , but rather let him labor , working that which is good with his hands , in order that he may have something to share with him who has need .
49004029	Let no corrupt word proceed from your mouth , but only what is good for edification , that it may give grace to them that hear .
49004030	And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God , by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption .
49004031	Let all bitterness , wrath , anger , clamor , and blasphemy be removed from you , with all malice .
49004032	And be kind to one another , tenderhearted , forgiving one another , just as also God in Christ forgave us .
49005001	Therefore be imitators of God as beloved children .
49005002	And walk in love , just as Christ also loved us and gave Himself for us , an offering and a sacrifice to God for a fragrant aroma .
49005003	But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness , let it not even be named among you , as is fitting for saints ;
49005004	neither wickedness , nor foolish talk or coarse jesting , which are not proper , but rather thanksgiving .
49005005	For this you know , that no fornicator , or unclean person , nor covetous person , who is an idolater , has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God .
49005006	Let no one deceive you with empty words , for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience .
49005007	Therefore do not be participants with them .
49005008	For you were once darkness , but now you are light in the Lord . Walk as children of light -
49005009	for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness , righteousness , and truth ,
49005010	proving what is well-pleasing to the Lord .
49005011	And have no partnership with the unfruitful works of darkness , but rather expose [ them ] .
49005012	For it is shameful even to speak of those things being done by them in secret .
49005013	But all things that are exposed are made manifest by the light , for whatever makes manifest is light .
49005014	Therefore He says : " Awake , you who are sleeping , and arise from the dead , and Christ will shine on you . "
49005015	See then that you walk carefully , not as unwise , but as wise ,
49005016	redeeming the time , because the days are evil .
49005017	Therefore do not be foolish , but understand what the will of the Lord [ is ] .
49005018	And do not get drunk with wine , in which is dissipation ; but be filled with the Spirit ,
49005019	speaking to one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs , singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord ,
49005020	giving thanks always concerning all things to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
49005021	subjecting yourselves to one another in the fear of God .
49005022	Wives , subject yourselves to your own husbands , as to the Lord ,
49005023	because the husband is head of the wife , as also Christ is head of the church ; and He is the Savior of the body .
49005024	But just as the church is subject to Christ , so also the wives be to their own husbands in everything .
49005025	Husbands , love your own wives , just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for her ,
49005026	in order that He might sanctify her , cleansing her by the washing of water by the word ,
49005027	that He might present her to Himself a glorious church , not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing , but that she should be holy and blameless .
49005028	So husbands ought to love their own wives as their own bodies ; he that loves his own wife loves himself .
49005029	For no one ever hated his own flesh , but nourishes and cherishes it , just as also the Lord does the church .
49005030	For we are members of His body , of His flesh and of His bones .
49005031	" For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife , and the two shall become one flesh . "
49005032	This is a great mystery , but I speak in reference to Christ and to the church .
49005033	Nevertheless you also individually , let each one love his own wife as himself , and let the wife see that she respect her husband .
49006001	Children , obey your parents in the Lord , for this is right .
49006002	" Honor your father and mother , " which is the first commandment with a promise :
49006003	" that it may be well with you , and you may live long on the earth . "
49006004	And fathers , do not provoke your children to anger , but bring them up in the discipline and admonition of the Lord .
49006005	Slaves , obey your masters according to the flesh with fear and trembling , in simplicity of heart , as to Christ ;
49006006	not with eyeservice , as men - pleasers , but as slaves of Christ , doing the will of God wholeheartedly ,
49006007	with good will doing service , as to the Lord , and not to men ,
49006008	knowing that whatever good thing anyone does , the same he shall receive back from the Lord , whether slave or free .
49006009	And masters , do the same things towards them , giving up threatening , knowing that your own Master is in heaven , and there is no partiality with Him .
49006010	Finally , my brothers , be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might .
49006011	Put on the full armor of God , so that you may be able to stand against the stratagems of the devil .
49006012	For we wrestle not against flesh and blood , but against principalities , against powers , against the rulers of the darkness of this age , against spiritual [ forces ] of evil in the heavenlies .
49006013	Because of this , take up the whole armor of God , that you may be able to withstand in the evil day , and having accomplished all things , to stand .
49006014	Stand therefore , having girded your waist with truth , having put on the breastplate of righteousness ,
49006015	and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace ;
49006016	above all , taking up the shield of faith , with which you will be able to quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one .
49006017	And take the helmet of salvation , and the sword of the Spirit , which is the word of God ;
49006018	through every prayer and petition , praying in every season in the Spirit , being watchful to this same thing with all perseverance and petition concerning all the saints -
49006019	and for me , that utterance may be given to me in the opening of my mouth , to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel ,
49006020	for the sake of which I serve as an ambassador in chains ; that in it I may speak boldly , as I must speak .
49006021	But that you also may know my circumstances , and how I am doing , Tychicus , a beloved brother and faithful servant in the Lord , will make all things known to you ;
49006022	whom I have sent to you for this very purpose , that you may know our situation , and that he may comfort your hearts .
49006023	Peace to the brothers , and love with faith , from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49006024	Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity . Amen .
50001001	Paul and Timothy , bondservants of Jesus Christ , to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi , together with the overseers and ministers :
50001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ .
50001003	I thank my God upon every remembrance of you ,
50001004	always in every prayer of mine in behalf of you all , with joy ,
50001005	for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now ,
50001006	having been persuaded of this very thing , that He who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Christ Jesus ;
50001007	just as it is right for me to think this concerning you all , because I have you in my heart , both in my chains and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel , you all are partakers with me of grace .
50001008	For God is my witness , how greatly I long for you all with the affection of Jesus Christ .
50001009	And this I pray , that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all perception ,
50001010	that you may approve the things that are excellent , in order that you may be sincere and without offense till the day of Christ ,
50001011	having been filled with the fruits of righteousness which are by Jesus Christ , to the glory and praise of God .
50001012	But I want you to know , brothers , that the things [ which happened ] to me have come about for the advancement of the gospel ,
50001013	so that it has become evident to the whole palace guard , and to all the rest , that my chains are in Christ ;
50001014	and most of the brothers in the Lord , having been persuaded by my chains , are much more bold to speak the word fearlessly .
50001015	Some indeed are preaching Christ even from envy and strife , but some also from good will :
50001016	The [ former ] proclaim Christ out of selfish ambition , not sincerely , supposing to add affliction to my chains ;
50001017	but the latter out of love , knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the gospel .
50001018	What then ? Nevertheless in every way , whether in pretense or in truth , Christ is proclaimed ; and in this I rejoice ; yes , and I will rejoice .
50001019	For I know that this will turn out for my deliverance through your prayer and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ ,
50001020	according to my earnest expectation and hope that in nothing I will be ashamed , but with utmost boldness , as always , now also Christ will be magnified in my body , whether by life or by death .
50001021	For to me , to live [ is ] Christ , and to die [ is ] gain .
50001022	But if I am to live on in the flesh , this to me will mean fruit from my labor ; and what I shall choose I do not know .
50001023	For I am hard pressed by the two , having a desire to depart and to be with Christ , [ which is ] far better .
50001024	But to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sake .
50001025	And having been persuaded of this , I know that I shall remain and continue with you all for your progress and joy in the faith ,
50001026	that your boasting may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my coming again to you .
50001027	Only conduct yourselves worthy of the gospel of Christ , so that whether I come and see you or am absent , I may hear of your affairs , that you stand fast in one spirit , with one soul striving together for the faith of the gospel ,
50001028	and not being terrified in anything by your enemies , which is to them a proof of destruction , but to you of salvation , and this from God .
50001029	For to you it has been granted for the sake of Christ , not only to believe in Him , but also to suffer for His sake ,
50001030	having the same struggle which you saw in me and now you hear is in me .
50002001	Therefore if there is any consolation in Christ , if any comfort of love , if any fellowship of the Spirit , if any affection and acts of compassion ,
50002002	fulfill my joy by being like-minded , having the same love , being united in spirit , intending the same purpose ,
50002003	doing nothing according to selfish ambition or conceit , but with humility , regarding one another as being better than yourselves .
50002004	Let each of you look out not only for his own concerns , but also for the concerns of others .
50002005	Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus ,
50002006	who , existing in the form of God , did not consider it robbery to be equal with God ,
50002007	but made Himself of no reputation , taking the form of a bondservant , and coming to be in the likeness of men .
50002008	And being found in appearance as a man , He humbled Himself , becoming obedient unto death , even the death of the cross .
50002009	Therefore God also has highly exalted Him , and has graciously given Him a name which is above every name ,
50002010	that at the name of Jesus every knee may bow , of those in heaven , and of those on earth , and of those under the earth ,
50002011	and [ that ] every tongue may confess that Jesus Christ is Lord , to the glory of God the Father .
50002012	So then , my beloved , just as you have always obeyed , not as in my presence only , but now much more in my absence , work out your own salvation with fear and trembling ;
50002013	for it is God who is working in you , both to will and to do for His good pleasure .
50002014	Do all things without grumbling and disputing ,
50002015	in order that you may become blameless and harmless , children of God without fault in the midst of a crooked and perverted generation , among whom you shine as light bearers in the world ,
50002016	holding fast the word of life , so that I may rejoice in the day of Christ , that I have not run in vain or labored in vain .
50002017	But even if I am being poured upon the sacrifice and service of your faith , I rejoice ; [ yea , ] and I rejoice with you all .
50002018	For the same reason you also rejoice and rejoice together with me .
50002019	Now I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you shortly , that I also may be encouraged when I learn of your circumstances .
50002020	For I have no one like-minded , who will be genuinely concerned about your circumstances .
50002021	For all seek their own interests , not the things of Christ Jesus .
50002022	And you know his approved character , that as a child with his father he served as a slave for the gospel .
50002023	Therefore I hope to send him at once , as soon as I may see how my circumstances go .
50002024	But I have been persuaded in the Lord that I myself will also come shortly .
50002025	Yet I considered it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus , my brother , fellow worker , and fellow soldier , and your messenger and minister to my needs ;
50002026	since he was longing for you all , and was distressed because you had heard that he was sick .
50002027	For indeed he was sick , [ and ] near death ; but God showed mercy [ on ] him , and not only on him but on me also , lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow .
50002028	Therefore I sent him more eagerly , in order that when you see him again you may have joy , and I may be less anxious .
50002029	Receive him therefore in the Lord with the utmost joy , and hold such [ ones ] in honor ;
50002030	because for the work of Christ he drew near unto death , being careless with his life , in order that he might fill up that which was lacking in your service to me .
50003001	Finally , my brothers , rejoice in the Lord . For me to write the same things to you is not troublesome , but for you it is safe .
50003002	Beware of the dogs , beware of the evil workers , beware of the [ false ] circumcision !
50003003	For we are the [ true ] circumcision , worshipping by the Spirit of God , rejoicing in Christ Jesus , and having no confidence in the flesh ,
50003004	although I also [ am ] having confidence in the flesh . If any other [ person ] thinks to have confidence in the flesh , I even more :
50003005	circumcised the eighth day , of the nation of Israel , of the tribe of Benjamin , a Hebrew of Hebrews ; with respect to the law , a Pharisee ;
50003006	with respect to zeal , persecuting the church ; with respect to righteousness which is in the law , blameless .
50003007	But such things as were gain to me , these I have considered loss for the sake of Christ .
50003008	More than that I also consider all things to be loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord , for whom I have sustained the loss of all things , and I consider them to be rubbish , in order that I may gain Christ
50003009	and be found in Him , not having my own righteousness , which is of the law , but that which is through [ the ] faith of Christ , the righteousness [ which is ] of God by faith ;
50003010	[ so as ] to know Him and the power of His resurrection , and the fellowship of His sufferings , being conformed to His death ,
50003011	if in some way I may attain to the resurrection from the dead .
50003012	Not that I have already obtained , or have already been made perfect ; but I press on , if also I may lay hold of that for which I was laid hold of by Christ Jesus .
50003013	Brothers , I do not count myself to have laid hold ; but one thing [ I do ] , forgetting those things which are behind , and reaching forward to those things which are ahead ,
50003014	I press toward the goal for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus .
50003015	Therefore , as many as are mature , let us think this way ; and if in anything you think otherwise , even this God will reveal to you .
50003016	Nevertheless , to what we have attained , let us walk by the same rule , [ being ] of the same mind .
50003017	Be fellow imitators of me , brothers , and look out for those walking this way , just as you have us for a pattern .
50003018	For many walk , of whom often I was speaking to you , and now even weeping I tell you , [ that they are ] the enemies of the cross of Christ :
50003019	whose end is destruction , whose god is their belly , and whose glory is in their shame - who are mindful of earthly things .
50003020	For our citizenship exists in heaven , from which also we eagerly await for the Savior , the Lord Jesus Christ ,
50003021	who will transform our lowly body , that it may be conformed to His glorious body , according to the working by which He is able even to subject all things to Himself .
50004001	Therefore , my beloved and longed for brothers , my joy and crown , in this way stand fast in the Lord , beloved .
50004002	I implore Euodia and I implore Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord .
50004003	Yes , I ask you also , true companion , help these women who labored together with me in the gospel , and with Clement also , and the rest of my fellow workers , whose names are in the Book of Life .
50004004	Rejoice in the Lord always . Again I will say , rejoice !
50004005	Let your gentleness be known to all men . The Lord is at hand .
50004006	Be anxious for nothing , but in everything by prayer and petition , along with thanksgiving , let your requests be made known to God ;
50004007	and the peace of God , which surpasses all understanding , shall guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus .
50004008	Finally , brothers , as many things as are true , as many as are honorable , as many as are just , as many as are pure , as many as are lovely - if there is any virtue and if there is any praise - meditate on these things .
50004009	The things which you learned and received and heard and saw in me , practice these things ; and the God of peace shall be with you .
50004010	But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now once [ again ] you have revived your mindfulness on my behalf , inasmuch as indeed you were mindful , but you lacked opportunity .
50004011	Not that I am speaking with respect to need , for I have learned to be content in whatever state I am .
50004012	I know how to be abased , and I know how to abound . In every place and in all [ circumstances ] I have learned both to be full and to be hungry , both to abound and to be in need .
50004013	I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me .
50004014	Nevertheless you have done well that you shared in my affliction .
50004015	Now you Philippians also know that in the beginning of the gospel , when I went out from Macedonia , no church shared with me in an accounting of giving and receiving except you only .
50004016	Because even in Thessalonica , both once and again you sent for my need .
50004017	Not that I seek the gift , but I seek the fruit which is increasing to your account .
50004018	And I have all things and abound . I have been made full , having received from Epaphroditus the things [ sent ] from you , a fragrant aroma , an acceptable sacrifice , well pleasing to God .
50004019	And my God will supply all your need according to His riches in glory in Christ Jesus .
50004020	Now to our God and Father be glory forever and ever . Amen .
50004021	Greet every saint in Christ Jesus . The brothers who are with me greet you .
50004022	All the saints greet you , but especially those of the household of Caesar .
50004023	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
51001001	Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ by [ the ] will of God , and Timothy our brother ,
51001002	To the saints and faithful brothers in Christ in Colosse : Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
51001003	We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , praying always for you ,
51001004	when we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and your love which is towards all the saints ;
51001005	because of the hope being laid up for you in [ the ] heavens , in which you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel ,
51001006	which has come to you , just as also in all the world , and is bearing fruit and growing , just as also among you , from the day which you heard and fully knew the grace of God in truth ;
51001007	just as also you learned from Epaphras , our beloved fellow servant , who is a faithful minister of Christ for you ,
51001008	who also told us of your love in the Spirit .
51001009	On account of this we also , since the day we heard , do not cease praying for you , and asking that you may be filled with the full knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding ;
