51001010	that you should walk worthy of the Lord , to please Him in all respects , bearing fruit and increasing in the full knowledge of God ;
51001011	being strengthened with all power , according to the might of His glory , for all endurance and longsuffering with joy ;
51001012	giving thanks to the Father who has qualified us to share in the inheritance of the saints in the light .
51001013	He has delivered us from the dominion of darkness and transferred us into the kingdom of the Son of His love ,
51001014	in whom we have redemption , the forgiveness of sins .
51001015	He is the image of the invisible God , the firstborn over all creation ,
51001016	because by Him all things were created , those in the heavens and those on earth , visible and invisible , whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities ; all things have been created through Him and for Him .
51001017	And He is before all things , and in Him all things are held together .
51001018	And He is the head of the body , the church , who is the beginning , the firstborn from the dead , so that in all things He may have the preeminence ;
51001019	for it pleased [ the Father that ] in Him all the fullness should dwell ,
51001020	and through Him to reconcile all things to Himself , by Him , whether things on the earth or things in the heavens , having made peace through the blood of His cross .
51001021	And you , who once were alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works , yet now He has reconciled
51001022	in the body of His flesh through death , to present you holy , and blameless , and above reproach before Him -
51001023	if indeed you continue in the faith , having been founded and firm and not drifting away from the hope of the gospel which you heard , which was proclaimed to all creation under heaven , of which I , Paul , became a minister .
51001024	I now rejoice in my sufferings for you , and fill up in my flesh what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ , for His body , which is the church ,
51001025	of which I became a minister according to the stewardship of God which was given to me for you , to fulfill the word of God ,
51001026	the mystery which has been hidden from the ages and from generations , but now was revealed to His saints .
51001027	To whom God willed to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the nations , which is Christ in you , the hope of glory ;
51001028	whom we proclaim , warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom , that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus ;
51001029	for which I also labor , striving according to His working which is working in me with power .
51002001	For I want you to know how great a struggle I have concerning you and those in Laodicea , and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh ,
51002002	that their hearts may be encouraged , being joined together in love , and to all riches of the full assurance of understanding , to a full knowledge of the mystery of God , both of the Father and of Christ ,
51002003	in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge .
51002004	Now this I say lest anyone may deceive you with persuasive words .
51002005	For though indeed I am absent in the flesh , yet I am with you in spirit , rejoicing to see your orderliness and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ .
51002006	Therefore as you have received Christ Jesus the Lord , so walk in Him ,
51002007	having been rooted and built up in Him and being established in the faith , just as you were taught , abounding in it with thanksgiving .
51002008	Beware lest anyone captures you through philosophy and empty deceit , according to the tradition of men , according to the basic principles of the world , and not according to Christ .
51002009	For in Him dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily ;
51002010	and you are completed in Him , who is the head of all principality and power .
51002011	In whom you were also circumcised with the circumcision made without hands , by the putting off the body of the sins of the flesh , by the circumcision of Christ ,
51002012	having been buried together with Him in baptism , in which also you were raised together through faith in the working of God , who raised Him from the dead .
51002013	And you , being dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh , He made you alive together with Him , having forgiven us all our trespasses ,
51002014	having blotted out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us , which was contrary to us , and He has taken it out of the midst , nailing it to the cross .
51002015	[ And h ] aving disarmed principalities and powers , He mocked them in public , triumphing over them in it .
51002016	Therefore do not let anyone judge you in food or in drink , or regarding a festival or of a new moon or of sabbaths ,
51002017	which are a shadow of things to come , but the body is of Christ .
51002018	Let no one rule against you , desiring [ to do so ] in [ false ] humility and in worship of the angels , intruding into those things which he has not seen , in vain being puffed up by his carnal mind ,
51002019	and not holding fast to the Head , from whom all the body , supported and joined together by joints and ligaments , grows with the growth of God .
51002020	If you died with Christ from the basic principles of the world , why , as though living in the world , do you submit to regulations -
51002021	" Do not handle , nor taste , nor touch , "
51002022	which things are all for corruption with the using , according to the commands and teaching of men ?
51002023	These things indeed have a reputation of wisdom in self-imposed religion , false humility , and severity [ on the ] body , but [ are ] not of any value against the indulgence of the flesh .
51003001	If then you were raised with Christ , seek those things which are above , where Christ is , sitting at [ the ] right [ hand ] of God .
51003002	Set your mind on things above , not on things on the earth .
51003003	For you died , and your life has been hidden with Christ in God .
51003004	Whenever Christ [ who is ] our life appears , then you also will appear with Him in glory .
51003005	Therefore put to death your members on the earth : fornication , uncleanness , passion , evil desire , and greed , which is idolatry .
51003006	Because of which things the wrath of God is coming on the sons of disobedience ,
51003007	in which you yourselves once walked when you lived in them .
51003008	But now you yourselves are to put off all [ these ] : wrath , anger , malice , blasphemy , filthy language out of your mouth .
51003009	Do not lie to one another , since you have stripped off the old man with his practices ,
51003010	and have put on the new man who is renewed in full knowledge according to the image of Him who created it ,
51003011	where there is not Greek nor Jew , circumcised nor uncircumcised , barbarian , Scythian , slave nor free , but Christ is all and in all .
51003012	Therefore , as the elect of God , holy and beloved , put on hearts of compassion , kindness , humility , meekness , patience ;
51003013	forbearing one another and forgiving yourselves , if anyone should have a complaint against any ; just as Christ forgave you , so you also [ do ] .
51003014	But above all these things put on love , which is the bond of perfection .
51003015	And let the peace of God rule in your hearts , to which also you were called in one body ; and be thankful .
51003016	Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom , teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs , singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord .
51003017	And whatever you may do in word or deed , do all things in the name of the Lord Jesus , giving thanks to God the Father through Him .
51003018	Wives , subject yourselves to your own husbands , as is fitting in the Lord .
51003019	Husbands , love your wives and do not be bitter toward them .
51003020	Children , obey your parents in all things , for this is well pleasing in the Lord .
51003021	Fathers , do not provoke your children , lest they become discouraged .
51003022	Bondservants , obey your masters according to the flesh in all things , not with eyeservice , as men-pleasers , but in sincerity of heart , fearing God .
51003023	And whatever you may do , work [ it ] from your soul , as to the Lord and not to men ,
51003024	knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance . For you serve the Lord Christ .
51003025	But the [ one ] doing wrong will be repaid for what he has done , and there is not partiality .
51004001	Masters , provide to your bondservants what is just and fair , knowing that you also have a Master in [ the ] heavens .
51004002	Continue earnestly in prayer , being vigilant in it with thanksgiving ;
51004003	praying at the same time also for us , that God would open a door for the word , to speak the mystery of Christ , because of which I am also in chains ,
51004004	that I may make it manifest , as I ought to speak .
51004005	Walk in wisdom toward outsiders , redeeming the time .
51004006	Let your word always be with grace , having been seasoned with salt , to know how you ought to answer each [ one ] .
51004007	Tychicus , the beloved brother and faithful minister , and fellow servant in the Lord , will tell you all things about me .
51004008	I am sending him to you for this very thing , that he may know your circumstances , and he may encourage your hearts ,
51004009	with Onesimus , the faithful and beloved brother , who is one of you . They will make known to you all the things [ happening ] here .
51004010	Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you , with Mark the cousin of Barnabas ( about whom you received instructions : if he comes to you , receive him ) ,
51004011	and Jesus who is called Justus . These alone are my fellow workers for the kingdom of God who are of the circumcision ; they have proved to be a comfort to me .
51004012	Epaphras greets you , who is one of you , a bondservant of Christ , always struggling for you in his prayers , that you may stand mature and complete in all the will of God .
51004013	For I bear him witness that he has much zeal for you , and those in Laodicea , and those in Hierapolis .

52001001	Paul , Silvanus , and Timothy , To the church of the Thessalonians in God [ the ] Father and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ : Grace to you and peace from God our Father and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ .
52001002	We give thanks to God always concerning you all , making mention of you in our prayers ,
52001003	constantly remembering your work of faith , labor of love , and perseverance of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ in the presence of our God and Father ,
52001004	knowing , beloved brothers , your election by God .
52001005	For our gospel did not come to you in word only , but also in power , and in the Holy Spirit and in much assurance , just as you know what kind [ of men ] we were among you for your sake .
52001006	And you became imitators of us and of the Lord , in that you received the word in much tribulation , with joy of the Holy Spirit ,
52001007	so that you became patterns to all those who believe in Macedonia and Achaia .
52001008	For from you the word of the Lord has resounded , not only in Macedonia and in Achaia , but also in every place . Your faith toward God has gone forth , so that we have no need to say anything .
52001009	For they themselves report about us what kind of entrance we had to you , and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God ,
52001010	and to wait for His Son from heaven , whom He raised from the dead , Jesus , who delivers us from the coming wrath .
52002001	For you yourselves know , brothers , [ regarding ] our coming to you , that it was not in vain .
52002002	But suffering before and being spitefully treated at Philippi , just as you know , we were bold in our God to speak to you the gospel of God with much conflict .
52002003	For our exhortation [ was ] not from error nor from uncleanness , nor in trickery ,
52002004	but just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel , even so we speak , not as pleasing men , but God who is testing our hearts .
52002005	For neither were we using flattering speech , as you know , nor covering up greed , God is [ our ] witness .
52002006	Nor seeking glory from men , neither from you , nor from others , even though we were able to carry weight as apostles of Christ .
52002007	But we proved to be gentle in your midst , as a nursing [ mother ] cherishes her own children .
52002008	In this way longing for you , we were well pleased to impart to you not only the gospel of God , but also our own lives , because you had become dear to us .
52002009	For you remember , brothers , our labor and toil ; for laboring night and day , that we might not be a burden to any of you , we proclaimed to you the gospel of God .
52002010	You are witnesses , and [ so is ] God , how devoutly and justly and blamelessly we were among you that believe ;
52002011	as indeed you know how each one of you , as a father [ to ] his own children , we exhorted , and comforted [ you ] , and imploring you ,
52002012	that you would walk worthy of God who calls you into His own kingdom and glory .
52002013	Because of this we also give thanks to God unceasingly , so that when you received the word of God which you heard from us , you received not the word of men , but just as it truly is , the word of God , which also is at work in you that believe .
52002014	For you , brothers , became imitators of the churches of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus , because you suffered the same things from your fellow countrymen , just as also they [ did ] by the Jews ,
52002015	who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets , and have persecuted us ; and they do not please God and [ are ] against all men ,
52002016	forbidding us from speaking to the Gentiles so that they may be saved , so as always to fill up [ the measure of ] their sins ; but the wrath [ of God ] has come upon them to the uttermost .
52002017	But we , brothers , being unwillingly separated from you for a short season , in presence , not in heart , were all the more eager to see your face with much desire .
52002018	Therefore we desired to come to you - I , Paul , time and again , but Satan hindered us .
52002019	For what is our hope , or joy , or crown of boasting ? [ Is ] it not even you , in the presence of our Lord Jesus at His coming ?
52002020	For you are our glory and joy .
52003001	Therefore , when we could no longer endure it , we were well pleased to be left behind in Athens alone ,
52003002	and sent Timothy , our brother and minister of God , and our fellow worker in the gospel of Christ , in order to establish you and encourage you concerning your faith ,
52003003	that no one should be disturbed by these afflictions ; for you yourselves know that we are appointed unto this .
52003004	For even when we were with you , we were telling you in advance that we were going to be afflicted , just as it also happened , and you know .
52003005	Because of this , when I could no longer endure [ it ] , I sent to learn about your faith , lest somehow the tempter had tempted you , and our labor be in vain .
52003006	But now when Timothy came to us from you , and brought good news to us of your faith and your love , and that you have good remembrance of us always , longing to see us , as we also [ long to see ] you -
52003007	because of this we were encouraged , brothers , in regard to you in all our affliction and distress by your faith .
52003008	Because now we live , if you stand firm in the Lord .
52003009	For whatever thanksgiving can we render to God for you , for all the joy with which we are rejoicing because of you in the presence of our God ,
52003010	night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face and to perfect what is lacking in your faith ?
52003011	Now may our God and Father Himself , and our Lord Jesus Christ , lead us directly to you .
52003012	And may the Lord make you to increase and abound in love toward one another and toward all [ men ] , as indeed we also do toward you ,
52003013	so that He may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints .
52004001	Finally then , brothers , we request of you and exhort [ you ] in the Lord Jesus , just as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God , that you should abound more .
52004002	For you know what commandments we gave you through the Lord Jesus .
52004003	For this is [ the ] will of God , your sanctification : that you should abstain from fornication ,
52004004	that each of you should know how to possess his own vessel in sanctification and honor ,
52004005	not in lustful passion , like the Gentiles who do not know God ,
52004006	that no one should transgress against and to defraud his brother in this matter , because the Lord is the avenger concerning all , just as we told you before and solemnly testified .
52004007	For God did not call us to uncleanness , but in sanctification .
52004008	Therefore he who rejects [ this ] does not reject man , but God , who has given His Holy Spirit to you .
52004009	Now concerning brotherly love you have no need [ for me ] to write to you , for you yourselves are taught by God to love one another .
52004010	For indeed you do so toward all the brothers in all Macedonia . But we exhort you , brothers , that you increase more and more ,
52004011	and that you aspire to be quiet , and to mind your own business , and to work with your own hands , just as we commanded you ,
52004012	in order that you may walk decently toward those that are outside , and may have need of nothing .
52004013	Now we do not want you to be uninformed , brothers , concerning those who have fallen asleep , lest you be sorrowful as those who have no hope .
52004014	For if we believe that Jesus died and rose [ again ] , thus also God will bring with Him those who sleep in Jesus .
52004015	For this we say to you by the word of the Lord , that we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord shall by no means precede those who are asleep .
52004016	Because the Lord Himself shall descend from heaven with a word of command , with [ the ] voice of an archangel , and with [ the ] trumpet of God , and the dead in Christ shall rise first .
52004017	Then we who are alive [ and ] remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air . And thus we shall always be with the Lord .
52004018	So then comfort one another with these words .
52005001	But concerning the times and the seasons , brothers , you have no need that I should write to you .
52005002	For you yourselves know accurately that the day of the Lord so comes as a thief in the night .
52005003	For when they say , " Peace and safety ! " then sudden destruction comes upon them , just as labor pains upon the woman that is pregnant , and they shall by no means escape .
52005004	But you , brothers , are not in darkness , so that this Day should overtake you as a thief .
52005005	You are all sons of light and sons of the day . We are not of the night nor of darkness .
52005006	Therefore let us not sleep , as others do , but let us watch and be sober .
52005007	For those who sleep , sleep at night , and those [ ] getting drunk , are drunk at night .
52005008	But we , since we are of the day , let us be sober , putting on a breastplate of faith and love , and as a helmet , the hope of salvation .
52005009	For God did not appoint us to wrath , but to [ the ] obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
52005010	who died for us , in order that whether we are awake or asleep , we may live together with Him .
52005011	Therefore comfort each other and edify one another , just as you also are doing .
52005012	And we request of you , brothers , to recognize those who labor among you , and are over you in the Lord and instruct you ,
52005013	and to regard them beyond all measure in love , because of their work . Be at peace among yourselves .
52005014	Now we exhort you , brothers , admonish the disorderly , encourage the discouraged , be supportive of the weak , be patient toward all .
52005015	See that no one pays back evil for evil to anyone , but always pursue that which is good , both for one another and for all .
52005016	Rejoice always !
52005017	Pray without ceasing !
52005018	In everything give thanks ; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you .
52005019	Do not quench the Spirit .
52005020	Do not despise prophecies .
52005021	But test all things ; hold fast that which is good .
52005022	Abstain from every form of evil .
52005023	Now [ may ] the God of peace Himself sanctify you completely ; and may your whole spirit , soul , and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ .
52005024	He who calls you is faithful , who also will do [ this ] .
52005025	Brothers , pray for us .
52005026	Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss .
52005027	I adjure you by the Lord [ for ] this letter to be read to all the holy brothers .
52005028	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you . Amen .
53001001	Paul , Silvanus , and Timothy , To the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ :
53001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ .
53001003	We are obligated to give thanks to God always for you , brothers , [ and ] rightfully so , because your faith grows exceedingly , and the love of every one of you all increases towards one another ,
53001004	so that we ourselves are boasting in you among the churches of God about your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that you endure ,
53001005	[ which is ] evidence of the righteous judgment of God , so that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God , on behalf of which you also suffer ;
53001006	since it is a righteous thing with God to repay with affliction those who afflict you ,
53001007	and to give you who are being afflicted rest along with us at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with His mighty angels ,
53001008	in flaming fire , inflicting vengeance on those who do not know God , and on those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53001009	These shall pay a penalty - eternal destruction from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of His might ,
53001010	whenever He comes , in that Day , to be glorified among His saints and to be marveled among all those having believed , because our testimony among you was believed .
53001011	Therefore we also pray always concerning you that our God may count you worthy of [ this ] calling , and may fulfill all the good pleasure of His goodness and the work of faith with power ,
53001012	in order that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you , and you in Him , according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53002001	Now , brothers , concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to Him , we beseech you ,
53002002	not to be quickly shaken from your mind , nor be disturbed , neither by spirit nor by word nor by letter , as if from us , [ as though ] the day of Christ has come .
53002003	Let no one deceive you by any means ; for [ that day will not come ] unless the falling away comes first , and the man of sin is unveiled , the son of perdition ,
53002004	who opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God , or [ every ] object of worship , so that he sits as God in the temple of God , showing himself that he is God .
53002005	Do you not remember that while I was still with you , I was telling you these things ?
53002006	And now you know that which is restraining , that he may be revealed in his own time .
53002007	For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work ; only He who now restrains [ will continue ] until one arises from out of [ the ] midst .
53002008	And then the lawless one will be unveiled , whom the Lord will consume with the breath of His mouth , and will destroy by the brightness of His coming ,
53002009	whose coming is according to the working of Satan , with all power , signs , and lying wonders ,
53002010	and in all deception of unrighteousness among those who perish , because they did not receive the love of the truth , that they might be saved .
53002011	And because of this , God will send them strong delusion , in order for them to believe the lie ,
53002012	so that they all might be damned who did not believe the truth , but delighted in unrighteousness .
53002013	But we are obligated to give thanks to God always for you , brothers beloved by the Lord , because God chose you from the beginning for salvation , through sanctification of the Spirit and belief in the truth ,
53002014	to which He called you through our gospel , for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53002015	So then , brothers , stand fast and hold to the traditions which you were taught , whether by word or our letter .
53002016	Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself , and our God and Father , who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and a good hope by grace ,
53002017	comfort your hearts and establish you in every good word and work .
53003001	Finally , brothers , pray for us , that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified , just as [ it is ] with you ,
53003002	and that we may be delivered from evil and wicked men ; for not all have faith .
53003003	But the Lord is faithful , who will establish you and will guard you from the evil one .
53003004	And we trust in the Lord concerning you , that the [ ] things which we command to you , you are both doing , and will do [ them . ]
53003005	Now may the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the patience of Christ .
53003006	But we command you , brothers , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , that you keep away from every brother living in idleness , and not according to the tradition which they received from us .
53003007	For you yourselves know how you ought to follow us , for we were not disorderly among you ;
53003008	nor did we eat bread from anyone without paying , but in labor and hardship , working night and day , so as not to be a burden to any of you ,
53003009	not because we do not have authority , but in order that we may give ourselves as a pattern to you , so that you might follow us .
53003010	For even when we were with you , we commanded you this : If anyone is not willing to work , neither let him eat !
53003011	For we hear [ that ] some are walking among you in a disorderly way , not working at all , but being busybodies .
53003012	And to such [ people ] we command and urge by our Lord Jesus Christ that they work in quietness and eat their own bread .
53003013	But as for you , brothers , do not lose heart [ in ] doing good .
53003014	Now if anyone does not obey our word in this letter , take note of him , and do not associate with him , that he may be ashamed .
53003015	Yet do not consider him as an enemy , but admonish [ him ] as a brother .
53003016	Now may the Lord of peace Himself give you peace always in every way . The Lord be with you all .
53003017	The greeting of Paul by my own hand , which is a sign in every letter ; so I write .
53003018	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
54001001	Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ , according to [ the ] commandment of God our Savior and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ , our hope ,
54001002	To Timothy , [ my ] own son in the faith : Grace , mercy , and peace from God our Father and Christ Jesus our Lord .
54001003	Just as I urged you to remain in Ephesus as I traveled into Macedonia , that you should command certain [ people ] not to teach differently ,
54001004	nor to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies , which cause disputes rather than godly edification which is in faith .
54001005	Now the goal of the commandment is love out of a pure heart , from a good conscience , and from sincere faith ,
54001006	from which some , having strayed , have turned aside to futile talk ,
54001007	desiring to be teachers of the law , not understanding either what they say or what they affirm .
54001008	But we know that the law is good if one uses it lawfully ,
54001009	knowing this : that the law is not laid down for the righteous , but for the lawless and insubordinate , for the ungodly and for sinners , for unholy and profane , for killers of fathers and killers of mothers , for murderers ,
54001010	for fornicators , for sodomites , for kidnappers , for liars , for perjurers , and if there is any other thing that is opposed to sound doctrine ,
54001011	according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God , [ with ] which I was entrusted .
54001012	And I give thanks to the [ One ] who empowers me , Christ Jesus our Lord , because He considered me faithful , putting me into the ministry ,
54001013	I , who was formerly a blasphemer , a persecutor , and an insolent man ; but I was shown mercy , because , being ignorant , I did it in unbelief ,
54001014	and the grace of our Lord superabounded with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus .
54001015	Faithful is this word , and worthy of all acceptance , that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners , of whom I am chief .
54001016	However , because of this I was shown mercy , so that in me first Jesus Christ might show forth all longsuffering , as a pattern for those who are going to believe on Him for everlasting life .
54001017	Now to the King of the Ages , immortal , invisible , [ the ] only wise God , [ be ] honor and glory forever and ever . Amen .
54001018	This charge I commit to you , [ my ] son Timothy , according to the prophecies previously made concerning you , that you may war by them the good warfare ,
54001019	having faith and a good conscience , which some having rejected , concerning the faith have suffered shipwreck ,
54001020	of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander , whom I handed over to Satan so that they may be taught not to blaspheme .
54002001	Therefore I exhort first of all that supplications , prayers , intercessions , and thanksgivings be made on behalf of all men ,
54002002	on behalf of kings and all those who are in authority , that we may lead a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and dignity .
54002003	For this is good and acceptable before God our Savior ,
54002004	who desires all men to be saved and to come to the full knowledge of the truth .
54002005	For there is one God and one Mediator between God and men , the Man Christ Jesus ,
54002006	who gave Himself a ransom for all , the testimony in due time ;
54002007	for which I was appointed a herald and apostle - I speak the truth in Christ , I do not lie - a teacher of Gentiles in faith and truth .
54002008	I desire therefore that men pray in every place , lifting up holy hands , without wrath and doubting .
54002009	Likewise also that the women adorn themselves in modest apparel , with propriety and discretion , not with braids or gold or pearls or expensive clothing ,
54002010	but which is fitting for women professing godliness , by means of good works .
54002011	Let a woman learn in silence with all submission .
54002012	And I do not permit a woman to teach , nor to have authority over a man , but to be in silence .
54002013	For Adam first was formed , then Eve .
54002014	And Adam was not deceived , but the woman being deceived , has come to be in transgression .
54002015	Nevertheless she shall be saved through childbirth , if they remain in faith and love , and sanctification , with self-control .
54003001	Faithful is this word : If anyone aspires to the position of a bishop , he desires a good work .
54003002	It is necessary , therefore , for a bishop to be irreproachable , the husband of one wife , temperate , sober-minded , well-behaved , hospitable , skillful at teaching ;
54003003	not given to wine , not a bully , not greedy for money , but gentle , not quarrelsome , not loving money ;
54003004	one ruling his own house well , having [ his ] children in submission with all reverence ;
54003005	( for if one does not know how to rule his own house , how will he take care of the church of God ? ) ;
54003006	not a new convert , lest being puffed up [ with pride ] he fall into the [ same ] condemnation as the devil .
54003007	Moreover he must have a good testimony among those outside , lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil .
54003008	Likewise deacons must be reverent , not double-tongued , not being given to much wine , not greedy for money ,
54003009	holding the mystery of the faith with a pure conscience .
54003010	But let these also first be tested ; then let them serve as deacons , being irreproachable .
54003011	Likewise their wives must be reverent , not slanderers , temperate , faithful in all things .
54003012	Let deacons be the husbands of one wife , ruling their children well , and their own houses .
54003013	For those who have served well as deacons obtain a standing for themselves and much boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus .
54003014	These things I write to you , hoping to come to you shortly ;
54003015	but if I am delayed , [ I write ] so that you may know how it is necessary to conduct oneself in the house of God , which is the church of the living God , the pillar and bulwark of the truth .
54003016	And confessedly , great is the mystery of godliness : God was manifested in the flesh , justified in the Spirit , seen by angels , proclaimed among [ the ] Gentiles , believed on in the world , [ and ] was received up in glory .
54004001	But the Spirit explicitly says , that in latter times some shall fall away from the faith , giving heed to deceiving spirits and doctrines of demons ,
54004002	speaking lies in hypocrisy , having been seared with a hot iron [ as to ] their own conscience ,
54004003	forbidding to marry , [ commanding ] to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who are believers and have come to know the truth .
54004004	Because every creature of God is good , and not one is to be rejected , being received with thanksgiving ,
54004005	for it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer .
54004006	Instructing the brothers in these things , you will be a good minister of Jesus Christ , being nourished by the words of faith and of the good doctrine which you have carefully followed .
54004007	But reject profane and old wives' tales , and exercise yourself unto godliness .
54004008	For bodily exercise is profitable a little , but godliness is profitable for all things , having promise of the present life and of the coming life .
54004009	Trustworthy is this word and worthy of all acceptance .
54004010	For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach , because we trust in the living God , who is the Savior of all men , especially of believers .
54004011	These things command and teach .
54004012	Let no one look down on your youthfulness , but [ rather ] become a pattern for the believers in word , in conduct , in love , in spirit , in faith , in purity .
54004013	Until I come , give attention to [ public ] reading , to exhortation , to doctrine .
54004014	Do not neglect the gift that is in you , which was given to you through prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the eldership .
54004015	Meditate on these things ; be in these things [ , ] so that your progress may be evident to all .
54004016	Take heed to yourself and to the doctrine . Continue in them , for by doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you .
54005001	Do not sharply rebuke an older man , but [ rather ] exhort him as a father , younger men as brothers ,
54005002	older women as mothers , younger women as sisters , with all purity .
54005003	Honor widows who are really widows .
54005004	But if a certain widow has children or grandchildren , let them first learn to show piety to their own household and to make repayment to their parents ; for this is acceptable before God .
54005005	Now she who is really a widow and having been left alone , has set her hope on God , and continues in supplications and prayers night and day .
54005006	But she who is living for pleasure is dead while she lives .
54005007	And these things command , so that they may be blameless .
54005008	But if anyone does not provide for his own , and especially for those of his [ own ] house , he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever .
54005009	Let a widow be enrolled having become not less than sixty years , [ the ] wife of one man ,
54005010	having a reputation for good works , if she has brought up children , if she has lodged strangers , if she has washed the saints' feet , if she has relieved the afflicted , if she has diligently followed every good work .
54005011	But refuse [ to enroll ] the younger widows ; for whenever they grow lustful against Christ , they desire to marry ,
54005012	having condemnation because they have set aside their first faith .
54005013	And besides they learn to be idle , going around from house to house , and not only idle but also gossipy and busybodies , speaking things [ which are ] not proper .
54005014	Therefore I desire that the younger widows to marry , to bear children , to manage the house , to give no opportunity to the adversary because of reproach .
54005015	For already some have turned aside after Satan .
54005016	If any believing man or believing woman has widows , let [ that one ] relieve them , and do not let the church be burdened , that it may relieve those who are really widows .
54005017	Let the elders having ruled well be counted worthy of double honor , especially those who labor in the word and doctrine .
54005018	For the Scripture says , " You shall not muzzle an ox threshing [ grain ] , " and , " The worker is worthy of his wages . "
54005019	Do not receive an accusation against an elder unless on [ the basis of ] two or three witnesses .
54005020	Those who are sinning rebuke before all , that the rest also may have fear .
54005021	I charge you before God and the Lord Jesus Christ and the elect angels that you observe these things without prejudice , doing nothing according to partiality .
54005022	Lay hands on no one hastily , nor share in [ the ] sins of others ; keep yourself pure .
54005023	No longer drink water [ only ] , but use a little wine on account of your stomach , and your frequent illnesses .
54005024	The sins of some men are evident beforehand , preceding them to judgment , but some also follow after .
54005025	Likewise also the good works [ of some ] are evident beforehand , and those which are otherwise cannot be hidden .
54006001	Let as many as are slaves under a yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor , so that the name of God and His doctrine may not be blasphemed .
54006002	And those having believing masters , let them not despise them because they are brothers , but rather let them serve as slaves , because those receiving the good service are believing and beloved . Teach and exhort these things .
54006003	If anyone teaches differently and does not consent to sound words , even those of our Lord Jesus Christ , and to the doctrine which accords with godliness ,
54006004	he is puffed up , understanding nothing , but [ is ] morbidly concerned with disputes and word battles , from which come envy , strife , slanders , evil suspicions ,
54006005	constant wranglings of men of corrupt minds and having been deprived of the truth , supposing that godliness is a means of profit . Withdraw from such [ people ] .
54006006	But godliness with contentment is great gain .
54006007	For we brought nothing into this world , and it is certain that neither can we carry anything out !
54006008	But having food and clothing , with these things we shall be content .
54006009	But those desiring to be rich fall into temptation and a snare , and many senseless and harmful lusts which sink men into destruction and perdition .
54006010	For the love of money is [ the ] root of all evil , of which some [ by ] aspiring have strayed away from the faith in their greediness , and pierced themselves through with many sorrows .
54006011	You however , O man of God , flee these things . But pursue righteousness , godliness , faith , love , endurance , gentleness .
54006012	Fight the good fight of faith , lay hold of eternal life , to which you were called and have confessed the good confession before many witnesses .
54006013	I charge you before God who gives life to all things , and before Christ Jesus who witnessed the good confession before Pontius Pilate ,
54006014	that you keep this commandment without spot , blameless until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
54006015	which He will show in His own time , He who is the blessed and only Sovereign , the King of kings and Lord of lords ,
54006016	who alone has immortality , dwelling in unapproachable light , whom no man has seen or is able to see , to whom be honor and everlasting power . Amen .
54006017	Command those who are rich in this present age not to be haughty , nor to put their hope on the uncertainty of riches , but in the living God , who provides all things richly for us to enjoy ,
54006018	to do good , to be rich in good works , to be generous , sharing ,
54006019	storing up for yourselves a good foundation for the future , that they may lay hold of eternal life .
54006020	O Timothy ! Guard that which was committed to your trust , turning away from the profane and empty babblings and opposing views of what is falsely called " knowledge , "
54006021	which some , by professing [ expertise , ] missed the mark concerning the faith . Grace be with you . Amen .
55001001	Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God , according to the promise of life which [ is ] in Christ Jesus ,
55001002	To Timothy , [ my ] beloved son : Grace , mercy , and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord .
55001003	I give thanks to God , whom I serve with a pure conscience , as my forefathers did , how unceasingly I have remembrance of you in my prayers night and day ,
55001004	longing to see you , having recalled your tears , that I may be filled with joy ,
55001005	taking recollection of the genuine faith [ that is ] in you , which dwelt first in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice , and I am persuaded is in you also .
55001006	For which cause I remind you to stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands .
55001007	For God has not given us a spirit of fear , but of power and of love and of a sound mind .
55001008	Therefore do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord , nor of me His prisoner , but endure hardship with the gospel according to the power of God ,
55001009	who having saved us , and having called us with a holy calling , not according to our works , but according to His own purpose and grace which was given to us in Christ Jesus before time [ itself ] ,
55001010	but has now been revealed through the appearance of our Savior Jesus Christ , having abolished death on the one hand , [ and ] having brought to life immortality through the gospel on the other ,
55001011	to which I was appointed a herald and apostle , and a teacher of the Gentiles .
55001012	For which cause I also suffer these things ; but I am not ashamed , for I know whom I have believed , and I have been persuaded that He is able to guard that which I have committed to Him until that Day .
55001013	Hold to the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me , in faith and love which are in Christ Jesus .
55001014	That good thing which was committed to you , guard by the Holy Spirit who dwells in us .
55001015	This you know , that all those in Asia have turned away from me , of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes .
55001016	May the Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus , because he often refreshed me , and he was not ashamed of my chain ;
55001017	but when he arrived in Rome , he more diligently sought me out and found [ me ] .
55001018	May the Lord grant to him to find mercy from the Lord in that Day - and you very well know how many ways he served in Ephesus .
55002001	You therefore , my child , be empowered by the grace which is in Christ Jesus .
55002002	And the things which you have heard from me through many witnesses , commit these to faithful men who will be competent to teach others also .
55002003	You therefore endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ .
55002004	No one serving as a soldier entangles [ himself ] in the affairs of [ civilian ] life , in order that he may please the [ one ] having enlisted him .
55002005	And also if anyone competes in athletics , he is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules .
55002006	It is necessary for the hard-working farmer [ to be ] first to receive of the fruits .
55002007	Consider the things I say , and may the Lord give you understanding in all things .
55002008	Remember that Jesus Christ , of the seed of David , was raised from the dead according to my gospel ,
55002009	in which I endure hardship unto chains as an evildoer ; but the word of God is not chained .
55002010	Because of this , I endure all things for the sake of the elect , that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory .
55002011	Faithful is this word : For if we died with [ Him ] , we shall also live with [ Him ] .
55002012	If we endure , we shall also reign with [ Him ] . If we deny [ Him ] , He also will deny us .
55002013	If we are faithless , He remains faithful ; He cannot deny Himself .
55002014	Remind them of these things , charging them before the Lord not to dispute about words , useful for nothing , for the ruin of the hearers .
55002015	Be diligent to show yourself approved unto God , a worker unashamed , rightly dividing the word of truth .
55002016	But shun profane and empty babblings ; for they will advance to more ungodliness .
55002017	And their word will spread like gangrene ; of whom are Hymenaeus and Philetus ,
55002018	who have strayed concerning the truth , asserting that the resurrection has already occurred ; and they overturn the faith of some .
55002019	Nevertheless the firm foundation of God stands , having this seal : " The Lord knows those that are His , " and , " Let everyone naming the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness . "
55002020	Now in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver , but also of wood and clay , some for honor and some for dishonor .
55002021	Therefore if anyone cleanses himself from the [ latter ] , he will be a vessel for honor , having been consecrated and useful to the Master , having been prepared for every good work .
55002022	Flee youthful lusts ; but pursue righteousness , faith , love , peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart .
55002023	But reject foolish and ignorant disputes , knowing that they bring forth fights .
55002024	And a servant of the Lord ought not to fight , but to be gentle to all , skillful at teaching , forbearing ,
55002025	in meekness instructing those that oppose , if God perhaps may give them repentance , to a full knowledge of the truth ,
55002026	and they regain their senses [ and escape ] out of the snare of the devil , having been captured alive by him to do his will .
55003001	But know this , that in the last days perilous times shall come .
55003002	For men will be lovers of themselves , lovers of money , boasters , proud , blasphemers , disobedient to parents , unthankful , unholy ,
55003003	unloving , unforgiving , slanderers , without self-control , brutal , not loving what is good ,
55003004	traitors , headstrong , having been puffed up , lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God ,
55003005	having a form of godliness but denying its power . And from these people turn away !
55003006	For of these are those [ who ] creep into houses and captivate gullible women having been loaded down with sins , who are led by various lusts ,
55003007	always learning and never being able to come to a full knowledge of the truth .
55003008	And in just the way Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses , thus also these resist the truth : men corrupted in mind , disapproved regarding the faith .
55003009	But they shall not advance further , for their folly shall be manifest to all , as also theirs became .
55003010	You however have carefully followed my doctrine , lifestyle , purpose , faith , patience , love , endurance ,
55003011	persecutions , [ and ] afflictions , which happened to me at Antioch , in Iconium , at Lystra - what persecutions I endured . And out of them all the Lord delivered me .
55003012	Yes , and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will be persecuted .
55003013	But evil men and impostors shall advance worse and worse , deceiving and being deceived .
55003014	But you must continue in the things which you have learned and been assured of , knowing from whom you learned them ,
55003015	and that from childhood you have known the Holy Scriptures , which are able to make you wise to salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus .
55003016	All Scripture is given by inspiration of God , and is profitable for doctrine , for reproof , for correction , for instruction in righteousness ,
55003017	that the man of God may be proficient , having been thoroughly equipped for every good work .
55004001	I charge you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ , who is going to judge the living and the dead in accordance with His appearing and His kingdom :
55004002	preach the word ! Be ready in season and out of season . Reprove , rebuke , exhort , with all patience and teaching .
55004003	For there will be a time when they will not put up with sound doctrine , but according to their own lusts , they will heap up for themselves teachers , tickling their ears ,
55004004	and they will turn their ears away from the truth , and be turned aside to myths .
55004005	You however be watchful in all things , endure hardship , do the work of an evangelist , fulfill your ministry .
55004006	For I am already being poured out [ as a drink offering ] , and the time of my departure has arrived .
55004007	I have fought the good fight . I have finished the race , I have kept the faith .
55004008	Finally , there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness , which the Lord , the righteous Judge , will give to me on that Day , and not only to me , but also to all those who have loved His appearing .
55004009	Be diligent to come to me quickly .
55004010	For Demas has forsaken me , having loved this present world , and traveled to Thessalonica - Crescens to Galatia , Titus to Dalmatia .
55004011	Luke alone is with me . Take Mark , and bring him with you , for he is useful to me for ministry .
55004012	And Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus .
55004013	Bring the cloak which I left with Carpus at Troas when you come - and the books , especially the parchments .
55004014	Alexander the coppersmith did me much harm . May the Lord repay him according to his works ;
55004015	whom you also should guard against , for he has greatly resisted our words .
55004016	At my first defense no one stood with me , but all forsook me . May it not be reckoned to them .
55004017	But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me , so that through me the proclamation might be fulfilled , and all the Gentiles might hear , and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion .
55004018	And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work and preserve me for His heavenly kingdom . To Him [ be ] glory forever and ever . Amen !
55004019	Greet Prisca and Aquila , and the household of Onesiphorus .
55004020	Erastus stayed in Corinth , but Trophimus I have left in Miletus sick .
55004021	Be diligent to come before winter . Eubulus greets you , as well as Pudens , Linus , Claudia , and all the brothers .
55004022	The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Grace be with you . Amen .
56001001	Paul , a bondservant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ , according to [ the ] faith of the elect of God and [ the ] full knowledge of [ the ] truth which is according to godliness ,
56001002	in hope of eternal life which God , who cannot lie , promised before time [ itself ] ,
56001003	but has in due time manifested His word in a proclamation , [ with ] which I was entrusted according to the command of God our Savior ;
56001004	To Titus , [ my ] own son according to [ our ] common faith : Grace , mercy , and peace from God [ the ] Father and [ the ] Lord Jesus Christ our Savior .
56001005	For this reason I left you behind in Crete , so that you should set in order the things [ ] that are lacking , and you should appoint elders in every city as I commanded you :
56001006	if a man is unimpeachable , the husband of one wife , having faithful children not accused of dissipation or [ who are ] insubordinate .
56001007	For a bishop must be unimpeachable , as God's steward , not self-willed , not quick-tempered , not given to wine , not violent , not greedy for money ,
56001008	but hospitable , loving good , prudent , just , holy , temperate ,
56001009	holding fast to the faithful word as he was taught , that he may be able to exhort by sound doctrine , and to convince those who oppose it .
56001010	For there are also many insubordinate , both idle talkers and deceivers , especially those of the circumcision ,
56001011	whom it is necessary to shut [ their ] mouths , who overturn whole households , teaching things which they ought not , for the sake of dishonest gain .
56001012	There said a certain one of them , a prophet of their own , " Cretans are always liars , evil beasts , idle gluttons . "
56001013	This testimony is true ; for which cause rebuke them sharply , that they may be sound in the faith ,
56001014	not giving heed to Jewish myths and to commands of men turning away from the truth .
56001015	All things indeed are pure to the pure ; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure ; but even their mind and conscience have been defiled .
56001016	They profess to know God , but in their works they deny Him , being abominable , disobedient , and disqualified for every good work .
56002001	But you speak the [ ] things which suit sound doctrine .
56002002	Older men are to be sober , serious , temperate , sound in the faith , in love , in endurance .
56002003	Older women likewise are to be reverent in demeanor , not slanderers , not given to much wine , teaching what is good ,
56002004	so that they may urge the young women to be lovers of their husbands , lovers of their children ,
56002005	temperate , pure , homemakers , good , submitting to their own husbands , lest the word of God be blasphemed .
56002006	Likewise exhort the young men to be sensible ,
56002007	in all respects showing yourself to be a pattern of good works ; in doctrine showing integrity , dignity , incorruptibility ,
56002008	sound speech that cannot be condemned , in order that the [ one ] who is an opponent may be put to shame , having nothing bad to say about us .
56002009	[ Exhort ] bondservants to be subject to their own masters , to be well pleasing in all things , not talking back ,
56002010	not embezzling , but showing good faith , so that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things .
56002011	For the saving grace of God has appeared to all men ,
56002012	teaching us that , denying ungodliness and worldly lusts , we should live soberly , righteously , and godly in the present age ,
56002013	looking for the blessed hope and glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ ,
56002014	who gave Himself for us , that He might redeem us from every lawless deed and purify for Himself a people as [ His ] own possession , zealous for good works .
56002015	Speak these things , exhort and rebuke with all authority . Let no one despise you .
56003001	Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities , to be obedient , to be ready for every good work ,
56003002	to slander no one , to be peaceable , gentle , demonstrating all meekness to all men .
56003003	For we ourselves were also once foolish , disobedient , being deceived , being enslaved to various lusts and pleasures , living in malice and envy , hateful , and hating one another .
56003004	But when the kindness and the love of God our Savior toward man appeared ,
56003005	not by works of righteousness which we did , but according to His mercy He saved us , through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit ,
56003006	whom He poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior ,
56003007	that having been justified by His grace we might become heirs according to the hope of eternal life .
56003008	Faithful is this word , and concerning these things I want you to strongly affirm , so that those who have believed in God may take thought to maintain good works . These things are good and profitable to men .
56003009	But avoid foolish disputes and genealogies , and strifes and legal fights ; for they are unprofitable and futile .
56003010	Reject a divisive man after the first and second admonition ,
56003011	knowing that such a person has been perverted and is sinning , being self-condemned .
56003012	Whenever I shall send Artemas to you , or Tychicus , hasten to come to me at Nicopolis , for I have decided to spend the winter there .
56003013	Speedily send forward Zenas the lawyer and Apollos , in order that they may lack nothing .
56003014	And let our [ people ] also learn to maintain good works , to meet urgent needs , lest they be unfruitful .
56003015	All [ ] who [ are ] with me greet you . Greet those who love us in the faith . Grace be with you all . Amen .
57001001	Paul , a prisoner of Christ Jesus , and Timothy our brother , to Philemon our beloved and fellow worker ,
57001002	to Apphia the beloved , and to Archippus our fellow soldier , and to the church at your house :
57001003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
57001004	I thank my God , always making mention of you in my prayers ,
57001005	hearing of your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints ,
57001006	that the sharing of your faith may become effective in full knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus .
57001007	For we have much thanksgiving and encouragement over your love , because the affections of the saints have been refreshed through you , brother .
57001008	Therefore , having much boldness in Christ to command you what is fitting ,
57001009	rather on account of love I appeal to you - being such a one as Paul , the elder , and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ -
57001010	I appeal to you for my son Onesimus , whose father I became in my imprisonment ,
57001011	who formerly was unprofitable to you , but now is profitable both to you and to me ,
57001012	whom I am sending back . You therefore receive him , that is , my very heart ;
57001013	whom I wished to keep with myself , in order that on your behalf he might serve me in the bonds of the gospel .
57001014	But I wished to do nothing without your consent , in order that your good might not be by necessity , but by [ being ] voluntary .
57001015	For perhaps he was taken away for a time on account of this , in order that you might keep him eternally ,
57001016	no longer as a slave but more than a slave - a beloved brother , especially to me but how much more to you , both in the flesh and in the Lord .
57001017	If then you count me as a partner , receive him as [ you would ] me .
57001018	But if he has wronged you or owes [ anything ] , charge this to me .
57001019	I , Paul , am writing with my own hand . I will repay - lest I say to you that even yourself you owe to me !
57001020	Yes , brother , may I have profit from you in the Lord ; refresh my heart in the Lord .
57001021	Having been persuaded of your obedience , I am writing to you , knowing that you will do even beyond what I say .
57001022	But meanwhile , also prepare for me a guestroom , for I hope that through your prayers I will be graciously given to you .
57001023	Epaphras , my fellow captive in Christ Jesus , greets you ,
57001024	[ as do ] Mark , Aristarchus , Demas , Luke , my fellow workers .
57001025	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
58001001	God , who at various times and in various ways spoke in time past to the fathers by the prophets ,
58001002	has in these last days spoken to us by [ His ] Son , whom He has appointed heir [ of ] all things , through whom also He made the worlds ;
58001003	who being the radiance of His glory and the exact expression of His substance , and upholding all things by the word of His power , when He had by Himself purged our sins , sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high ,
58001004	having become so much better than the angels , as He has inherited a more excellent name than they .
58001005	For to which of the angels did He ever say : " You are My Son , today I have begotten You " ? And again : " I will be a Father to Him , and He shall be a Son to Me " ?
58001006	But when He again brings the firstborn into the world , He says : " Let all the angels of God worship Him . "
58001007	And of the angels He says , " He who makes His angels spirits and His ministers flames of fire . "
58001008	But of the Son [ He says ] : " Your throne , O God , is forever and ever ; the scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your Kingdom .
58001009	You have loved righteousness and hated lawlessness ; therefore God , Your God , has anointed You with the oil of gladness above Your companions . "
58001010	And : " You , LORD , in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth , and the heavens are the work of Your hands .
58001011	They shall perish , but You continue ; and they all shall grow old like a garment ;
58001012	and like a cloak You will roll them up , and they shall be changed . But You are the same , and Your years shall not fail . "
58001013	But to which of the angels has He ever said : " Sit at My right hand , till I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet " ?
58001014	Are they not all ministering spirits being sent out to minister for the sake of those who shall be heirs of salvation ?
58002001	On account of this we must give the more earnest heed to the things we have heard , lest we drift away .
58002002	For if the word which was spoken through angels was confirmed , and every transgression and disobedience received a just retribution ,
58002003	how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation , which in the beginning was spoken by the Lord , and was confirmed to us by those who heard ,
58002004	God also bearing witness both with signs and wonders , with various miracles , and gifts of the Holy Spirit , according to His own will ?
58002005	For He did not subject the world which is to come , concerning which we speak , to angels .
58002006	But someone somewhere testified , saying : " What is man that You are mindful of him , or the son of man that You visit him ?
58002007	You made him a little lower than the angels , You crowned him with glory and honor ,
58002008	You have subjected all things under his feet . " For in subjecting to him all things [ , ] He left nothing not subjected to him . But now we do not yet see all things having been subjected to him .
58002009	But we see Jesus , who was made a little lower than the angels , through the suffering of death , having been crowned with glory and honor , so that by the grace of God , He might taste death for everyone .
58002010	For it was fitting for Him , on account of whom [ are ] all things and through whom [ are ] all things , in bringing many sons to glory , to perfect the Author of their salvation through sufferings .
58002011	For both He who sanctifies and those who are being sanctified are all of one ; for which reason He is not ashamed to call them brothers ,
58002012	saying : " I will declare Your name to My brothers ; in the midst of the congregation I will sing praise to You . "
58002013	And again : " I will put My trust in Him . " And again : " Behold I and the children to whom God has given Me . "
58002014	Therefore since the children have partaken of flesh and blood , He Himself likewise shared in the same things , in order that through death He might destroy the [ one ] having the power of death , that is , the devil ,
58002015	and that He might set free these , as many as by fear of death through all of their lives , were subject to bondage .
58002016	For indeed He does not take hold of angels , but He does take hold of the seed of Abraham .
58002017	Therefore He was obligated to become like His brothers in all [ respects ] , in order that He might become a merciful and faithful High Priest in things [ pertaining ] to God , in order that He might make propitiation for the sins of the people .
58002018	For in that which He Himself has suffered , being tempted , He is able to help those who are tempted .
58003001	Therefore , holy brothers , partakers of the heavenly calling , consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession , Jesus Christ ,
58003002	who is faithful to Him who appointed Him , as Moses also was faithful in all His house .
58003003	For He has been counted worthy of more honor than Moses , inasmuch as He who built the house has more honor than the house .
58003004	For every house is built by someone , but He [ ] who built all things is God .
58003005	And Moses indeed was faithful in all His house as a servant , for a testimony of the things which would be spoken ,
58003006	but Christ [ was faithful ] as a Son over His own house , whose house we are if we hold fast the confidence and the boast of hope firm until [ the ] end .
58003007	Therefore , just as the Holy Spirit says : " Today , if you will hear His voice ,
58003008	Do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion , in the day of trial in the wilderness ,
58003009	Where your fathers tested Me , they tried Me , and saw My works forty years .
58003010	Therefore I was indignant with that generation , and said , ' They go astray in their heart ; and they did not know My ways . '
58003011	So I swore in My wrath , ' They shall not enter My rest . '
58003012	Take heed , brothers , lest there be in any one of you a wicked heart of unbelief in departing from the living God ;
58003013	but encourage yourselves every day , while it is called " Today , " lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin .
58003014	For we have become partakers of Christ , if indeed we hold fast the beginning of the assurance firm until the end ,
58003015	while it is said : " Today , if you hear His voice , do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion . "
58003016	For some , having heard , did provoke : but not all who came out of Egypt through Moses .
58003017	And with whom was He indignant forty years ? Was it not with those who sinned , whose carcasses fell in the wilderness ?
58003018	And to whom did He swear that they would not enter into His rest , except to those who disobeyed ?
58003019	And we see that they were not able to enter on account of unbelief .
58004001	Therefore let us fear , lest while the promise remains to enter into His rest , any one of you seems to have fallen short .
58004002	For indeed we have had the gospel preached [ to us ] just as those also ; but the word which they heard did not profit those , not having been mixed with faith in those having heard it .
58004003	For we who have believed enter that rest , as He has said : " So I swore in My wrath , they shall not enter My rest , " although His works were finished from the foundation of the world .
58004004	For He has said somewhere concerning the seventh day thus , " And God rested on the seventh day from all His works ; "
58004005	and again in this place : " They shall not enter My rest . "
58004006	Therefore since it remains [ for ] some to enter into it , and those formerly having the gospel preached [ to them ] did not enter on account of disobedience ,
58004007	again He appoints a certain day , saying in David , " Today , " after such a time , just as it has been said : " Today , if you will hear His voice , do not harden your hearts . "
58004008	For if Joshua had given them rest , then He would not have spoken afterward of another day .
58004009	Then there remains a Sabbath rest for the people of God .
58004010	For he who has entered into His rest also rested himself from his works , as God [ did ] from His own .
58004011	Therefore let us be diligent to enter into that rest , lest anyone falls in the same example of disobedience .
58004012	For the word of God is living and active , and sharper than any two-edged sword , piercing even to the division of soul and spirit , and of joints and marrow , and is a discerner of the thoughts and intentions of the heart .
58004013	And there is no creature hidden before Him , but all things are naked and open to His eyes , to whom we must give an account .
58004014	Therefore having a great High Priest who has passed through the heavens , Jesus the Son of God , let us hold fast the confession .
58004015	For we do not have a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses , but having been tempted in all [ respects ] in quite the same way as [ we are ] , yet without sin .
58004016	Therefore let us come boldly to the throne of grace , so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need .
58005001	For every high priest taken from among men is appointed for men in the things pertaining to God , that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins ,
58005002	being able to deal gently with those who sin in ignorance and go astray , since he himself is also subject to weakness .
58005003	On account of this he is obligated to offer [ sacrifices ] for sins , just as concerning the people , so also concerning himself .
58005004	And no man takes this honor for himself , but he that is called by God , just as Aaron also [ was ] .
58005005	So also Christ did not glorify Himself to become High Priest , but it was He who said to Him : " You are My Son , Today I have begotten You . "
58005006	Just as He also says in another place : " You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek " ;
58005007	who , in the days of His flesh , when He had offered up both prayers and supplications , with strong crying and tears to the [ One ] who was able to save Him from death , and was heard because of His fear of God ,
58005008	though He was a Son , He learned obedience by the things which He suffered .
58005009	And having been perfected , He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him ,
58005010	having been designated by God a High Priest " according to the order of Melchizedek , "
58005011	concerning whom we have much to say , and it is hard to explain , since you have become sluggish in hearing .
58005012	For indeed , although you ought to be teachers by this time , again you have need [ for someone ] to teach you what are the elements of the beginning of the oracles of God ; and you have come to need milk and not solid food .
58005013	For everyone who partakes [ only ] of milk is unacquainted with the word of righteousness , for he is an infant .
58005014	But solid food is for the mature , for those because of their practice have their senses trained for the distinguishing of both good and evil .
58006001	Therefore , leaving the subject of the beginning of Christ , let us be moved to perfection , not again laying down a foundation of repentance from dead works and of faith toward God ,
58006002	of the doctrine of baptisms , of laying on of hands , and of resurrection of the dead , and of eternal judgment .
58006003	And let us do this if indeed God permits .
58006004	For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened , and have tasted of the heavenly gift , and became partakers of the Holy Spirit ,
58006005	and have tasted the good word of God and [ the ] powerful deeds of the age to come ,
58006006	and having fallen away , to renew [ them ] again to repentance , since they crucify again for themselves the Son of God , and hold Him up to contempt .
58006007	For the earth which drinks the rain often coming upon it , and bears suitable vegetation for those on account of whom it is cultivated , receives a blessing from God ;
58006008	but if it bears thorns and thistles , it is worthless and near to being cursed , of which the end [ is ] for burning .
58006009	But we are persuaded concerning you , beloved , of better things and those pertaining to salvation , even though we speak in this manner .
58006010	For God is not unjust to forget your work and labor of love which you have shown toward His name , in that you have ministered to the saints , and do minister .
58006011	But we desire that each one of you show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope until [ the ] end ,
58006012	lest you become dull , but [ become ] imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises .
58006013	For when God made a promise to Abraham , since He could swear by no one greater , He swore by Himself ,
58006014	saying , " Surely blessing I will bless you , and multiplying I will multiply you . "
58006015	And so , after he had been patient , he obtained the promise .
58006016	For men indeed swear by the greater , and the oath for confirmation [ is ] an end of every dispute to them .
58006017	Thus God , wanting to show even more clearly to the heirs of the promise the unchangeableness of His counsel , guaranteed it by an oath ,
58006018	in order that through two unchangeable things , in which it is impossible for God to lie , we might have strong encouragement , who have fled to take hold of the hope being set before [ us ] ;
58006019	which [ hope ] we have as an anchor of the soul , both sure and secure , and which enters into the inner [ side ] of the veil ,
58006020	where the Forerunner has entered on our behalf , [ even ] Jesus , having become a High Priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek .
58007001	For this Melchizedek , king of Salem , priest of the Most High God , who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him ,
58007002	to whom also Abraham divided a tenth from all , first being interpreted " king of righteousness , " and then also king of Salem , which is " king of peace , "
58007003	without father , without mother , without genealogy , having neither beginning of days nor end of life , but having been made like the Son of God , remains a priest continually .
58007004	But observe how great this [ man was ] , to whom even the patriarch Abraham gave a tenth of the spoils .
58007005	And indeed those who are of the sons of Levi , who receive the priesthood , have a commandment to collect tithes from the people according to the law , that is , from their brothers , though they have come from the loins of Abraham ;
58007006	but the [ one ] not tracing his descent from them has received tithes from Abraham , and he has blessed the [ one ] having the promises .
58007007	Now without any contradiction the lesser is blessed by the better .
58007008	And here on the one hand mortal men receive tithes , but there on the other he [ receives them ] , of whom [ ] it is witnessed that he lives .
58007009	Even Levi , the [ one ] receiving tithes , has paid tithes through Abraham , so to speak ,
58007010	for he was still in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him .
58007011	Therefore , if perfection was through the Levitical priesthood ( for under it the people have received the law ) , why is there yet a need [ for ] another priest to rise , according to the order of Melchizedek , and not to be called according to the order of Aaron ?
58007012	For the priesthood being changed , of necessity there occurs a change of law also .
58007013	For He concerning whom these things are spoken belongs to another tribe , from which no one has officiated at the altar .
58007014	For it is evident that our Lord has risen out of Judah , regarding which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood .
58007015	And it is yet even more clearer , if according to the likeness of Melchizedek , there arises another priest
58007016	who has come , not according to the law of a fleshly commandment , but according to the power of an endless life .
58007017	For He testifies : " You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek . "
58007018	For on the one hand an annulment comes about of the preceding commandment on account of its weakness and uselessness .
58007019	For the law made nothing perfect ; but there [ is ] the bringing in of a better hope , through which we draw near to God .
58007020	And inasmuch as [ it was ] not without an oath ,
58007021	for they have become priests without an oath , but He with an oath by Him that said to Him : " The LORD has sworn and will not relent , ' You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek ' " ,
58007022	by so much more Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant .
58007023	Also there were many priests , because they were prevented by death from continuing .
58007024	But He , because He remains forever , has an unchangeable priesthood .
58007025	Therefore He is also able to save to the uttermost those coming to God through Him , since He always lives to make intercession for them .
58007026	For such a High Priest was fitting for us , who is holy , innocent , undefiled , having been separated from sinners , and has become higher than the heavens ;
58007027	who does not need daily , as those high priests , to offer up sacrifices beforehand , on behalf of His own sins and then for the people's , for this He did once for all when He offered up Himself .
58007028	For the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness , but the word of the oath , which came after the law , [ appoints ] a Son who has been perfected forever .
58008001	Now this is the main point of the things being said : We have such a High Priest , who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens ,
58008002	a Minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord set up , and not man .
58008003	For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices ; therefore it is necessary that this [ high priest ] also have something to offer .
58008004	For if He were on earth , He would not be a priest , since there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law ;
58008005	who serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things , just as Moses had been warned when he was about to complete the tabernacle , for He says , " See , you shall make all things according to the pattern shown to you on the mountain . "
58008006	But now He has obtained a more excellent ministry , inasmuch as He is also Mediator of a better covenant , which has been enacted upon better promises .
58008007	For if that first [ covenant ] had been faultless , then no place would have been sought for a second .
58008008	For finding fault [ with ] them , He says : " Behold , the days are coming , says the LORD , when I will establish a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah ,
58008009	not according to the covenant which I made with their fathers , in the day when I took their hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt . Because they did not persevere in My covenant , and I disregarded them , says the LORD .
58008010	For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days , says the LORD : I will put My laws in their mind , and I will inscribe them upon their hearts ; and I will be their God , and they shall be My people .
